loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is a thirty-four-year-old widowed lady living together with her three children who are all still in school. She a hardworking woman who wants to ensure that her family state improves. She owns a food stall where she prepares and sells meals to her customers. She has been doing this for some years and thanks to her determination, she has managed to keep it going for all this time. She is very hard-working and, above all, very enterprising and responsible. She achieves all her goals. Her dream is for her business to flourish and to increase her income, so she can improve her and her family's quality of life. With this in mind, she has applied for a loan from Yehu to invest in her food stall by buying merchandise wholesale such as eggs, sugar, rice, beans, detergent, coffee, milk and more to reduce operating costs hence enable her to achieve her dream of improving her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her stall

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame sells food stuffs and vegetables in Enyinase near Elmina. Maame has received no formal education.  She is a widow and has four children. Maame has been selling food stuffs and vegetables for the past 40 years. She is responsible for paying her own personal expenses and helping support her children too. Her loan will be used to buy a greater quantity and variety of food stuffs and vegetables to sell in the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her food selling trade.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of food stuffs and vegetables to sell in the market.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is a mother of four children. She is 31 years old and sells different items in her boutique. She wants this loan to add more items in her store to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Alphred Thomas

texts.en:
Alphred Thomas is 33 years old. He sells different electronic items. He has been in the business for more than 15 years. 

With the loan, he will buy TVs and decoders to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build savings.

loans.use: To buy more TVs and decoders to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her stall.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 33 years old. She sells both soft and alcoholic drinks. She has been running her business for five years. She wants a loan to buy more local brews that are most wanted by her clients. The profits from the business are meant for savings as well as for providing food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more local brews for sale.

loans.name: Gilmer Joel

texts.es: Gilmer, tiene 31 años de edad, casado. Tiene 3 hijos y vive en una colonia que pertenece al municipio de Villanueva, Cortes. Hace 6 años que Gilmer estableció su propio negocio de llantera, donde repara todo tipo de llantas para vehículos, también vende materiales como neumáticos, rines, parches etc. este taller de reparación lo tiene establecido en un local alquilado. El préstamo que solicita es por 14,000 lempiras y es el segundo ciclo con ODEF, el cual lo va invertir en la compra de llantas, neumáticos, parches, rines para repararlas y vender, y brindar un mejor servicio al cliente. Su meta es seguir trabajando para lograr obtener un local propio y mejorar las condiciones del taller, comprar maquinaria y herramientas que no tiene.
texts.en:
Gilmer is 31 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in a neighborhood in the town of Villanueva, Cortes. Six years ago, he established his own tire shop. He repairs tires for all types of vehicles. Gilmer also sells products such as tires, rims, patches, and other items. His repair shop is located in a rented location.

The loan he is requesting is in the amount of 14,000 HNL and this is his second loan cycle with ODEF. He will invest the money in the purchase of wheels, tires, patches, and rims that he can use for repairs or sell. This will enable him to provide better service to his customers. His goal is to continue working so that he can obtain his own shop and improve the condition of his business. He also wants to buy machinery and equipment that he does not have.

loans.use: to buy wheels, tires, patches, and rims.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells homemade liquid soap in Enyinase, near Elmina. Ekua has received no formal education. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua has been selling liquid soap for five years now. She is responsible for helping her husband cover their family's general expenses. Ekua will use this loan to purchase more supplies, such as palm oil, perfumes and lye, needed to make liquid soap for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to improve her soap selling enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies, such as palm oil, perfumes and lye, needed to make liquid soap for sale.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is 26 years old. He is married with one child, age two. His wife is unemployed. He works as a computer specialist. He wants this loan to buy more computer accessories to sell. He plans to make more savings with the profits from the business.

loans.use: To buy more computer accessories for sale.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. Due to his passion to have a stable financial status, he started a produce business ten years ago. He has been able to build rental houses to supplement his produce business, and he also has continued to farm. He dreams of educating his children and buying a vehicle. Weather and bad roads affect his business. Lawrence intends to use this loan to buy cassava, beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava, beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell in the market.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is single and has no children. She has received no formal education. Abigail sells homemade liquid soap in Enyinase near Elmina, which she has done for two years. Abigail uses her income to support herself and pay all her own expenses. Abigail will use the loan to purchase more necessary supplies, such as palm oils, perfumes, and lye to make liquid soap for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abigail plans to improve her soap selling enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies such as palm oils, perfumes, and lye to make liquid soap to sell

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en: Jean De Dieu is 24 years old and single. He sells computer accessories. He would like to get this loan to buy more accessories for sale. With the profits from the business, he will provide food for his family.

loans.use: to buy more computer accessories for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has 2 children. She has received no formal education. 

Elizabeth sells fruits and vegetables in Enyinase near Elmina, which she has done for 4 years now. Her husband is a farmer. 

Elizabeth uses her income to help her husband pay for their family's general expenses and their children’s school fees. 

Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to expand her fruit and vegetable selling business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William used the previous loan to buy cattle. He is a 50-year-old married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been rearing cattle for the past 10 years. He started by farming crops and after selling his proceeds he diversified into rearing cattle. Price fluctuations for milk and unpredictable seasonal weather affect his business. He would like to support his children's education and expand his business to new markets. William is requesting a loan to buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru: Елена занимается выращиваение овощей в теплицах. Благодаря предыдущему кредиту она смогла построить две дополнительных теплицы. К сожалению, семена, которые предназначались для этих теплиц, плохо взошли и теплицы остались ждать сделующего года. На деньги полученные с летнего урожая с основных теплиц Елена купила дополнительный участок земли и теперь планирует посторить там еще три теплицы. Для этого ей нужен кредит в размере 20,000 гривен. Елена очень активна и предприимчива и стремиться не останавливаться на достигнутом, но постоянно расширять свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Yelena cultivates vegetables in greenhouses.  Thanks to her previous loan, she was able to build two additional greenhouses.  Unfortunately, the seeds that were supposed to be planted in these greenhouses did not germinate well and the greenhouses were not used until the next year.  

With the money that Yelena made from the summer harvest in her main greenhouses, Elena bought an additional plot of land, on which she is planning to build three more greenhouses. To do so, she needs a loan of 20,000 hryvnia.  Yelena is very active and enterprising, and she always strives to go beyond what she has already achieved in order to constantly expand her business.

loans.use: to build greenhouses on a new plot of land.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells banku (a ground corn and cassava dough eaten with a variety of different soups and sauces) in Enyinase near Elmina. Efua has received no formal education.  She is single and has four children. Efua has been selling banku for the past five years now. She is responsible for paying her family's expenses alone. Her loan will be used to buy more corn and cassava to prepare banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her banku-making enterprise and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more corn and cassava to prepare banku for sale.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a married man, age 32, with six children between the ages of 13 and 1 living in Kagadi, Uganda. He owns a retail shop where he sells shoes. He has been in this business for four years. He is also a politician who represents his local area in the district. He is currently building a residential house for his family. Inadequate capital is a major challenge to his business. Lawrence intends to use the loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a 40-year old-married man with four children between the ages of 16 and 4 living in Kagadi, Uganda. He owns a carpentry workshop that he started ten years ago, where he makes chairs and beds. He has been able to establish a motorcycle transport business to supplement his business. He dreams of buying a lorry in future. Limited capital is affecting his business growth. Fred intends to use the loan to buy timber for making school desks and beds to sell.

loans.use: to buy timber for making school desks and beds to sell.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal is a 40-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been a primary teacher for fourteen years, works five days a week and nine hours a day, and sells fish to earn extra income. Her inspiration for the profession is derived from the fact that she is employed by the government and is assured of a pension at retirement. She desires to upgrade in her studies and educate her children while her business plan is to own a refrigerated van that can supply fish to different markets. Racheal intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman and has five children. She has received schooling through basic level to junior high school. Rose is a petty trader and a farmer from Akpafu, Hohoe. She has been farming maize and rice for the past five years. She took out a loan to fry doughnuts and hawk them to assist her husband, who is a peasant farmer, pay for their children’s school fees. Rose also uses her income to feed the family. Rose will use this loan to purchase a gallon of oil, flour and margarine and store it for her business. Rose plans to save the new profit from her expanded business and put it back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase a gallon of oil, flour and margarine and store it for her doughnut making business.

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna is a 42-year-old mother of two daughters. She lives in Yerevan with her family.

Zhanna teaches English to children. Her elder daughter Lilit (in the photo) is a student at Yerevan State University. She is in her first course, in the Faculty of Armenian Philology. Zhanna and her husband work hard to sustain their family, but it is very difficult for them to save money for Lilit's education. So Zhanna has applied for this loan to pay for her daughter’s university tuition. 

The loan is very important for this family. Lilit dreams of completing her education and becoming a good teacher like her mother.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Solange

texts.en: Solange is 22 years old and married with two children who are between 2 and 4 years old. She sells fresh milk and has been doing this business for almost two years. With the loan, she wants to add more fresh milk, andazi, and cakes for sale. With the profits from the business, she will pay for her oldest child's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more fresh milk, andazi and cakes to sell

loans.name: Edra

texts.en: Edra is married with four children. All of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother and sisters). She has a business selling and frying chips. She has been in this business for nine years selling to all categories of people. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of Irish potatoes and cooking oil. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to open up another branch in the market selling chips and soft drinks. She resides in a rented house and her family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of Irish potatoes and cooking oil

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married with three children. All her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business and home and feeding the family.

Juliet has a retail shop selling sugar, soap and cartons of salt. She has been in this business for two years. She generates additional income by making and selling necklaces. Her major business challenges include thieves, transportation and defaulting.

Juliet has applied for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. She hopes to become a wholesaler, to own a delivery van to help with transportation, and to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high school level. Araba sells vegetables in Enyinase near Elmina, which she has done for four years now. Her husband is a driver. Araba uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. 

Araba will use the loan to purchase a greater quantity of vegetables for sale in the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to grow her vegetable-selling business.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of vegetables for sale in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drugs to fill the shelves and make more profit.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is married and has three children. She has received schooling to a junior high school level. Dorothy is a petty trader at Akpafu, Hohoe, who deals in plastic bowls and sponges. She has done this since 2009. Her husband is into carpentry. Dorothy uses her income to assist her husband to care for their 3 children. Dorothy will use the loan to purchase more plastic bowls, buckets and bottles to enable her to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Dorothy plans to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls, buckets and bottles to enable her to expand her business.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is divorced and has one child. He has received schooling to middle school level. Nicholas is into photography in Akpafu, Hohoe. He has been doing this for seven years. Nicholas uses his income to care for his son and his parents. Nicholas will use this loan to purchase a new camera. Nicholas plans to save the new profits from his expanded business and open a studio in the future. He also wants to open a charcoal business to make more profit for his child’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a new camera.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for the preparation of food at her chop bar.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married and has four children. She has received schooling to only the middle school level and could not continue again due to financial difficulties, so she decided to learn how to sew. Rose is a seamstress at Akpafu, Hohoe, which she has been doing for the past two years. Her husband is a farmer. Rose uses her income to pay to help her husband look after the home. Rose will use the loan to purchase linen, zippers, and thread for her sewing and trade-in cloth business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to save for expansion work at her shop and also own an electric sewing machine one day.

loans.use: to purchase linen, zippers, and thread for her sewing and trade-in cloth business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for the preparation of food for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cartons of fish for sale.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo, de 45 años, es un hombre trabajador y responsable, esta casado con Sara ya por varios años con quien tiene cuatro hijos de 12, 07, 03 años y el último de 09 meses con quienes vive en su casa propia y son la razón de trabajo ya que desea darles una mejor calidad de vida.
EL trabajo de Guillermo como actividad principal consiste en la siembra de diferentes hortalizas. También se dedica a la  reparación de motores electrógenos, motos, maquinarias pesadas y otros, el hace su trabajo de forma delivery va a donde le llamen y a la hora que lo soliciten, lleva haciendo este trabajo por más 12 años, es muy bueno en lo que hace y es por eso que siempre le llaman para solucionar los problemas de las maquinas de sus clientes.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que genera ingresos para su hogar,  además de tener un horario que el mimo maneja, lo que no le gusta es que a veces le llaman en horas no apropiadas, pero como son clientes que pagan bien por sus servicios el siempre va en busca de solucionar el problema. Espera poder mas adelante seguir trabajando como hasta ahora ya que se siente cómodo con el trabajo que realiza. Este  será el préstamo número 06 con la institución MFP, por ello solicita de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Se siente muy bien con el grupo al que pertenece, y esta muy agradecida con la institución por que le dan la oportunidad de poder crecer junto a su familia.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 nuevos soles comprará semillas, abonos para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Guillermo, age 45, is a hardworking and responsible man. He has been married to Sara for many years and they have four children (ages 12, 7, 3, and 9 months). They live in their own home. Guillermo wants to provide his family a better quality of life, so this is the reason why he works. His main business activity consists of growing different vegetables. He also repairs motors for electric generators, motorcycles, heavy machinery, and other types of equipment. Guillermo performs his work on-site, so he must travel whenever his customers call him and arrive at the time that they request. He has been in this line of work for more than 12 years and is very good at what he does. For this reason, he is always called upon to solve the problems related to his customers’ equipment.

What he enjoys most about his job is being able to generate household income. He also has a schedule that he can manage, but sometimes he receives calls at inappropriate times. Since his customers pay him well for his services, he is always willing to find solutions to their problems. Going forward, he hopes to continue working in the same manner as he is doing now because he feels comfortable in his profession.

This is his sixth loan with the MFP organization. Guillermo is requesting assistance so that he can carry out his plans. He feels very good about being a member of his group and is grateful to MFP for giving him the opportunity to grow with his family. The amount of 1,000 PEN that he requested will be used to buy seeds and compost for planting his crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina sells provisions at Santrokofi, Hohoe. Paulina has received a middle school level of education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a teacher. Paulina has been selling provisions for two years. She is responsible for assisting her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy cartons of biscuits, drinks and a bag of rice. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, drinks and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase groundnut and produce the paste herself

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bag of maize, sugar and cups since her porridge customers have increased.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is married and has three children. She has received no formal education. Irene sells fish at Santrokofi, Hohoe, which she has for three years. Her husband is a chain saw operator. Irene uses her income to assist in paying the basic bills of the home. Irene will use the loan to buy cartons of fish on a cash basis to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Irene plans to save and acquire a deep freezer.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fish to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is married and has five children. She has received schooling through junior high. Mercy sells foodstuffs at Santrokofi, Hohoe, which she has done for 17 years. Her husband is a petty trader. Mercy uses her income to help her spouse to educate their five children. Mercy will use the loan to buy more foodstuffs for sale to increase her profit for expansion. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mercy plans to save for her old age.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su séptimo ciclo. Podemos decir que el grupo es muy responsable, todas las integrantes tienen actividades. La Sra. Graciela es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a varias actividades como por ejemplo, venta de comidas, de ropa los fines de semana. Ella es una madre soltera que mantiene a sus hijos con su trabajo. En pocas palabras podemos que es un ejemplo para las demás integrantes.
La Sra. Graciela lucha por sus hijos, ya que quiere darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener, y que el día de mañana sean personas de bien.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar prendas, las cuales venderá y seguirá trabajando y saliendo adelante. Esta muy agradecida por esta oportunidad que recibe, que le ayudara a poder crecer.
texts.en:
This existing committee is in its seventh loan cycle. They are able to say that they are a very responsible group since all of the members have business activities.

Sra. Graciela is one of the members. She engages in several activities, such as preparing food and selling clothes on the weekends. Graciela is a single mother who supports her children through her work. In a few words, one could say that she is an example for the other members. Sra. Graciela strives on behalf of her children because she wants to give them everything that she did not have. One day she hopes that they will become good people.

Graciela is requesting a loan so that she can buy articles of clothing to sell. This will enable her to continue working and moving forward. She is very grateful for the opportunity that she has received since it will help her to grow.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Kadek

texts.en:
Kadek is a Balinese artisan who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of silver and natural gemstones to increase production.

Kadek has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

"I was born into the world of jewelry-making. My parents and most people in my neighborhood are silversmiths. My parents used to say, if you make something, don't use only your hands but also all of your heart. This way everything you make will have spirit. I really want to reach success in life, especially in silver jewelry, because I want to continue the family tradition and also be able to support my youngest brother's education. He is still in secondary school and I want him to get a better education than I did."

"Thank you so much for this micro-credit, because it will make it possible for me to increase the capacity of my jewelry production. It is an opportunity to make more space for creation, and it will also make it possible for me to invite other silversmiths to join my workshop. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Kadek's silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5917

loans.use: to purchase silver and natural gemstones

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is married and has two children. She has received schooling through the middle school level. Vida sells food stuffs at Santrokofi, Hohoe, which she has been doing for 15 years. Her husband is a farmer. Vida uses her income to help her husband pay for their children's school fees. Vida will use the loan to expand her capital base so she can buy food stuff on a cash basis instead of credit for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vida plans to save to acquire a property for herself.

loans.use: to expand her capital base so she can buy food stuff on cash basis instead of credit for resale.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en: Getrude sells local food like kinkey and wakye, at Santrokofi, Hohoe. Getrude has received a middle school level of education. She is divorced and has four children. Getrude has been selling cooked food for 20 years. She is responsible for paying the expenses of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more food stuffs for the preparation of food for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save for her business.

loans.use: to buy more food stuffs for the preparation of food for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloth in bulk to make clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice and oil to prepare traditional Ghanaian dishes to sell

loans.name: Manzanita Group

texts.es:
l comite Manzanita se destaca por la unidad y el deseo de progresar como grupo, ellas trabajan unidas y se ayudan las unas a las otras. Una miembro es la Sra. Marina quien es una Ama de Casa, pero quiere empezar un nuevo trabajo, que es la venta de cosméticos, es una persona con muchas ganas de crecer y ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar cosméticos y así empezar su emprendimiento.
Este muy agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que podrá generar mayores ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia, y así sentirse útil.
texts.en:
The committee named “Manzanita” is known for its unity and the desire of its members to make progress as a group. They work together so that they can help one another.

One of its members, Sra. Marina, is a homemaker. However, she wants to start a new business of selling cosmetics. Marina is a person who has the desire to grow and help her family.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy cosmetics in order to start her business. Marina is very grateful for the opportunity she has received since it will allow her to generate more income to help her family. Therefore, she feels the loan will be useful.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Komang

texts.en:
Komang is an Indonesian artisan who specializes in handcrafted silver and gemstone jewelry. He would like to purchase larger quantities of silver and gemstones to increase production.

Komang has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"I was born in Celuk, renowned as the birthplace of silversmiths. When I was 10 years old, my parents, who are master silversmiths, told me to learn about making jewelry because someday, when I got older, I'd be able to make a living from this skill. I enjoyed creating new designs for my parents. I like drawing and I came up with a variety of jewelry designs. I even earned some money with this. I love this job! The nicest part of my jewelry is the uniqueness of its style. Although it shows an ethnic influence, it's different."

"I am new to Novica, and I'm really excited about creating more new designs. I'm really happy to receive the micro-credit, too, because this can help me replenish my stock and also — little by little — help me to develop new creations. I know it will work and, with time, my sales will increase. Thank you so much for your support, and for purchasing my jewelry. Please know that you are a part of the success I'm working toward. Thank you!"

Use the link below to view Komang's sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8459

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of silver and gemstones to increase production

loans.name: Mujeres Chimaltecas Group

texts.en:
“Buena Vista” is a small community just outside of the Department of Chimaltenango. Seven enthusiastic women, who are good friends and neighbors, are members of the Trust bank called “Mujeres Chimaltecas’.

The President of the Trust Bank is 44-year-old Maria Josefina. She is married with four children. Her husband works in construction. The couple is really pleased that they have been able to send their children to school. Two of their children have completed high school while the other two are in 5th and 9th grade. They have high hopes for each of them.

For many years, Maria Josefina worked as a street vendor selling food. A few years ago, she took a real step up when she contacted the manager of a nearby clothing store in hopes that she could sell her food there. Now, Maria Josefina is thrilled to have 100 regular customers who she serves daily meals to from Monday through Friday. She rises early to prepare for each day’s meals. Her hard work has paid off and she can count on a fixed monthly income. Her ultimate goal is to be self-sustaining and not in need of a loan.

Maria Josefina, as well as the other women in her Trust Bank, appreciates the financial support that generous people from other countries give them. In addition, they are happy with the informative trainings that Friendship Bridge provides on relevant topics like budgeting, business management, customer service, women’s health, self-esteem and children’s rights. The combination of a loan and education enables these women to move forward, creating a better life for themselves, their families and their communities.

loans.use: to buy cooking stuff

loans.name: Elías Omar

texts.es:
Elías tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero, vive junto a sus padres y un hermano de diez años. Él se ha dedicado a ayudar a su padre con las labores agrícolas; pero desde hace seis meses inicio a trabajar en la Fuerza Armada del país. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es  para comprar madera y lamina, para cambiarle el techo a la casa, ya que el que tiene esta dañado y en el invierno se filtra el agua. Su propósito, es continuar siendo miembro de la Fuerza Armada y con sus ingresos ir mejorando poco a poco su casa.
texts.en:
Elías is 20 years old, single, and lives with his parents and his 10-year-old brother. He had been helping his parents with their farm work, but six months ago he began working for the National Armed Forces.

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy wood and metal sheets for replacing the roof of his house, which is damaged and leaks during the winter. His goal is to continue as a member of the Armed Forces and use his income to gradually make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to buy wood and metal sheeting for replacing the roof of his house.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр занимается выращиванием овощей в теплицах. Благодяря предыдущему кредиту он подготовил существующие теплицы к сезону и установил отопление. Хотя урожай у Александра был хорошим, прошлый год принес ему несколько трудностей. 

В прошлом году Александр планировал приобрести землю, отдал аванс, но сделка не получилось, поэтому особого развития не было. Теща Александра отдала ему свой участок земли, на котором есть большая теплица и ему пока достаточно. Также зимой в прошлом году в гололед Александр не справился с управлением и его машина врезалась в дерево. Пришлось ее продать. Через время приобрел другое авто, не новое, но оно оказалось даже лучше старого.

В этот раз Александр просит предоставить ему кредит на закупку пленки, семян и удобрений. Конкретных планов на будущее пока что нет. Александр хочет вырастить и продать хороший урожай, а уже потом строить планы на развитие.
texts.en:
Alexander cultivates vegetables in greenhouses.  His previous loan allowed him to prepare his existing greenhouses for the season and to install a heating system.  Although last year brought a good harvest, it also came with its share of difficulties.  Alexander had planned to purchase some land for which he had paid an advance of money, but the transaction fell through, so his business did not particularly grow.  His mother-in-law then gave him her own plot of land with a large greenhouse, which Alexander feels is sufficient for him at the moment.  

Last winter, he also lost control of his car while driving in icy conditions, so he crashed into a tree.  He had to sell his car.  He bought another, second-hand car, which actually turned out to be better than his old one.

Alexander is now requesting a loan to buy plastic sheeting, seeds and fertilizers.  At the moment, he has no specific plans for the future.  He first wants to produce and sell a good harvest; then he will make plans for the development of his business.

loans.use: to buy plastic sheeting, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es:
La señora Luisa Amanda, es madre soltera de seis  hijos y se dedica a la venta de plásticos de forma ambulante en la ciudad de Chinandega, desde hace diecisiete  años, este trabajo lo realiza para llevar el sustento a su familia, sale de su casa a las 5:00 inicia a ofertar  sus productos  a las 6:00 am finalizando hasta las 5:00 pm en este mismo horario de lunes a sábado.

El crédito que esta solicitado a Ceprodel será utilizado para Comprar al por mayor producto plástico tal como: termos,  panas, baldes, platos, tazas  y así tener mayor ganancia y lograr a realizar mejora a su humilde vivienda para brindarle  mejores  condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Luisa Amanda is a single mother with six children. She has been selling plastic goods as a street vendor in the city of Chinandega for the past 17 years. This line of work enables her to support her family. Luisa leaves her house at 5:00 A.M. so that she can begin offering products at 6:00 A.M. She finishes her work at 5:00 P.M. and repeats the same schedule Monday through Saturday.

The loan she is requesting from CEPRODEL will be used to buy plastic goods in bulk such as thermal containers, bowls, buckets, plates, and cups. As a result, she will have more income and be able to make improvements to her humble home so that she can provide better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to buy thermal containers, bowls, buckets, plates, and cups.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth tiene un hijo, vive en anticrético ocupando una habitación con un acabado fino y piso de machimbre, también cuenta con una cocina, baño, comedor y sala, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Escobar Uria de la ciudad de La Paz.

Elizabeth trabaja de forma independiente realizando dos actividades como ser: peinados y tejidos a croché ya que ella sola corre con los gastos de alimentación, servicios básicos, vestimenta de su familia.

El crédito lo requiere para la compra de implementos para su negocio de peluquera, como ser un par de tijeras nuevas, otra secadora de pelo, una rasuradora electrica para hacer crecer su negocio.

El sueño de Elizabeth, es mejorar sus ingresos económicos para mejorar su calidad de vida y así tener una salón de belleza ya que actualmente peina a domicilio.

Es la primera vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Elizabeth has a son and lives in a rental property that contains one room with fine finishes and a wooden plank floor. Her home also has a kitchen, a bathroom, a dining room, and a living room. The house is located in the District of Escobar Uria in the city of La Paz.

Elizabeth works independently in two business activities: giving haircuts and making crochet items. She alone handles the expenses such as food, basic services, and clothing for her family.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy equipment for her hair salon, such as a pair of new scissors, another hair dryer, and an electric razor so that she can grow her business. Elizabeth’s dream is to earn more income so that she can improve her quality of life and acquire a location for her beauty salon. She currently provides haircuts out of her home.

This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy scissors, a hair dryer, and an electric razor.

loans.name: Fiave

texts.en:
Fiave is married and has one child. She has received schooling through junior high school. 

Fiave is a seamstress in Kolenu near Hohoe, where she has worked for the last four years. Her husband is a petty trader in the area. Fiave uses her income to support her husband and pay her child’s school fees. 

Fiave will use the loan to purchase and sell cosmetic products that are popular among her clients. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fiave plans to save to acquire an electric sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase and sell cosmetic products that are popular among her clients.

loans.name: Ana Gabriela

texts.es:
La Joven Ana Gabriela,  se dedica a  trabajar como contador en una institución de la Ciudad de León, sale de su casa de habitación 7:30 am inicia sus labores 8:00 am  finalizando  a las 5:00 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes, realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento diario de su pequeña Hija.

La Joven solicita un crédito a Ceprodel el que será  utilizado para pago de tesis, de su carrera universitaria el cual le ayudara a culminar sus estudios profesionales permitiéndole así mejorar su calidad de vida tanto de ella como el de su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Ana Gabriela is a young woman who works as an accountant for an institution in the city of León. She leaves her house at 7:30 A.M. so that she can start her job at 8:00 A.M. Ana finishes work at 5:00 P.M. and then repeats this same schedule Monday through Friday. Her job enables her to provide for the daily needs of her young daughter.

Ana Gabriela is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL so that she can pay for the thesis that is required for her university degree. By finishing her professional studies, she will be able to improve her quality of life and that of her young daughter.

loans.use: to pay for her thesis.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase packets of milo and bags of sugar as well as other staples to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude sells provision in Kolenu, near Hohoe. Getrude has received a middle school level education.  She is divorced and has two children. 

Getrude has been selling provisions for the past two years. She alone, is responsible for paying for the general welfare of her family. 

Her loan will be used to buy a bag of rice, biscuits and other goods to sell at her stand. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bag of rice, biscuits and other good to sell at her stand.

loans.name: Jamirah

texts.en:
Jamirah is 34 years old and a hard-working woman with three children living in Kasese Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children up to University. 

She has been dealing in phones and accessories for the last three years and the business is very lucrative. Her major hardship is inadequate capital to meet the demand, while her dream is to hire employees to help expand her business. 

Jamirah intends to use the loan to buy phones to sell.

loans.use: to buy phones to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more maize and cassava for the preparation of banku to sell in the market.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence sells banku (a ground corn and cassava dough) in Enyinase near Elmina. Florence has received no formal education. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a contractor. 

Florence has been selling banku for the past seven years. She is responsible for helping support her husband with their family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more maize and cassava for the preparation and sale of banku. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her banku-making enterprise and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more maize and cassava for the preparation and sale of banku.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 35 years old. She is a mother of seven children. Her husband works as a businessman. 

Beatrice sells skirts, shirts and dresses. She has initiated another business in addition to the existing one and she is now involved in selling different types of clothes. 

With the loan, she wants to add more shirts and skirts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase silver bowls.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new construction kit to improve his work

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a 59-year-old man. He is married and a father to four sons and three daughters; two of his sons are workers with low salaries.

For the past fifteen years, Saleh has been working in bicycles sales. These long years of work have given him a good reputation among the buying public, where he has a lot of loyal customers. This makes his project a profitable one, but also in need of more support.

Saleh is requesting a 2,000 USD Green loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a new and modern collection of bicycles. Taking this loan will increase the volume of sales and improve his income positively.

Saleh is photographed inside his store.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of bicycles to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is the president of a women's weaving cooperative named To'ooneel Ixoq, which specializes in weaving accessories and hammocks. They would like to invest in the purchase of more cotton thread to increase production.

Rosario and the women of To'ooneel Ixoq have been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is their story:

"We are a group of hard-working, creative and enterprising women with a desire to improve our lives, our families' lives, and those of our community. Our mothers taught us to weave when we were only little girls, and they also taught us how to dye threads with natural pigments to protect our environment. In fact, that is our specialty – our weaves are done with cotton threads dyed with tree bark, leaves and fruits. We go by the name To'ooneel Ixoq, which in the Tzutujil Maya language means 'Feminine Development.' We are a very united team, and the most beautiful thing about being in this team is that we support each other, and we encourage members to create their own designs. Our dream is to one day have our own store and a community workshop, because at the moment we work from our own homes."

"With this microcredit we will be able to buy a considerable amount of cotton so that we may continue to weave. The more we have to sell benefits our families, and for that we thank you."

Use the link below to view To'ooneel Ixoq's handwoven accessories and hammocks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7339

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of more cotton thread to increase production

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro and his wife and three children are Guatemalan silversmiths specializing in jade and sterling silver jewelry. They would like to invest in the purchase of fine silver to increase production.

Pedro and his family have been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is their story:

"After working for silversmiths for six years, we decided to open our own workshop. We are all involved in the family business. We've developed a good working relationship. Everyone specializes in a different aspect and we complement each others' work."

"We appreciate this microcredit very much, because it will allow us to purchase enough silver to continue working for a good while. This in turn will allow us to invest in more materials and cover the salaries of those collaborating with us at the workshop. Many thanks, and may God bless you."

Use the link below to view Pedro and family's jade and sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7566

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fine silver to increase production

loans.name: Sabri

texts.en:
Sabri is a 36-year-old man who is married and the father of one son and two daughters. He is employed but the low salary he earns is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

For the past one and a half years, Sabri has been raising and selling chicks, which has been a profitable project and a second helper source to the family, but also his project needs more support to cover some necessary costs.

Sabri is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the costs of purchasing more chicks and more fodder to feed them. Taking this loan will enable him to meet his customers' demand and increase his sales, which will increase his income and allow him to offer better living conditions to his family.

Sabri's photo is in the place where he is raising chicks.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and fodder

loans.name: Mosa

texts.en:
Mosa is a 24-year-old single young man. He is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover his daily needs. For the past three years, Mosa has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and a second source of income to him.

Mosa is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new engine for the taxi he drives and making some necessary repairs, such as painting and changing the taxi mats. This will increase the taxi's capacity to work extra hours and enable Mosa to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve his income positively.

Mosa is an ambitious man who is planning to own a new taxi in the future. Mosa appears in the photo.

loans.use: To cover the costs of purchasing a new engine for the taxi and making some repairs

loans.name: Domingo Leonel

texts.es:
El señor Domingo es  soltero tiene un negocio de venta frutas y verduras, tales como plátano, mandarina, naranja, papaya y otras frutas de la temporada,  desde hace 5 años para llevar el sustento a su familia. Empieza su actividad comercial desde las 4 de la mañana y finaliza a las 3 pm. realiza esta labor de  lunes a domingo en este mismo horario. 

Don Domingo utilizara el crédito para la compra de plátanos y diferentes frutas de la época,el apoyo de  ceprodel lograra  satisfacer la demanda de sus clientela.
 
Domingo  es padres de una  hija que está a su cargo y sus sueños son  terminar de realizar mejora a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Domingo is single. For five years he has had a business selling fruits and vegetables, such as bananas, mandarins, oranges, papaya and other seasonal fruits, in order to support his family.  Domingo starts work at 4am and works until 3pm.  He works Monday to Sunday,with the same timetable every day.

Domingo will use this loan to buy bananas and different seasonal fruits.  The support from Ceprodel will allow him to satisfy his customers' demands.

Domingo has a daughter who he takes care of.  His dream is to finish the renovation work on his house.

loans.use: to buy papaya, oranges, watermelons and bananas.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 53 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y optimista, además de alegre y extrovertida. Es separada del padre de sus hijos. Vive en compañía de sus 02 hijos de 25 años y 18  años de edad. Todos juntos habitan una casa que construyó sobre el terreno que le heredó su padre. Juana se dedica a la preparación y venta de comidas al paso, como tallarines, arroz chaufa, pollos broster y otros,  todo lo prepara durante el día, para luego instalar su puesto de venta en el frontis de su casa, en  la noche donde atiende a sus clientes que en su mayoría son vecinos y transeúntes.  Realizando ésta actividad hace más de 20 años y hasta el momento cuenta con la ayuda  de su hermana en la preparación y en la atención a los clientes, dándole un pago diario, de esa manera le apoya con un ingreso económico.
Considera a su negocio rentable por las ganancias que le deja y la buena acogida que tiene.
Le gusta su actividad  porque  le permite contar con un ingreso económico  para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar, además le gusta cocinar, labor que aprendió gracias a su madre quien le enseñó desde muy joven. Por otro lado, no le gusta  el cansancio físico que le ocasiona las largas jornadas que le hacen quedarse hasta muy tarde en las noches para acabar de vender todo  lo que prepara, pero es consiente que es su fuente de ingreso económico y desea continuar.  Por eso tiene planes de renovar sus utensilios de cocina, como también su puesto de venta. Este es el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el crédito concedido, desea seguir contando con más créditos, por eso dice será puntal con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Además de sentirse a gusto con el grupo de su banco comunal, ya que considera a sus miembros ser personas responsable y solidaria.
Con el monto solicitado de 1,000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de madera para el arreglo de su puesto de venta como mesas y sillas. También en la compra de utensilios para cocina como plato, cucharas, tenedores, vaso, entre otros.
texts.en:
Juana, 53, is an optimistic, joyful, outgoing and hardworking woman. She separated from the father of her children, who are 25 and 18 years old and live with her in a house she built in a piece of land she inherited from her father.

Juana cooks and sells food to go, like noodles, chaufa rice and fried chicken. She prepares everything in the morning and afternoon, and in the evening she opens her stall in the front of her house. Her customers are mainly neighbors and pedestrians. She has been doing this for more than twenty years, helped by her sister. In this way, Juana supports her with some daily income.

Juana thinks she runs a profitable business, considering the profits and the acceptance among her customers. She enjoys this line of work because it helps her pay for her home expenses, and because she likes to cook, something she learned from her mother as a young girl. On the other hand, she feels very tired at the end of the day because she has to stay late in order to sell everything she prepares.

However, she is conscious of the importance of the business as a source of income and wants to continue working. For this reason, she is planning to renew her kitchen utensils and her stall. This is her third loan with MFP, and she appreciates the loan she was granted. She would like to continue having this opportunity so she promises to pay in time, just as she has been doing with the previous loans. She feels comfortable working with her communal bank and she considers its members to be responsible and caring people.

With the requested amount, 1000 nuevos soles [PEN], she will buy wood to fix her stall, tables and chairs. She will also buy kitchen utensils such as plates, spoons, forks and glasses.

loans.use: to buy wood to fix her stall, chairs, tables and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Samah is a 45 year old married woman, a housewife and a mother to five children.
Samah's husband has a home products store. He is well known in the market and has many loyal customers, which makes his project a successful and profitable one. He is the only source of income for the family.
Samah wants to help her husband in bringing in a new collection of home products to sell, which will satisfy the customers and increase sales.
Samah is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the cost of purchasing home products.
This will increase Samah's husband’s sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase home products for her husband to sell in his store.

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en:
Ameen is a 30 year old married man and a father to a son. He lives with his family in a small village that is famous for agriculture.
Ameen and his family have been working in agriculture for a long time. He has a greenhouse growing different types of seasonal vegetables, which has been a profitable project and enabled Ameen to open a small store to sell fruits and vegetables.
Ameen is requesting a 1,000 USD Youth Loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing cucumber seedlings to plant in the greenhouse he owns. This will permit Ameen to produce a better crop and thus increase his sales and improve the family's income.
Ameen was picking cucumbers when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy cucumber seedlings to plant in his greenhouse, and thus increase his sales.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 26 year old married man. He lives with his wife in a small village called Hableh, near Qalqilia.
For the past year, Bilal has been raising and selling chicks to customers, which has been a profitable project and is the only source of income for the family.
Bilal is requesting a 1,000 USD Youth Loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing chicks and additional cages.
This will improve Bilal's project by increasing sales and will improve the family's income.
Bilal was photographed in his store.

loans.use: to buy chicks and additional cages for his business.

loans.name: Nidaa

texts.en:
Nidaa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her daughter Zumorrud appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Nidaa is a 41 year old Palestinian woman from a village called Kufr Zebad, near Tulkarem. Nedaa is insisting on having her children complete their university studies despite the bad circumstances. Nidaa needs to pay university installment fees for her daughter, who is studying the Arabic language.
Nidaa is requesting a 2,000 USD education loan from FATEN. This loan will help Nidaa to pay the university fees.
This will ensure a better future for her daughter and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay university fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 31 year old married woman. She and her husband would like to complete the family’s new house and improve the family living conditions. Hiyam lives in medium housing conditions. Her husband works as blacksmith, with a medium income. 
Hiyam took a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing construction materials, such as cement, wood and bricks, that are needed to finish building their new house. This loan will help Hiyam and her husband to improve their standard of living and enjoy living in their new house. 
Hiyam was photographed while she was applying for the loan in Faten’s offices.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials, such as cement, wood and bricks, to complete their new family home.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья - предприниматель из города Никополь. Она торгует обувью и одеждой в небольшом магазинчике. Благодаря предыдущему КИВА кредиту Наталья смогла сделать закупку товара к сезону. Торговля была хорошей и Наталья смогла увеличить свою прибыль.

В связи с тем, что в торговом центре, в котором расположен магазинчик Натальи, проводится реконструкция, возросла арендная плата. Тем не менее дополнительная прибыль помогла Наталье справиться этой трудностью.

Несмотря на то, что Наталья торгует не только обувью, но и одеждой, когда придет весна, то первым делом будут спрашивать обувь. Поэтому Наталья хочет взять кредит, чтобы закупить партию весенней обуви. Благодаря этому она планирует получить дополнительную прибыль с приходом весны.
texts.en:
Natalya is a businesswoman from the town of Nikopol. She sells shoes and clothing in a small store. Thanks to the previous Kiva loan Natalya was able to buy seasonal merchandise. The sales were good and she was able to increase her profit.

The rental cost has increased due to the reconstruction taking place at the trade center where Natalya's store is located. Nevertheless the additional profit has helped Natalya cope with this difficulty.

The shoes will be in high demand with the arrival of spring even though Natalya sells not only shoes but clothing too. This is why she wants to take a loan to buy a batch of shoes for the spring. Thanks to the loan Natalya is planning to get an additional profit with the coming of spring.

loans.use: to buy spring shoes.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 44 years old and married with three children. All of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ruby has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ruby requested a 18000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

Ruby has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Ruby would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Batsuren

texts.en: Mr.Batsuren is 45 years old and lives with his wife and 5 children in a ger in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Ariunaa, is 45 years old and stays home taking care of their children. His daughters Ariuntuya, 16 years old, Ariun-Erdene 8 years old and sons Husel-Erdene, 11 years old and Huchit-Erdene, 7 years old go to the local school and their youngest son Orgil-Erdene, who is 2 stays home with his mother. Batsuren has been working as a furniture carpenter for years and has gained a lot of experience in the local furniture manufacturing company. He is now planning to start his own furniture manufacturing business on their plot of land. He is now requesting a 1'000'000MNT loan to purchase inventory for his new furniture manufacturing business. He is hardworking and a diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his new furniture manufacturing business.

loans.name: Nicky

texts.en: Nicky is 33 years old and married with 2 children, ages 12 and 14. She lives in Lag-itan, Panglao, Bohol. She engages in selling various commodities like canned goods, noodles, seasonings, and beverages. She also bakes native delicacies like cakes and pastries. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy ingredients like flour, cooking oil and sugar. She works hard to earn a living. In the future, Nicky would like to open up a stall in which she could display her native delicacies. By combining both business she would be able to earn a living and at the same time save for her children's college education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Валентина выращивает овощи в теплицах. Она уже пользовалась КИВА кредитами, благодаря чему смогла выростить хороший урожай и получить дополнительную прибыль. В прошлом году Валентина сделала ремонт в доме. Она поставила новые пластиковые окна, сделала санузел, ремонт в кухне и выложила плитку во дворе. 

В этот раз Валентина просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 14 000 гривен на покупку семян, пленки, угля и удобрений. Также небольшая часть денег пойдет на ремонт теплицы. Кредит поможет Валентине подготовиться к весеннему сезону и получить хороший урожай.
texts.en:
Valentina grows vegetables in the greenhouses. She has already used Kiva's loans thanks for which was able to grow good harvest and get additional profit. During the last year Valentina made repairs at home. She installed new plastic windows, new bathroom and upgrades in the kitchen as wells as put tile in the yard. 

This time Valentina is asking to give her a loan in the amount of 14,000 hryvnia to buy seeds, film, coal and fertilizer. Also a small part of the loan will go towards repairs in the greenhouse. This loan will help Valentina get ready for the spring season and get a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, film, coal and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Ganchimeg is 37 years old lives with her husband and 2 children in a ger in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband Sundui, age 42, works at a local company as a repairman. Her daughter Myagmarjargal, age 16 and Tuvshintulga, age 12 go to the local school. Ganchimeg has been working as a saleswoman in other people's grocery stores for 7 years and now she is planning to start her own grocery store in a rental space. She is now requesting a 3'500'000MNT loan to purchase starting inventory and equipment for her new grocery store. She is a hardworking, welcoming and friendly woman.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory and equipment for her new grocery store.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en: Cesar is a 32-year-old married man from Fatima, Cortes, Bohol. He is a father of a six- year-old son. He has engaged in a hog raising business for the last 2 years. He requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy feed for the hogs and grocery items like canned goods, noodles, seasonings and beverages. Cesar works hard to earn a living. In the future, Cesar would like to open a sari-sari (variety) store to support his family and to save for the education of his son.

loans.use: to buy feed for the hogs, and grocery items like canned goods, noodles, seasonings and beverages.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 46 years old and married with 3 children.

Alma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Alma has been in this business for seven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Alma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son Mohammad appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Hanan is a 34-year-old married woman. She lives in Qalqilia with her husband and five children: three sons and two daughters. The family owns a small grocery store which has been in operation for five years. This store provides a very good income, but it also needs some support to purchase more grocery products. 

Hanan is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN. this loan will help Hanan and her family to improve the store conditions and buy more groceries to sell.

This will increase sales and increase the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an ice cream business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 14000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her ice cream.

Dina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her ice cream business.

NWTF is relisting Dina's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Lydia has been in this business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Lydia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 30-year-old young man. He is married and a father to one son and three daughters. Mohammad has had a shoe store in Tulkarem. He has been working for twenty years and earns a good income. Mohammad would like to increase his income by buying a new collection to sell. 

Mohammad borrowed a youth loan from FATEN. This will increase demand from his loyal customers and so increase his income, which will enable him to create a better future for his family. 

Mohammad is pictured inside his store.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Drissa est un homme marié né en 1981 qui est père de 2 enfants et  qui vit dans une famille monogame  dans le quartier Dougounina de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas pu progresser dans les études très tôt Drissa s’interessa aux activités génératrices de revenu notamment à l’achat vente d’articles divers tels les habits, les chaussures et les prêts à porter. Avec une expérience de 2 ans, dans  cette activité, il est très sollicité à Bougouni. 
Il est à son troisième prêt, après avoir correctement remboursés les deux précédents.
Il compte acheter avec son prêt, 10 paires de chaussures de différentes sortes, 20  douzaines de différentes sortes de chemises et pantalons auprès des grossistes de Bamako et effectue ses ventes, au comptant en détail et à crédit, au grand marché de Bougouni à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Drissa envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65.000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour assure certaines dépenses de la famille et améliorer d’avantage son entreprise.
texts.en:
Drissa was born in 1981. He is married and has two children. He lives in a monogamous family in the Dougounina neighborhood of Bougouni.

Not able to progress in his studies early on, Drissa turned to revenue-generating activities such as buying and selling various items: clothing, shoes, and ready-made clothing. With two years of experience in this line of work, he is in high demand in Bougouni.

He is on his third loan. His two previous loans were correctly repaid.

He plans to use the loan to buy 10 different pairs of shoes and 20 dozen shirts and pants of various types from wholesalers in Bamako. He sells his goods individually for cash, or for credit, at the big market in Bougouni to a clientele made up of both men and women.

Drissa expects to earn a monthly profit of 65,000 FCFA, which he will use to cover some of his family's expenses and further improve his business.

loans.use: to buy various items

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia, 67, a resident of Malibay, Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Ulpiano and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Delia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects an expansion in her income as she enlarge her business. 

Delia hopes that her business will grow and dreams that her children will have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Javzmaa

texts.en: Javzmaa is 40 years old and lives with her husband and 7 children in their house in Selenge Province, Mongolia. Her husband, Otgonbaatar, works in local company as driver. She has two daughters. Enhmaa, age 20, graduated from specialty training school and Bayarmaa, age 19, studies at university. Her sons Byambadorj, age 17, Lhagvadorj, age 16, and Myagmardorj, age 7, go to local schools. Her younger children Enhjin and Uchral go to a local kindergarten. The borrower has stopped her garment retail business and started an organic vegetable growing and sales business in a local market. Since 2000, she has grown organic vegetables on her plot of land for family use only. Now, she has made it business and sells her surpluses to local customers. She is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase preserving equipment and inventory to produce organic vegetable products. She is a hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase preserving equipment and inventory to produce organic vegetable products.

loans.name: Bayarsaihan

texts.en: Bayarsaihan, 58, lives with his wife in an apartment in Selenge Province, Mongolia. His wife works in the tax department. His daughter has married and lives separately. The borrower has been working at local company for years as construction engineer and retired few years ago. He started his own business selling construction supplies at retail prices in the local market in June 2012. He is planning to insulate his apartment because it is an old apartment built years ago by Russians and now it needs to be insulated in order to stay warm during winter. He is now requesting 6,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of insulation material to insulate his house and other customers' houses to stay warm during winter as well as to make money by providing installation services. He is an open-minded, friendly and hardworking man.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material to insulate his house and other customers' houses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay rent for a gym space and to purchase gym supplies

loans.name: Lori

texts.en:
Help this family-run construction company expand!

The son of a carpenter, Ron started his construction business in 2001, realizing a life-long dream. Ron and his wife, Lori, became business partners in 2002. Today, Lori continues to run the business day to day. Lori employs her son, nephew and daughter, making their construction company a true family business. Lori says the best part of watching their business grow has been seeing customers seek them out because they have heard about the high standard of quality contracting the construction company offers.

Despite their wonderful reviews and success via word of mouth, they have had trouble raising money from banks due to lack of collateral. Now that their local lumber yard has closed, Lori needs a loan to add a storage area to their shop as well as buy inventory. They hope to expand in the near future, deputizing their son and nephew to run the construction crews themselves while Ron and Lori run the office. A loan to this construction company will help them meet these goals and preserve the jobs and vitality of the entire family.

loans.use: to add a storage area to their shop as well as to purchase inventory

loans.name: Diamond

texts.en: Help fund this great new company! Two years ago, Diamond started his own towing company so that he could expand on his previous experiences in the towing business and have the flexibility to spend time with his two young daughters. Rite Hook Towing is a bright new small business with just two employees – Diamond and another family member. Watching his business grow from the ground up has been a dream come true for Diamond and his family, and now he wants to make improvements to his business’s services and image. A loan to Rite Hook Towing would help Diamond buy equipment and uniforms and help him build his credit.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and uniforms

loans.name: Wilder

texts.en: Help this experienced entrepreneur expand his business! Wilder runs W.L.C. Consulting Corp. all by himself – he is the founder, president and sole employee of this successful accounting business. Originally from Colombia, Wilder has been in business for over nine years, serving clients out of his home in Miramar, Florida. Learning the business language and culture of a different country has been difficult but incredibly rewarding for Wilder, and now he wants to take the next logical step for his business and expand. A loan to Wilder would help him buy a vehicle so that he can visit clients in their homes and provide him with working capital.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle to be able to more easily visit clients of his accounting business

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
This is Beatriz, 43, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Felix and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Beatriz operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a 15, 000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Beatriz hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a long life so she can support her grandchildren. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Help this fashion entrepreneur meet growing demand! For the past three years, Lilian has run Celeste Enterprise, Inc. in South Florida selling perfumes, wallets, purses and other fashion goods. In the past three years Lilian has watched her client base grow and now needs a loan to buy inventory to satisfy the high demand for her products. A loan to Celeste Enterprise will help Lilian buy purses, sunglasses, sports accessories and wallets for the coming season. If you love fashion, support this entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional gym equipment to expand her services.

loans.name: Supatt

texts.en:
Supatt started Bio Togo Supply in 2011 as a supplier of biodegradable food packaging. His business currently serves the local Los Angeles area. 

Supatt is seeking a loan of $10,000 to help finance the purchase of additional inventory to expand his reach outside of Los Angeles.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory to expand his reach outside of Los Angeles.

loans.name: Davaajav

texts.en:
Davaajav is 25 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (a traditional yurt) in Tosontsengel soum of Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife, Uuganjargal, works at the local school as an assistant teacher but she is on pregnancy leave. They are expecting their baby in February, 2013. His son, Sanchir, age 1, stays home with his mother. 

Davaajav started his business of organic dairy products sales in 2009 with his brother, and now he is running the business alone. He has gained lot of experience and built strong relationships with herders and regular customers over the years. 

He is now requesting 1,700,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products from herders. He is hardworking and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products from herders.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is a 30-year-old married entrepreneur in Punta, Pana-on. 

He has run a transport service business for almost three years now, and he earns 6,000 PHP a month. To improve business, he is borrowing 24,500 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, which he just joined in 2012, to obtain accessories and tires. 

He is hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business before long.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza is a 45-year-old resident of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

Lorenza supports her family from the little amount of 4,000 PHP she gains monthly from her gardening business, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Since 2008, she has been a member of GDMPC, and she will apply her loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Lorenza wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is from Barangay 5, Tangub City. She is 33 years old, married, and has four school-age children. 

Vilma owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Vilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is requesting a loan of 5,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.
