Vilma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Osias

texts.en:
Osias is 57 years old, married, and has four children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For the past five years, Osias has been operating a motorcycle transport business, earning 5,000 PHP a month. 

Osias is requesting a loan for 12,500 PHP, which he will use to purchase spare parts. He joined GDMPC in 2009.  In the future, he hopes to improve his general living conditions and provide an education to his children.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a widow and has two children. She is 52 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Elizabeth operates a business providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Every month she earns 4,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 29,000 PHP to repair her vehicle to provide better service. In 2010, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services that will help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve and expand her business and to earn twice as much income.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle to provide better service.

loans.name: Thermie

texts.en:
Thermie is 23 years old, married, and resides in Capucao, Ozamiz City, Philippines. She owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting bananas, which she has been doing for six years. She earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

Thermie is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2012,Thermie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services and help to improve her business and living situation. In the future, Thermie plans to make improvements to her house and have a baby.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Nyamdorj

texts.en:
Nyamdorj is 21 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (a traditional yurt) in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. His wife, Otgonbayar, age 23, works in a local specialty training school as a teacher. His son, Boldhuyag, is 1 year old and stays home with his grandmother during the day. 

Nyamdorj has been running a hair salon in a rental place since 2008. He is planning to expand the hair salon since they have a baby and the family's expense has increased a lot. 

He is now requesting 1,350,000 MNT to purchase equipment and tools for his own hair salon business in town. He is a well-experienced, friendly and welcoming man.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools for his own hair salon business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 53 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in Sinacaban where she has a transport service business, which she has been doing for 

Elsa is requesting a loan from GDMPC for  30,000 PHP, which she will use to buy accessories and tires.  She joined GDMPC in 2012.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase accessories and tires.

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
Clarissa is 40 years old and single.  She is a  resident of Caloocan, Philippines.  Clarissa operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs from  round palm-sized ones to the much larger doormats. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP a day.

Clarissa is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread, and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Clarisssa hopes that her business will grow and will continue to generate income. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship * members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is from Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, Juanita cultivates flowers for sale. Juanita has been in this business for 2 years and earns a monthly income of 3,500 PHP. In 2005, Juanita joined GDMPC. Juanita is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase seedlings to plant. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 44-year-old living in San Juan, Panaon. She has provided for the needs of her 4 children from the small sum of 3,000 PHP she has been earning monthly from her gardening business for 3 years. Her business is an aid to the income that her husband earns from farming. In 2011, Susan joined GDMPC, and she is applying for a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad is from Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, married and has 3 children. To make a living, Trinidad owns and operates a transportation services business. She's been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns 2,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Trinidad joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 3,500 PHP, which she will use to purchase tires and other accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
This is Rosalita, 43, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, an employee, and she is mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosalita maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers count on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosalita hopes to expand her business and dreams to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and merchandise like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener and undergarments.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is a 33-year old resident of Magsaysay, Panaon. 

Rolando supports his family from the little amount of 8,000 PHP he has gained monthly from his private transport service business for the past three years. 

He has been a member of GDMPC since 2012, and he applied for a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. Rolando wants to expand his business one day.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa is a 69-year-old married mom of 3 kids. She lives in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has been sewing for 30 years and continues to do so today. She designs dresses according to the customer's desired style, or sometimes she creates out of her own will and imagination. Every month, she receives 3,000 PHP, which is fair enough to cover day-to-day expenses. Felisa joined Gata Daku MPC earlier in 2012. She applied for a loan of 4,000 PHP from the cooperative to buy sewing materials such as textiles and threads. By having all necessary materials, Felisa hopes to create as much output as she can to generate more income. She is also planning to expand in her business area and/or buy another set of sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as textiles and threads.

loans.name: Ruba

texts.en:
This is Ruba, 37, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Pedro, a tricycle driver, and is mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ruba maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers count on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ruba hopes that her business will expand and dreams that all her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener and undergarments.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is 40 years old, married and has three children. She is from Punta, Panaon. To make a living, Melodina grows bananas to sell, which she has been doing for two years. She earns 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. 

Melodina is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP, which she will use to obtain farm fertilizers. Melodina joined GDMPC in 2012. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to obtain farm fertilizers.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is separated and a mother of one dependent. She is 54 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez. Merlyn owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She established the motorcycle transport business as a way of generating extra income of 4,600 PHP (Philippines pesos) per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for two years. 

Merlyn requested a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories. Merlyn became a member of GDMPC in 2012. In the future, Merlyn wants to purchase more motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Patrocenio

texts.en:
Patrocenio, 32 years old, lives in Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is married with two kids. To make a living, Patrocenio operates a motorcycle transport business. He's been in this business for 10 years and earns 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. He has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. 

He applied for a loan of 15,000 PHP to pay for the motorcycle's maintenance and registration. He plans to purchase an additional motorcycle for his business and to help his family with their daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the motorcycle's maintenance and registration.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is a 67-year-old widowed woman from Corella, Bohol. She is a mother of three grown children. She has raised hogs in her community for six years. She earns  6,000 pesos out of the hog-raising business. She works hard to earn a living. She never depends on her children for her daily needs.

Crispina requested a loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional piglets, feed and pig supplements to increase the production of healthy pigs so she could sell them on time. In the future, Crispina would like to invest in another business in order to be successful and prepare for old age.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and pig supplements.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Mr. Gantulga is 38 years old. He lives with his wife and three children in a Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife, Tumendemberel, is temporarily unemployed now and helps her husband to run his business manufacturing wooden furniture. His daughter, Narangerel, age 18, has just enrolled in university, and his sons Lhagvadorj, age 17, and Nandinlham, age 7, go to local schools. He has been running his business of wooden furniture manufacturing since 2007. 

He is now requesting 1,800,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to pay his daughter's university tuition fee and other school expense. He is a hardworking, diligent and responsible man.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's university tuition fee and other school expenses.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria, 45, a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Eddie, her business partner, and is a mother to her children. She is working hard to continually provide for their everyday expenses. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business.

Gloria operates a soft broom retailing business. She sells soft brooms, which are very common in the Philippines as they are used in cleaning the house. What she basically does is buy her products from wholesalers, then sells them per item with a profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices that she offers. She also has a variety store for additional income. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of soft brooms. She will also use the loan for buying products for her variety store. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Gloria hopes that her business will continue to grow and many customers will patronize her product. She dreams that all her children will finish their studies and have a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more soft brooms needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 38 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, además de ser amable y cordial. Está casada con Hilter quien es empleado y padre de sus 3 hijos: Jacqueline de 14 años, Angelo de 11 años y Eler de 3 años de edad. Vive en compañía toda su familia en su propia casa la cual compró con su esposo.
La actividad que realiza María es la venta de bebidas gasificadas heladas de diversos sabores y marcas además de helados de marcas reconocidas y de exquisito sabor. Para esto cuenta con una refrigeradora que compró con sus ahorros, ahí conserva a bajas temperaturas todos los productos que ofrece para que siempre estén refrescantes y al gusto del cliente. Se inició  con un préstamo de MFP hace más de 1 año, trabaja sola atendiendo a sus clientes de manera cordial. 
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en casa y cuidar a sus pequeños hijos a los que quiere mucho, además puede contar con los ingresos económicos necesarios para pagar los gastos de su hogar. Por lo contrario, no le gusta cuando llueve muy seguido ya que le dificulta la venta de sus productos pues depende mucho del clima para mejorar sus ventas.  Pero eso no la desanima y  tiene planes de continuar y aumentar la variedad de sus productos.
Este es el préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP. Por tanto agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Asegura que se siente cómoda trabajando con los integrantes de su banco comunal pues los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de gaseosas y helados de diversas marcas y sabores para tener un stock disponible para la venta, buscando precios más bajos por sus compras al por mayor.
texts.en:
María, 38, is hardworking, determined, friendly, and polite. She is married to Hilter, who is employed and is the father of their three children: Jacqueline, 14; Angelo, 11; and Eler, 3. The family lives together in the house her husband purchased.

María sells a variety of well-known brands and delicious flavors of soda and ice cream. She stores them in a refrigerator she purchased with her savings. The products are kept at a low temperature to satisfy her customers' tastes. She started her business a year ago with a loan from MFP, and she works alone, always serving her customers cordially. She likes her business because she can be at home and take care of her beloved children, while earning enough to pay her household expenses. Since her sales depend on the weather, she doesn't like it when it rains continuously because sales fall. This doesn't discourage her, and she plans to add more items to her inventory. 

This is her 6th loan cycle with MFP, and she is grateful for the chance to achieve her objectives. She is comfortable with the members of her communal bank because they are responsible and caring people. She will use the loan of 2000 nuevos soles to buy different brands and flavors of soda and ice cream at low wholesale prices to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy different brands and flavors of soda and ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Lesly Liliana

texts.es:
Lesly  es una señorita de 22 años de edad, ella es soltera y  vive en Sololá con sus padres y un hermano mayo quien trabaja independientemente.
Ella se dedica a la crianza y a la venta de carne de cerdo en el mercado de su comunidad. Esta actividad lo empezó a realizar cuando estudiaba su carrera académica  porque  ella necesitaba de ingresos económicos para poder mantener y terminar esta carrera ahora gracias a eso ella logro uno de sus objetivos en la vida. 
Ella tiene ahora 5 años de emprender este negocio  y ha visto los buenos resultados en la generación de ganancias para su familia.
De este modo ella ve la necesidad de invertir más capital en  su negocio solicitando un préstamo de  Q 7,000.00 para comprar más cerdos y poder criarlos para luego poder comercializar la carne en el mercado local obteniendo mejores resultados en sus ganancias. 
De esto ella sueña  hacer crecer más su negocio y expandir más su producto en otros mercados.
texts.en:
Lesly, 22, is a young, single woman that lives in Sololá with her parents and an older brother who is an independent worker. Lesly raises pigs and sells their meat in her community’s marketplace. She started this line of work when she was studying because she needed some income in order to support herself and finish her studies. Thanks to this effort, she reached one of her goals in life. She started this business five years ago and has seen that it generates good income for her family.

Conscious of the need to invest more in her business, she is requesting a loan of 7000 GTQ. She will buy more pigs, raise them and sell their meat in the local marketplace, which will result in better profits. She expects to expand her business even more and offer her product in other marketplaces.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell their meat.

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyuntsetseg is 57 years old. She lives with her husband in a Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Tuv province of Mongolia. Her husband, Sereeter, runs a taxi service in town. Her children all are married and live separately. 

She had been working at a state-owned company for years and retired two years ago. She has been helping her daughter to run her clothes retail business in a local market. She is now starting her own business of clothing retail at a rental counter in a local market. 

She is now requesting 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to import clothes from Erlian, China, for her newly started clothes retail business. She is a hardworking and optimistic woman.

loans.use: to import clothes from Erlian, China, for her newly started clothes retail business.

loans.name: Pok's Group

texts.en:
Pok is 42 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She and her family live in a rural area of the Sa Ang district located in the Kandal province, Cambodia. Pok and her husband make their living farming rice on a hectare farmland, earning about 70,000 KHR a day. They save approximately 15,000 KHR for future needs after offsetting the daily cost of living. 

Pok is leading a loan group which consists of three female members who all are first-time borrowers with VisionFund.  They are requesting loans for 160,000 KHR each. The group leader Pok will use her loan portion to build a latrine for use by the family. Wit the loan, Pok will be able to avoid using unsanitary practices and create a healthier environment for her whole family. With this latrine properly installed, she can also help to promote sanitation and hygiene practices in her community.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Byambahuu

texts.en:
Mrs. Byambahuu is 49 years old. She lives with her husband and son in a small house in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband, Shiilegbat, age 54, works in a local company. Her son, Mongonhuyag, age 8, goes to a local primary school. 

She has been selling organic vegetable from a rental counter of a local market for five years. She purchases organic vegetables from agrarians and sells them to local customers from her counter at a retail price. 

She is now requesting 6,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase a large amount of organic vegetable to sell from her counter. She is a hardworking, honest and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic vegetable to sell from her counter.

loans.name: Suny's Group

texts.en: Residing in a rural area of the Sa Ang district in Cambodia, Suny is a 43-year-old widow and a mother of four children, two of whom are dependent on her. To offer a decent life for the family, Suny has been working tirelessly as a rice farmer for more than 20 years. Suny, a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is leading a female group member who also is a second-time borrower to take out a new loan in the amount of 160,000 KHR each. The group leader Suny states that via the help of the previous loan she was able to sufficiently cover the daily expenses and meet the family’s needs. This time, she will spend her loan portion on building a latrine for use in her family. With the help of the new requested loan portion, Suny highly believes that she will be able to create a healthier environment for her whole family and avoid using unsanitary practices.

loans.use: To build a latrine

loans.name: Belen

texts.es:
Belén, de 55 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y amable, siempre hizo frente a las adversidades al lado de Walter con quien ya tiene 34 años de convivencia, trabajó mucho para así poder sacar adelante a sus cuatro hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes, ella vive a lado de su esposo en su casa propia en donde a diario trabaja mucho para poder tener una vejez tranquila.
Belén tiene como actividad laboral la venta de productos variados como gaseosas, harinas, golosinas y otros productos envasados hacia las poblaciones aledañas a la ciudad. Quincenalmente traslada todo lo que tiene para vender vía fluvial en viajes que pueden tardar hasta una semana de recorrido. Trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo quien se encarga de movilizar la pesada mercadería. Lleva en este negocio 10 años y le va muy bien. Cuando se encuentra en la ciudad ayuda a su esposo en la fabricación de puertas y ventanas de fierro, por otra parte tiene un mototaxi que alquila a un conductor y por el cual recibe un pago diario. 
Durante todo el tiempo que se dedica a su trabajo siente que aprendió y avanzó mucho ya que tiene la satisfacción de tener sus propios ingresos y además dispone de su tiempo como ella mejor lo crea conveniente, se siente contenta trabajando al lado de su pareja y eso le brinda mayor seguridad, espera seguir trabajando y poder aumentar su capital para poder enviar mayor cantidad de productos para vender. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará 50 cajas de gaseosas y con el monto restante comprará harina, diersas golosinas y otro productos no perecibles para enviarlos a otras localidades.
texts.en:
Belén, 55, is modest, friendly, and always confronts challenges. She and Walter, her husband of 34 years, worked hard to provide for their four children, who are now independent adults. She and her husband live in their own house and work daily to save for their later years.

Belén sells a variety of items such as soda, flour, sweets, and packaged goods to customers in the city's neighborhoods. Every two weeks, she delivers her inventory by boat in trips that last up to a week. Her husband helps her load the heavy merchandise. The business has been running for 10 years and is prospering. When they are in the city, she helps her husband make iron doors and windows. They also have a motor taxi that they rent to a driver for a daily fee.

She feels that she has learned and progressed a lot during her years working and is happy to have her own income and be able to set her schedule. She enjoys and feels more secure working with her husband. She expects to keep working and wants to increase her capital to be able to deliver more products. She will use the loan of 3000 soles to buy 50 cases of soda, and flour, sweets, and other non-perishable items to deliver to other locations.

loans.use: to buy 50 cases of soda, and flour, sweets, and other non-perishable items to deliver to other locations.

loans.name: Vann's Group

texts.en: Vann, age 55 years, is a resident living in the Sa Ang district in Cambodia’s Kandal province. She is married and has two children, one (a daughter) of whom is currently a student. Vann supports her family through farming rice. The lack of a latrine for use has been a big challenge for her as well as her family. Thus, Vann is leading a female group member to take out a loan in the amount of 500,000 KHR and 300,000 KHR, respectively. The group representative Vann has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for four loan cycles already, with which she accomplished supporting her daughter’s education and covering household expenses. This time, Vann plans on utilizing her loan portion to smooth out her challenge by building a latrine for use in the family. Via the help of this loan, Vann and family will have a proper latrine for use and avoid using unsanitary practices.

loans.use: To build a latrine

loans.name: Shehnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 36-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, 2 daughters and 2 sons. All of her children are students while her husband is a painter. She lives in a rented house and sometimes they don't have enough money to pay electricity bills and house rent with all the other household and children's education expenses.

Shenaz is a very hardworking and independent woman. By stitching clothes, she helps her husband meet the family's needs and her children's education expenses. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly since 2000. Her clients always appreciate her work. Presently, she is interested in purchasing a tailoring machine so that she can work more efficiently. This will help her to save some time and increase her income as well. For that, she has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan.

As she is living in a rented house with her family, Shehnaz dreams to build her own house. She also desires to increase her business and to provide a quality education to her children. Shehnaz and her family are very thankful to both BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine to stitch clothes.

loans.name: Portacia

texts.en:
Portacia is 52 years old and lives in Duanguican, Tudela, Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Portacia has a general store business and earns approximately 6,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase raw materials for her house renovation. Portacia has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. 

In the future, Portacia hopes to save for some emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her house renovation

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Fatoumata est une femme mariée née vers 1957 qui est mère de 7 enfants et  qui vit avec ses enfants chez son époux dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquentée l’école très tôt Fatoumata s’interessa aux activités génératrices de revenu notamment à l’achat vente de céréales. Avec une expérience de plus 7 ans, dans  cette activité, elle est très sollicitée et appréciée à Bougouni. 
Elle est à son quatrième cycle de prêt, après avoir correctement remboursés les trois précédents.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, 5 tonnes de maïs auprès des produteurs de Bougouni et environs. Elle effectue ses ventes, au comptant en détail et à crédit, au grand marché de Bougouni à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Fatoumata envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000 FCFA
qui sera utilisé pour assure certaines dépenses de la famille et améliorer d’avantage son entreprise.
texts.en:
Fatoumata was born around 1957. She is a married mother of seven children, and she lives with her family in the Bougouni district of Massablacoura. 

Fatoumata, who never went to school, became involved in income-generating activities at an early age. She has been buying and selling cereals for over seven years, and her experience has made her a popular vendor who is in very high demand in Bougouni. 

This is her 4th loan cycle, and all past loans were correctly repaid. She plans to use her loan to buy five tonnes of maize from farmers in Bougouni and surrounding areas. She conducts her sales at retail at the big market of Bougouni, for cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Fatoumata expects to earn an average monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA, which she will use to cover some of the household expenses and to bolster her activity.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en: Mr. Ganzorig is 28 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger in Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife Enhtungalag, works in a local market as a saleswoman. His son Togoldor, age 3, goes to local kindergarten. Mr. Ganzorig has been working on a construction site as an assistant worker during the summer and as a part-time driver during winter. He is now planning to start his own business of taxi service in town. He is now requesting 3,650,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to provide taxi service to local customers. He is a hardworking and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to provide taxi service to local customers

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 58 years old, from Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is separated and has 8 children. She manages a rice (palay) production business. She's been in this business for 5 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. She joined GDMPC in 2012. She has requested a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her next crop. She hopes that her children will be able to finish their education and she can improve their daily life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her next crop.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie is married with four children. She is 31 years old and lives in Panta-on, Ozamiz City, Philippines. Melanie is a farmer who cultivates bananas and gardens to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years and every month she earns 4,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase manure to use as fertilizer. Melanie has been a member of GDMPC since 2012. Her hope for the future is to improve their living situation.

loans.use: to purchase manure to use as fertilizer.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es:
Cindy, de 22 años, es una joven mujer trabajadora, es madre de una niña llamada Kaori de 5 años a quien cría en la casa de sus suegros junto a su pareja Alex, ella trabaja mucho pues lo que más desea es poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su menor hija.
Cindy se dedica a la venta de pescado, tiene un puesto de ventas en uno de los mercados mas concurridos por la población, afortunadamente tiene buenas ventas y considerables ganancias, pero este trabajo merece de mucho sacrificio ya que para conseguir los buenos y frescos productos que ofrece a sus clientes tiene que madrugar e ir al puerto de la ciudad a las 4 de la mañana, sin embargo, ella sabe que todo su esfuerzo vale la pena y es recompensado al ver que su pequeña hija tiene todo lo necesario para estar cómoda. Lleva en este negocio 1 año, trabaja al lado de su cónyuge de principio a fin, reconoce que aún no tiene la experiencia necesaria pero afirma que las ganas por hacer las cosas bien y generar ingresos económicos para su familia son su principal motivo para ir en busca del progreso.
Le gusta la libertad que le brinda este negocio ya que puede divertirse por las tardes jugando y practicando algún deporte además de estar al lado de su familia, espera seguir trabajando para continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio y tener mayor variedad de pescados para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en créditos anteriores, además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
El monto solicitado (S/. 2000) lo invertirá en la compra de pescados de las mejores especies y tamaños, su inversión diaria varía entre 1000 soles con la compra de aproximadamente 200 kilos de mercadería.
texts.en:
Cindy, age 22, is a hard-working young woman.  She is the mother of a five year old girl named Kaori.  She and her life partner, Alex, are raising their daughter in her mother and father-in-law’s house.  Cindy works a lot because what she wants most of all is to be able to give her small daughter a better quality of life.

Cindy sells fish.  She has a sales stand at one of the busiest markets.  Fortunately, she has good sales and considerable income.  However, this work requires a lot of sacrifice.  In order to get the good, fresh products that she offers her customers, she has to get up early and go to the city port at four in the morning.  

Nevertheless, she knows that all of her effort is worth it.  She is rewarded  upon seeing that her little daughter has everything she needs in order to be comfortable.

She has had this business for one year, and she works at her husband’s side from start to finish.  She recognizes that she does not yet have the needed experience.  However, she affirms that the desire to do things well and to generate income for her family is her primary motivation to seek progress.

She likes the freedom that this business provides because she is able to enjoy the afternoons playing and practicing some sport and being with her family.  She hopes to continue working in order to continue with the growth of her business and to have a greater variety of fish to offer her customers.

This is her fifth loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the opportunity and trust given to her in order to receive this loan.  She pledges to make her payments punctually as she has done with her previous loans.  It pleases her to be part of the communal bank she belongs to.  She has seen that the members are responsible and supportive people.

She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy the best types and sizes of fish.  Her daily investment is about 1,000 soles for approximately 200 kilos of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy the best types and sizes of fish.

loans.name: Crhis

texts.es:
Crhis, de 31 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora, es conviviente hace 5 años con Miguel de 36 años y con quien tiene un pequeño hijo llamado Miguel de 5 años, vive en una casa alquilada en donde dedica tiempo a sus actividades y a educar a su hijo a quien desea brindarle una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida.
El trabajo de Crhis consiste en la venta de bebidas gaseosas, además de la venta de golosinas. A diario acomoda en su refrigeradora sus productos y pone a exhibir todo lo que ofrece, se abastece de las bebidas dos veces por semana. Lleva realizando este trabajo desde hace 3 años y desde que empezó siempre lo ha hecho sola. Además, cada fin de semana vende comida típica de la región y otros platillos peruanos ya que su experiencia y buena sazón le permite preparar los potajes que le soliciten.
Su negocio marcha adecuadamente, espera seguir trabajando mucho más y así continuar progresando para mejorar la economía de su hogar. El monto solicitado 2000 soles, lo destinará a la compra de cajas de gaseosas y golosinas, su inversión semanal varía entre 500 a 700 soles en una sola compra. El saldo restante lo usará para comprar ingredientes usados en la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Crhis, 31 years old, is a good, kind, and hard-working woman. She has a 5-year-old little boy, Miguel, with her partner of 5 years, Miguel, who is 36 years old. She lives in a rented house where she dedicates time to her activities and her son, for whom she wants to provide a good education and a better quality of life.

Crhis's work consists of selling soft drinks and candy. Every day, she keeps her products in her refrigerator and puts the products she has to offer on display. She stocks up on drinks twice a week. She has been working in this job for 3 years and since she started it, she has done everything herself. Also, every weekend she sells typical regional food and other Peruvian dishes since her experience and good seasoning allow her to prepare the vegetable stew that is requested.

Her business is moving along well. She hopes to continue working more and progressing to improve her home's economic situation. She is requesting 2000 soles, which will be used to buy boxes of soda and candy. Her weekly investment varies between 500 and 700 soles in one purchase. The remaining money will be used to buy ingredients used to prepare her meals.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soda, candy and ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Jenelyn is 39 years old, married and the mother of two children. She lives in Magsaysay, Panaon, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She has earned a living for the last 6 years by selling home and products. She makes PHP 2,300 a month and is applying for a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Jenelyn joined GDMPC in 2008 as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Nayyer's Group

texts.en: Nayyar is 23 years old, a hardworking and independent woman. She is living in Punjab, Pakistan, with her family. Her husband is a painter and his income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. For the past few years Nayyar has been running a beauty salon, and she wants to purchase a variety of cosmetic products like beauty and makeup kits, hair products, facial creams, etc. for her beauty salon. For that reason, Nayyar as a member of a six-person lending group has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. With her increased profits, first she will repay the loan amount to Kiva and then she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the space in the salon is too much congested. She hopes that her business grows and she is very thankful to both BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cosmetic products for her salon.

loans.name: Domero

texts.en: Domero is 57 years old and lives in Panaon, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with three children. Domero has engaged in a transport business for 5 years and earns 5,000 PHP each month. He has requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. Domero has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Domero hopes to expand and improve the business to earn a better living.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en: Purevsuren is 63 years old and lives with his wife and son in a small house in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. His wife, Lhamsuren, age 56, has retired and stays home. His son, Baasanhuu, age 20, graduated from a specialty training course as a carpenter. Purevsuren worked for a state owned company for years and retired a few years ago. He helps his son make furniture, and now his son is planning to start a furniture manufacturing business of his own on their plot of land. Purevsuren is now requesting 1,800,000 MNT to purchase equipment for his son to start this furniture making business. His family members are hardworking and responsible people.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his son to start a furniture making business.

loans.name: Manuk

texts.en:
Manuk is married and has two children.  He lives in Azatek village of Vayots Dzor region where he runs a farm and raises livestock. The farm currently includes two cows, five sheep, and 12 chickens. Manuk also cultivates peach, apricot, nut, and pear trees. 

Manuk is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase sheep, heifer, and forage for feeding the livestock. Manuk and his family live in an old house, which needs to be repaired. The stable growth of agriculture is important for family to save, renovate his house, and live in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sheep, heifer, and feed.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
This is Emily, 48, a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Jaime, a driver, and is a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Emily operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 15,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects an expansion in her business income as she enlarges her business. 

Emily hopes that her business will grow and expand, and dreams to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Zareena's Group

texts.en:
Zareena is a 56-year-old hardworking and decent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, 5 sons and 2 daughters. One son is a carpenter and one is a tailor by profession. Her husband is a tailor as well. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Zareena is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes at her home. She is providing tailoring services in her community, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Zareena is a member of a 5-person group and has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a sewing machine to stitch up more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine to stitchup more dressses.

loans.name: Sodgerel

texts.en: Mrs.Sodgerel is 24 years old and lives with her husband and son in a small house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband Tserendorj is a police officer in the local police departmnet. Her son Temuulen, age 4 goes to a local kindergarten. Sodgerel has been working for a wholesale distribution company for the last few years and has gained a lot of experience and has built a network with suppliers and customers. She is now planning to start her own clothes retail business at a rental counter of the local market. She is now requesting 1'500'000MNT to purchase bulk orders of clothes to start her business. She is a hardworking and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase bulk orders of clothing to start her own business at the local market.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is a 35-year-old married woman from Loboc, Bohol, Philippines. She has two young children. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for seven years. She earns 7,500 PHP by doing this. Her husband is a motorcycle driver, and helps finance the family's basic needs. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy feed and additional piglets to produce and sell healthy pigs. In the future, Rosalina would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to save for the education of her children

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 45 years old and married with one child. She lives in Alang-Alang, Aurora. To make a better living, Elvira runs a general store. She's been in her business for 16 years and earns 7,430 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. She joined GDMPC in 2012. 

Elvira has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She aims to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Karim

texts.fr:
Karim est un homme marié né en 1974 à Soumako  qui est père de 5 enfants et qui vit dans une famille polygame (avec ses 2 épouses)  dans le quartier Dougounina de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas pu progresser dans les études très tôt Karim s’interessa aux activités génératrices de revenu notamment à la construction métallique. Avec une expérience de plus de 11 ans, dans  cette activité, il est très sollicité et apprécié à Bougouni et environs. Il est à son deuxième prêt, après avoir correctement remboursé le précédent.
Il compte acheter avec son prêt, 10 barres de fer, 10 feuilles de tôle noire et 5 paquets de baguettes auprès des grossistes de Bougouni pour la fabrication de charrettes. Il effectue ses ventes, au comptant en détail et à crédit, dans son atelier à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Karim envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 95.000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour assure certaines dépenses de la famille et améliorer d’avantage son entreprise.
texts.en:
Not being able to go on with his studies, Karim early applied himself to earning a living, specifically working in metal construction. With 11 years of experience in this field, he is sought after and appreciated in Bougouni and the nearby region. He is on his second loan, having duly repaid the first loan.

He plans to use the loan to buy 10 iron bars, 10 black steel sheets and five packs of rods from wholesalers in Bougouni in order to manufacture carts. He sells retail, for cash and on credit, out of his workshop, to a customer base composed of both men and women.

Karim plans to earn an average monthly income of 95,000 West African francs, which will be use to provide for some family expenses and to improve his business further.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to manufacture carts.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
This is Iluminada, 59, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Antonio, a barangay (village) watchman and a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Iluminada maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers count on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Iluminada hopes to increase her business and dreams to have their own house and lot. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Sirvard

texts.en:
Sirvard is involved in beekeeping. Currently she keeps 10 beehives. She keeps livestock which currently includes 6 pigs and 10 chickens, as well as grows apple, pear, nut, peach and apricot trees.
Sirvard lives with her pensioner husband Henrik, who helps his wife with the agriculture.
The main income for Sirvard and her husband is from selling their harvests at the local markets. Sirvard is a very hardworking women and she does her best to have good harvests.
Sirvard has applied for this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. With the loan's help Sirvard will be able to save money and cover some basic needs of the family.
The loan is very important so she is able to continue the expansion of her farm, which means increased income and better living conditions for her and her husband.

loans.use: to buy forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is 39 years old, married and has 1 child. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Julie does carpentry for a living. He has been in business for 4 years and earns about 5,000 PHP every month. Julie has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. He is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase carpentry supplies such as nails, cement, etc. His plan is to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase carpentry supplies such as nails, cement, etc.

loans.name: Kenanda

texts.en:
Kenanda is 38 years old, married to Nasula and blessed with five children aged 16, 14, 12, eight and five years respectively. He is a livestock trader and has been running the business for the past six years making a monthly income of KES. 25,000

He has requested a third loan of KES. 40,000 from KADET LTD which he intends to use to purchase more livestock for resale. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost business. 
His future dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Inasagan, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur where she manages her gardening business, which she has been doing for two years. She earns 2,000 PHP a month. 

Letecia is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She joined GDMPC in 2012. She hopes to improve the general living condition of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
This is Lucila, 66, and a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Romeo and a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Lucila operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets and dresses. Clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php8, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lucila hopes to have a new sewing machine and dreams that her grandchildren will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Lilya

texts.en: Lilya lives in Meghri town with her husband and two children. Together with her family, Lilya is involved in cattle breeding. They keep two cows and make cheese and milk products. Lilya's husband sells the products in the local market and gets some income, but unfortunately that income isn't enough even to cover the family's basic needs. So Lilya has applied for this loan to purchase a cow. This will help her to get more milk to make more cheese. The family hopes that this loan will help them get a higher income and they will be able to cover their costs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a cow.

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat is a 58-year-old widow with 5 sons and 2 daughters. Her husband died of diabetes when her children were at an early age. Since then she has been looking after her children and paying all household expenses alone. She faced a very difficult time after the death of her husband as she is the only earning person in the family.

Mussarat owns a chicken shop in the market nearby, which is the only source of income for the family. She sells chickens and eggs in her shop. In spite of working full time, she takes care of all the housework and makes sure that she can fulfill all of her children's needs. All of the income that comes from her chicken shop goes to the household expenses, so she is unable to save any amount for her children’s future.

She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase chickens and eggs from the poultry farm for her shop. Mussarat hopes that the loan will be beneficial for them.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and eggs to sell.

loans.name: You

texts.en:
You is 49 years old and a mother of six children, happily residing with her family in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She has been dedicated for over 30 years to a business of growing crops according to the seasons. Aside from her hardship at the rice field, You occasionally devotes her time to help her husband in producing mortar and pestle sets, earning approximately 5.00 USD each day. 
 
You is requesting the loan to effectively manage the costs of her son’s wedding party, which will be coming very soon. She expects the impact of the loan will enable her to meet the financial needs for this party and make a good preparation for everyone. For her future plan, You dreams to have a good business with an abundant harvest and to obtain a higher profit that will let her improve her home.

loans.use: to effectively manage the costs of her son’s wedding party.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng is 54 years old and lives with her husband in the Dongkor district, an area of Phnom Penh. She has four children, two of whom depend on her. She has learned about medicines and used to work as a pharmacist for a public hospital. Since retiring from the hospital, she has operated a small drugstore located in her own house. It’s been the main source of her income. Most of her customers are friends, relatives and neighbors who are from the surroundings areas. She typically generates income of 10.00 USD per day.

Heng is requesting an amount of 1,500 USD to increase the supply of her medicines. Heng, with the support of this loan for her business, wants to get ahead and continue improving her business, and to keep her customers healthy with the product she provides.

loans.use: to increase the stock of her medicines.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a widow and 64 years old.  She has four children who are all above eighteen years old. She knits and sells sweaters, scarfs, etc.  and also sells firewood and charcoal. She has been in this business for three years now and gets a monthly income of forty thousand shillings.

This will be Hannah's second loan with KADET LTD. she plans to use the entire loan to buy thread, charcoal and firewood. 

In future she wants to live and see her grandchildren with a stable life.

loans.use: to purchase thread, firewood and charcoal.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is 39 years old. She lives in the small village of the Kaspi district District with her son Shmagi. Khatuna has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is Khatuna’s income working as a housekeeper. She makes 200 Laris per month. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Khatuna has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business.  Her loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provisioning of business start-ups and re-startup credits with easy conditions to country rural poor. They do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit Khatuna will purchase a truck. After purchasing a truck, her son will serve people by transporting cargo. This will increase the income of their family.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a truck

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
This is Nerissa, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Emmanuel, her business partner, and she is a mother to her children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. They are working hand in hand to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nerissa owns and oversees operations of their van transportation business. She has two van units, which are paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, especially the children who go to school. She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her van units. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Nerissa hopes to have more capital for her growing business and dreams of having a good and peaceful life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their van.

loans.name: Shushik

texts.en:
Shushik is involved in agriculture. She keeps livestock which currently includes 3 cows, 4 oxen and 20 chickens. She also grows apricots, peaches, cherries, nuts, apples and pears. 
Shushik lives with her husband and two sons: Grisha (who is 17 years old) and Vahe (who is 15 years old).
The main income of the family is gathered from selling their harvest and milk products in the local markets. It is very important for Shushik to expand her agricultural business. As a result, she has applied for this loan. With the loan's help she will purchase a heifer. She plans to grow and fatten it, then sell it for a higher price.
Shushik hopes that the loan will help her to increase her income and she will be able to ensure a better future for her sons.

loans.use: to pay for a heifer

loans.name: Lkhagva

texts.en: Mr. Lkhagva, who is 43 years old, lives with his wife and children in Darkhan, which is the second largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Before moving to the house, they resided in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) on another person's land. His elder daughter studies at the university of technology. His older son has graduated from his vocational course and now works as an electrician in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His younger daughter goes to high school while his youngest child attends kindergarten. Since 2006, he has begun rendering transportation services to local people using his own mini-van. In 2010, he purchased another mini-van and paid its' full price in January, 2011. In February, 2012 he rented another mini-van and employed one driver. His wife helps him by executing the role of money collector. This time of year, the price of automobiles is usually low compared with other seasons so he is requesting a loan of 6800000 MNT to purchase a car which runs on natural gas. The advantage of a car which runs on natural gas is that it emits less smoke and generates only harmless chemicals to atmosphere. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who is responsible and reliable. Purchasing a natural gas powered automobile is definitely reflective of his responsibility in all aspects.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile which runs on natural gas

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en: Clarisse is 22 years old, married and the mother of one child, who is four years old. Her husband earns a living by building houses while she works several jobs, including selling fruit. She is requesting this loan to buy more fruit to sell to her customers. With the profits she earns from her work, she plans to start building her own home.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Telman

texts.en:
Telman, 46, lives with his wife and twenty-three-year-old son in a small village in the Marneuli district. He is a hardworking person with a great deal of agricultural experience.  Telman and his family earn their living through agricultural business. Within their greenhouse they grow different kinds of greens, tomatoes and onions. He sells his products at the local open market. Additionally, Telman’s son works as a welder and earns a monthly income. 
Telman is applying for a 1000 GEL loan through LLC to repair their second greenhouse. He must buy iron materials to fix the framework. When the greenhouse is repaired, it will retain the warmth needed, and the family will harvest more produce and as a result, their income will increase. 
Telman plans to use the increased profits to expand their business and improve the family’s living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to repair his greenhouse

loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en: Mrs. Dulamsuren, 53 years old, lives with her husband in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Her two children live separately from their parents and are both married. Her husband has been running his excavator renting business since 1998. From March to October, her husband rents his excavator to others. She herself has worked at a flour mill since 1980. In 1995 the flour mill stopped its operation so she lost her job. In 2008, she began working as a distribution manager at a private business entity and also works as a manager at a foreign language learning center. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years so she is requesting a loan of 6800000 MNT to renovate and insulate her house by purchasing necessary construction materials such as bricks, press board and cotton. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place. An insulated and renovated house doesn’t lose heat thus reducing the consumption of coal. Decrease in coal usage in one household is a significant contribute to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Avag

texts.en: Avag lives in the town of Jermuk with his wife and two daughters. About two years ago, he started a sewing business and he now needs to improve it by making some investments. He has applied for this loan to renovate his sewing machine and buy some fabric. This is important to Avag because it will allow him to stay competitive by completing current orders and improving the quality of his work.

loans.use: to renovate his sewing machine and buy fabric.

loans.name: Pacifique

texts.en: Pacifique is 24 years old and has earned a living for the last six years by selling children's clothing. She is requesting this loan to buy more clothing to sell to her customers. She will use the additional income she earns to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, Pov is 51-year-old mother of three children. She is a rice farmer on 2.5 hectares of farmland in the local area. She also supplements her family’s income by raising cows in the backyard. Having been in the business for 31 years, Pov earns a daily income from her current business of 8,500 KHR and is able to save about 3,000 KHR per day after expenses for future needs.

Pov’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle. Pov fully paid back the past loan, which has helped her to have enough household supplies for her family to use. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 160,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials to construct a decent latrine. She'll need cement, bricks, a latrine pan, etc. Pov hopes that this loan will enable her family to have a clean latrine for daily use, so as to improve their standard of living by making the family healthier.

loans.use: To buy materials to construct a decent latrine

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 28 years old, who is married and is a father of one child. He lives with his parents and his brother. Both Abbas and one of his parents provide the family income.

Abbas owns a blacksmith shop. He specializes in making doors. He established his business in 2000, and now he has an employee. He has good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area by his excellent reputation.

He is requesting a sum of 2,400 USD to buy specialized equipment for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy specialized equipment

loans.name: Maia

texts.en: Maia lives in the village of Nogha. She is 39 years old and lives with her parents and child. Maia’s father gets a retirement pension while the family earns a living by running a small dairy farm. They use the milk produced by their cows to make cheese, which they sell locally. Maia also sells fruits and vegetables, which she buys wholesale and sells to local shops and in nearby villages. The family also grows nuts on family-owned land. Maia is requesting this loan to buy seasonal clothing to resell. She plans to offer a wide assortment of clothes to people in her area so she can make lots of sales and a good profit. She will reinvest part of this profit in her business, and use the balance to improve her family's living conditions

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Sergo

texts.en: Sergo lives in Chiva village with his wife, mother and three children. A few months ago he started a retail business where he sells building materials. He has applied for this loan to buy more building materials to sell in his shop. This will allow him to satisfy customer demand, stay competitive and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of three young children, ages 11, 9 and 7. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than 10 years now. Her husband works as a mechanic.

Juana dreams of making improvements in her hog-raising business. However, she lacks the financial resources to do so. She joined CEVI to gain access to the loan services offered by the organization to micro-entrepreneurs like her. She is asking for a loan to buy feed and food supplements for the pigs. Any additional revenue generated from the business will be reinvested into the business and used to pay her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy feed and food supplements for pigs.

loans.name: Ket

texts.en:
Working at the rice field from dawn to dusk, Ket is an industrious woman who is always eager to go ahead in her business and provide a better quality of life for her family. She has been working in farming for more than ten years. She gets great support from her spouse, who is currently employed as a construction worker for a daily wage. Ket is 30 years old and is a loving mother of two school-aged children.

Ket is applying for a loan in the amount of 700 USD to purchase a motorbike, due to the lack of a proper vehicle for their household. This motorbike will allow Ket and her husband to safely travel to their business locations, as well as other places, thereby reducing their daily traveling costs. Ket hopes to increase her earnings and help her children in their future education.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Davaachuluun

texts.en: Mr. Davaachuluun is 53 years old and lives with his wife and son. They live in a ger in Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife Oyun, age 53, works in a local company as an assistant worker. His son Tserendolgor, age 23, is a senior student at university, studying engineering. Mr. Davaachuluun has been running his butcher shop in a local market for years. He has built strong relationships with customers and suppliers over the years. He is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to cover his son's university tuition fee. He is a hardworking and modest man.

loans.use: to pay his son's university tuition fee

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique   es un hombre agricultor de 48  años de edad, el está casado  y  vive en Sololá.  El tiene nueve  hijos de ellos cuatro varones dos trabajan independientemente y  dos estudian en una escuela de la comunidad también  cinco mujeres tres trabajan independientemente y dos  estudian.

El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando papa, cebolla, remolacha, repollo  en una parcela que tiene  donde se ubica su hogar, esto lo aprendió de su padre desde pequeño. Viendo la necesidad de crear su propio negocio decide cultivar y comercializar su propio producto con el apoyo de su familia.
El ahora cuenta con 33 años de realizar su propio cultivo viendo que obtiene ganancias buenas cultivando estas verduras.   De este modo el solicita un préstamo de   Q 5,000.00 para que pueda comprar semillas de papa, zanahoria y su fertilizante para cultivar  y cosecharlo mejorando sus ingresos junto a su familia. 
El sueña que en un futuro el pueda ampliar mas su cultivo en otra parcela para que pueda obtener mayores ganancias, todo con el fin de tener un mejor desarrollo familiar.
texts.en:
Enrique’s a 48-year-old farmer; he’s married and lives in Sololá.  He has nine children, four boys two of which work independently and two who attend the local school; he also has five daughters three of which work independently and two attend school.

He works in agriculture growing potatoes, onions, beets and cabbage on a parcel he has at home.  He learned this from his father when he was a boy.  Needing to start his own business he decided to start growing and selling his own products with support from his family.

He now has 33 years’ experience growing his own crops and he earns good profits from these vegetables.  He’s therefore asking for a 5,000 Quetzal loan to buy potato and carrot seeds and fertilizer to grow and harvest and improve his family’s income.  He dreams in future with being able to expand his crops more into another parcel so that his profits will be higher; all of this is aimed at having better family development.

loans.use: to buy potato and carrot seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Leticia Mariuxi

texts.es: Leticia   vive en el cantón libertad  Tiene 33 años. Es casada  tiene  dos hijos menores. Ella  Tomo la decisión de buscar trabajo para  salir adelante con su familia  y  Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa.  Decide juntar dinero  para dar apertura  a su negocio  de bazar  En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  clientes necesarios.  Leticia  trabaja en su negocio  diariamente. Con el préstamo  el comprara camisas, papelería,  juguetes, suministros, etc. su meta es poder  mejorar sus ingresos  y agrandar su negocio.
texts.en: Leticia lives in Libertad Canton.  She’s 33-years-old and has two minor children.  She decided to seek work to get ahead with her family and since no one would hire her to work in a firm she decided to gather money together to open her own business.  She opened a store that has been growing to date and now has the required clientele.  Leticia works in her store daily and will use the loan to buy shirts, stationery supplies, toys, ingredients, etc.  Her goal is to be able to improve her income and enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy stationery supplies and toys.

loans.name: Elmadin

texts.en:
Elmadin is 29 years old. He lives in the small village of Marneuli district with his parents. His father receives a retirement pension. Elmadin works as a painter and gets a monthly income. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 3 calves and a greenhouse, where tomatoes are grown. Their harvested products are sold locally at a good price. Elmadin is a very hard working young man and has extensive experience in his business. 

He requested a loan to purchase a milk cow. After purchasing a milk cow, they will be able to produce dairy products and sell them. This will increase the family's income. With the increased income they will improve their living conditions. Elmadin awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 50 years old, married, and she supports a family of ten. She runs a retail shop in Marigat town and this has been her income generating business for the last 13 years.  She makes an average monthly income of 35,000 KES.
