She has borrowed a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase more stock of maize flour, tea leaves, and crates of soft drinks to sell in her retail shop. She anticipates making profits which she will use to expand her business by increasing the variety of items to meet her client’s needs.

Miriam hopes to improve her living standards and be financially stable.  She also hopes to save money to enable her to pay the school fees for her children, as well as expand her business to a wholesale shop

loans.use: To purchase more stock of maize flour, tea leaves, and crates of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 40 years old. She is married, with four children, and they all attend schools. Her husband is a house-builder. Jeanne sells vegetables such as tomatoes, green beans, and carrots. A loan of RWF 400,000 helps Jeanne to buy more vegetables for sale. She plans to provide food for the family from the profits.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Burmaa

texts.en:
Burmaa, 59 years old, lives with her husband in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. Their children are married and now live separately from their parents. She and her husband have retired from work and get a state pension. 

For the upcoming Tsagaan sar (Mongolian traditional celebration, White Moon), she wants to renovate her one-bedroom apartment by repairing the kitchen and living room. So, she is requesting a loan of MNT 800,000 to purchase a sofa and some construction materials, such as cement, boards, emulsion, and mastic. As a result, the family can welcome any guest to their renovated house without worrying about its appearance.

loans.use: to repair the kitchen and living room and purchase a sofa.

loans.name: Geraldina

texts.es:
Geraldina, tiene 35 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en una aldea del municipio de Tela, Atlántida.
Geraldina lleva  siete años de dedicarse a la venta de cosméticos como perfumes, lociones, cremas, talcos, maquillaje, desodorantes, etc. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y en su casa. Ella ha mantenido su negocio mediante préstamos, ha solicitado cuatro ciclos de préstamos en ODEF, con el que solicita actualmente que es por 15,000 lempiras, el cual lo utilizara para comprar más cosméticos para la venta. Su objetivo es seguir obteniendo ganancias para seguir ayudando a sus hijos con el estudio.
texts.en: Geraldina, 35, is married and has two children; she lives with them in a village in the municipality of Tela, Atlántida.  She’s been selling cosmetics like perfume, lotion, cream, talc, make-up, deodorant, etc. for seven years.  She sells from place to place and also at home.  She’s stayed in business thanks to loans.  She’s asked ODEF for four loans counting the present one that’s for 15,000 Lempiras she’ll use to buy more cosmetics to resell.  Her objective is to continue earning profits in order to continue supporting her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es: El señor Jose María, tiene 33 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en una aldea  que pertenece al  municipio de San Francisco, Atlántida. Hace 5 años que Jose María, se dedica a su propio negocio. El vende producto de forma ambulante en un vehículo, recorre en su aldea ofreciendo repollo, tomate, zanahorias, papas, lechuga, cebolla, pepino, ajos, chiles, y fruta de temporada. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 12,000.00 lempiras para comprar frutas y verduras para la venta, el necesita surtir y aumentar las ventas para obtener ganancias. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio y  lograr que sus hijos se gradúen y que tengan todas las comodidades que se merecen.
texts.en: José María, 33, is married living with his wife and two children in a village that belongs to the municipality of San Francisco, Atlántida.  He’s been in business for himself for five years.  He sells products from place to place in a vehicle.  He goes through his village offering cabbage, tomatoes, carrots, potatoes, lettuce, onions, cucumbers, garlic, chili peppers and seasonal fruit.  He’s requested a 12,000 Lempira loan to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.  He needs to stock up in order to increase sales and profits.  His goal is to make the business grow and succeed in getting his children to graduate so that they’ll have all the comforts they deserve.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María, tiene 49 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Esparta, Atlántida con su familia.
Doña María, tiene su propia fuente de ingresos, hace 6 años estableció una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como es frijoles, arroz, café, pan, manteca, harina, azúcar, pastas, condimentos, aceite, manteca, sal, verduras y otros abarrotes. Ha invertido varios prestamos a su negocio para mantenerlo surtido. El préstamo actual es el séptimo y es por 15,000 lempiras con el cual va surtir el negocio de productos básicos alimenticios. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio para obtener mejores ganancias para el bienestar personal y familiar.
texts.en: María, 49, is married and has three children.  She lives with her family in a village belonging to the municipality of Esparta, Atlántida.  María has her own source of income.  She opened a grocery store six years ago where she sells basic family staple items like beans, rice, coffee, bread, lard, flour, sugar, pasta, condiments, oil, shortening, salt, vegetables and other grocery items.  She’s invested several loans in her store to keep it stocked.  The current loan is her 7th and it’s for 15,000 Lempiras she’ll use to buy basic food items to stock the store with.  Her goal is to make the business grow to earn higher profits for her personal and family well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is a young farmer from Sisian town. He keeps ten cows and cultivates potatoes. He gets milk and sells it in the local markets. Davit lives with his parents, who are also involved in agriculture. Despite his young age, Davit is a very hard-working farmer and the expansion of his farm is very important to him. 

So, he has applied for this loan to purchase forage to be used to feed the livestock. Since agriculture is the only source of income for this family, this loan is very important for Davit to gather more income and make his parents' lives better.

loans.use: to pay for forage to be used to feed the livestock.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan, thirty-seven, is a married father of two children ages six and ten.  His wife works as a nurse. Together they live in a minority community. In order to earn a living, Ivan runs his own business, a  café bar. He started out with as a very small café and now has managed to expand and grow his business. 

Ivan is now requesting a loan in order to buy new inventory and beverages for his café, which will help him to increase his income even more and improve the living conditions for his family. He hopes that in the future he will be able to open a large café bar in order to achieve his goal of giving his children a better education and future. He would like to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy new inventory and beverages

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 60 years old, married, and has four children.  Presently she resides at Candanay Norte, Siquijor.

She has been in the vegetable business for 30 years and earns 5,000 PHP to support her family's daily needs.

She has been a PMPC member for two years and she requested a loan amounting to 7,000 PHP to purchase more products. In the future, she aims to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase different vegetable products

loans.name: Venuste

texts.en: Venuste is 46 years old. He is married and has five children aged between seven and eighteen. They all go to school. He sells animals such as goats and hens. With the loan, he wants to buy more goats and hens for resale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more goats and hens for sale.

loans.name: Leodegaria

texts.en:
Leodegaria is 70 years old and lives in Bohol, a province in the Philippines. For the past five years, Leodegaria has operated a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items like canned goods, rice, bread and chips and other snack foods, soap and toiletries. This is her source of income. As of now, her business is doing well. 

Leodegaria wants to access a loan to buy materials for house repair like wood, nail, galvanized iron, cement and others. Some of the loan will be used to buy additional stock for her store. Leodegaria is hopeful that one day she will be able to continue expanding her business and experience fullness of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for house repair like wood, nail, galvanized iron, cement and others

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 32 years old. He sells CDs, and DVDs. He has been in the business for five years. With the loan, he wants to buy more CDs and DVDs for sale as well as burning music on them. He would like to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more CDs and DVDs for sale.

loans.name: Fredis Osmar

texts.es:
En el municipio  de san Juan de Limay, comunidad la guaruma vive Fredis Osmar  con su esposa y 4 hijos al que tiene el deber de mantener y darles sus estudios, de profesión, agricultor, en granos básicos y ganadero en  ganado de leche y repasto de novillos. 

Don Fredis  conocido como una persona honesta y emprendedora, tiene más de 15 años de experiencia y trabajar estos rubros, trabaja junto con su familia en su finca que es alta mente productiva y quiere sacarle un buen provecho explotándola en uno de los mejores rubros de la zona como es el ganado.

 solicitando un crédito, para la compra de una  vaca parida y un novillo de engorde,su proyección es engordar el novillo y venderlo para pagar el crédito y dejar como ganancia la compra de la vaca parida.

 Manifiesta que su mayor objetivo es aumentar su hato ganadero con vacas paridas y vender lácteos toda la época del año y hacer de su finca una área más productiva, que le ayudarán a mejorar sus ingresos y por ende el nivel de vida familiar
texts.en:
Fredis Osmar lives in the community of La Guaruma in the municipality of San Juan de Limay, with his wife and four children he needs to support providing then with schooling.  He’s a farmer by profession; he grows basic grains, raises dairy cattle and pastures calves.

Fredis is known as a hardworking, enterprising person.  He has more than 15 years’ experience in these lines of work; he works alongside his family in his farm which is highly productive.  He wants to make good use of it exploiting one of the best lines of work which is raising cattle.

He’s requesting a loan to buy a pregnant cow and a calf to fatten up.  His project is to fatten up the calf in order to sell it to repay the loan and the pregnant cow would be his profit.  He states that his greatest objective is to increase his herd size with pregnant cows and to sell dairy products throughout the year and to make his farm more productive so his income will improve and as a result so will his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a pregnant cow and a calf to raise.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma, tiene 63 años de edad, es casada, sus hijos son independientes, vive con su esposo en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Santa cruz de Yojoa. 
Doña Irma tiene 10 años de haber establecido su negocio de pulpería, donde vende productos básicos alimenticios como ser: azúcar, arroz, manteca, productos de limpieza, churros, refrescos, agua en bolsa, pan, pastillas, frijoles, y otros abarrotes.  La pulpería la ha mantenido surtida mediante la inversión de prestamos, actualmente ha solicitado el quinto préstamo a ODEF que es por 25,000 lempiras para la compra de productos alimenticios para tener variedad y aumentar las ventas. Su meta es hacer de su negocio una fuente de ingresos mayor para su familia.
texts.en: Irma, 63, is married; her children are all independent.  She lives with her husband in a village belonging to the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  Irma opened her grocery store ten years ago where she sells basic food items like sugar, rice, lard, cleaning supplies, snacks, soft-drinks, bagged water, bread, pills and beans, among other grocery items.  She’s kept the grocery store stocked by means of loans.  She’s currently asking ODEF for her 5th loan for 25,000 Lempiras to buy food items in order to have a variety of items to sell thus increasing her sales.  Her goal is to turn her store into a greater source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Milosav

texts.en:
Milosav, forty-two, is single and lives in a minority community. Since he is single he is able to really focus on his business and has much time to invest into doing this. For many years he had been operating his own business, a boutique, however two years ago he changed the type of business he wanted to own and he opened a fast food shop.  It is located near a school and he usually serves students. Milosav is very busy because he makes delicious food and has many return and regular customers.

He is now in a need of a loan in order to buy inventory and to do some renovations in the front of his fast food store. The loan will help him to make more income. In the future he hopes to expand his business even further and he wants to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy inventory and to do renovations

loans.name: Lamzira

texts.en:
Lamzira is 44 years old, married, and has two sons. She lives in a small village of Senaki District. Lamzira’s younger son works at vulcanization and gets a small monthly salary. Lamzira and her husband are busy with agricultural activities. They have six milk cows; every day they produce cheese and curds and sell them at the local open market. They also have a plot of land where nuts and maize are grown. The family does all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. In addition they own a pig and sell piglets seasonally.

 Lamzira is requesting a loan to purchase a truck. Her husband will be able to provide goods transportation services to local people. The family will earn additional income. They will also use the truck for transportation of their harvested produce. Using their own truck instead of a rented one will decrease transportation costs and increase their profit, which will be used to repair their house.

loans.use: to purchase a truck

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine lives in Artashat town with her 16-year-old son. She opened a beauty salon one year ago and now due to her hard work and kindly attitude towards people she has a lot of loyal clients. Now she needs some investment in order to be able to continue to satisfy current market demand. She has applied for this loan to purchase chairs which she needs in her salon, and a sewing machine. The sewing machine will help her to offer sewing services to clients, which will significantly increase Hermine's income.

The loan is very important for Hermine to expand her business and ensure a better future for her son.

loans.use: to pay for a sewing machine and chairs

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en: Jeannette, aged 41, is married with three children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for two years. With the loan, she wants to buy more foodstuffs such as bananas, rice, and potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy bananas, rice, and potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 25 years old, married, and supports a family of three. Her spouse supports her in meeting some of their financial needs. Zipporah runs a clothing shop in Marigat town. She has been in the business for six years. Her monthly income from the business is KES 43,000. 

She is borrowing her second loan of KES 100,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stocks of assorted clothes for sale in her business. She plans to use the additional income to reinvest in the business as well as save some for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of assorted clothes for sale.

loans.name: Leoniso

texts.en:
Leoniso is a 54-year-old married man and a father of a grown up son.  He is from Talibon, Bohol. He has been involved for several years in the food vending business together with his wife. They sell home-cooked food to the people in their place.

Leoniso wants to avail a loan to buy ingredients for food vending such as flour, bananas, cooking oil, and sugar. With this, he and his wife will be able to cook more snack foods, and increase their profit and income. Leoniso hopes of making their business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food vending such as flour, bananas, cooking oil, and sugar

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with two children; both go to school. She has a business of a grocery shop. She has been in this business for three years. 

Susan has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more soda, sugar and rice. She generates additional income through tailoring. She works seven days a week in a shop that she rents and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

Susan aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house. The house has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more soda, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Cesarie

texts.en: Cesarie is 45 years old. She is married with three children and they all attend schools. She would like to add vegetables to her business; this loan will be for buying more tomatoes and ripe bananas for sale. With the profits from the business, Cesarie wants to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 44 years old and from Olkalou. He is married with four children, all of whom are in school.

Joseph is a farmer and has been doing this for the past five years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy a heifer. 

He hopes to build rental houses in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Bautista Saavedra  de la ciudad de El Alto.

El actualmente esta estudiando en la Universidad en la ciudad de La Paz la Carrera de Administración de Empresas  y actualmente desempeña las funciones de ayudante de carpintería en el negocio de su tío en la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de estudio (un par de libros, un programa de computación para cargar a su computadora) y de esta manera continuar estudiando y salir profesional.

El sueño de Gustavo Nicolás es ser Administrador de Empresas.

Es la Segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Gustavo’s single and has no children.  He lives in his parents’ house located in the city of El Alto’s Bautista Saavedra zone.  He’s currently attending a university in the city of La Paz majoring in business administration and also works as a helper in his uncle’s carpentry shop in the city of El Alto.  He needs the loan to buy study materials (a pair of textbooks and computer software to loan into his computer) so that he can continue with his studies and become a professional.  Gustavo Nicolas’ dream is to become a business leader.  This is his second IMPRO loan request and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy textbooks for his business administration courses.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.es:
La señora Sharon tiene dos hijos, vive en casa de un familiar ocupando una habitación con un acabado de ladrillo y piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de valle hermoso de la ciudad de La Paz.

Sharon trabaja de forma independiente realizando tejidos de mantas de cholita, ya es su único ingreso económico trabaja por más de ocho horas al día, para cubrir los gastos de alimentación, servicios básicos, vestimenta de su familia.

El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima, como ser: telas, lanas, cintas y otros materiales con los que ella pueda trabajar.

El sueño de Sharon es hacer crecer su negocio y además tener un taller, como también mejorar sus ingresos,  y calidad de vida. 

Es la primera vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en: Sharon has two children.  She lives in the family home occupying one bedroom with brick walls and dirt floor; the house is located in the city of La Paz’s Valle Hermoso zone.  Sharon works independently weaving traditional fabrics.  This is her only source of income and she works more than 8 hours daily to cover her family’s food, utility and clothing costs.  She needs the loan to buy raw materials like fabric, yarn, ribbons and other supplies she needs to do her work.  Sharon’s dream is to make the business grow and to have a workshop; she also wants to improve her income and quality of life.  This is her first time with IMPRO and with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy knitting supplies.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum, aged 36, is a very responsible, honest and hardworking woman. Her husband and four children live with her in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province, while her oldest child got married and is settled in his individual house. Her income is what she earns from growing seasonal rice crops on her own farm. She receives support from her husband and their children to accomplish these activities each year.
 
Chum has taken out several loans with HKL and they have been punctually repaid. She now wants to invest this Kiva loan in purchasing a cow to help her in her farm work. The impact of the loan is that she can reduce the operating costs of farming and save more profit for future emergencies of her family. She wants to have a plentiful harvest this year. Her dreams are to have a successful business, obtain more income, improve her home and educate her children up to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to help her in her farm work.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is glad about the developments in his business. He received good income from the previous loan which helped him repay the loan on time. He is currently also employed as a court clerk.

He is applying for a loan of 62,650 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of charcoal. The challenge in the business has been that when it rains, the roads are unaccessible, since charcoal is found in the interior.

The additional income from the loan will help David pay for school fees, add stock of charcoal, and repay the loan faster.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Jisele

texts.en: Jisele is 34 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. She sells fabrics and has spent seven years in the business. With the loan, she wants to buy more fabrics to make clothes. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to make clothes for sale.

loans.name: Frazia

texts.en:
Frazia is 31 years old. She is a mother of two children. She has been selling bananas for a few months.

Frazia has requested a loan to buy more bananas and tomatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Aline

texts.en:
Aline is 28 years old. She sells cloth and has spent seven years in the business. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more fabrics for sale. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics for sale.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
El señor Rodrigo no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres, ocupando una habitación con un acabado fino y piso de machimbre, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Escobar Uria de la ciudad de La Paz.

Rodrigo, estudió hasta el nivel técnico medio, actualmente trabaja de forma independiente realizando mantenimiento de computadoras ya que es su único ingreso económico. Trabaja por más de ocho horas al día desde su domicilio ya que no cuenta con un taller.

El crédito lo requiere para el incremento de su capital, como ser: monitores, teclados, Mouse y otros para repararlos y venderlos a un precio relativamente mayor. 

El sueño de Rodrigo es tener un taller propio, donde pueda dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.  

Es la primera vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en: Rodrigo does not have any children.  He lives in his parents’ house occupying one bedroom with wood flooring and finished walls.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Escobar Uria zone.  Rodrigo studied up to mid-technical level and currently works independently servicing computers; this is his only source of income.  He works more than 8 hours daily at home since he does not have a workshop.  He needs the loan to increase his capital buying monitors, keyboards, mice and others to repair and resell at a relatively higher price.  Rodrigo’s dream is to have a workshop of his own where he can provide better customer service.  This is his first time with IMPRO and with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy computer equipment to repair and resell.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a 36-year-old father of one child, who is 4.  He has a motorcycle transport business. He is married to Joyce and they all live in Nakuru town. He has been in the transport business for five years and it has been profitable.

This being his first loan term, he plans to buy another motorcycle for his transport business within Nakuru town. This will enable him to generate more income, which he will use to open a retail shop for his wife.

Kennedy hopes to expand his transport business in the future by buying a lorry for transporting goods.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 37 years old. She is married with three children. Her husband works as a house builder. With the loan, she wants to buy more Iron sheets and many other construction materials for sale. Francine would like to use the profits for paying school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more iron sheets and other construction materials for sale.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is a 58-year-old  married woman from Baclayon, Bohol. She has three children. The youngest child is 16. She is engaged  in selling  various  merchandise like household utensils, slippers and clothes. She requested a loan of 25,000 PHP  to  buy more merchandise to sell like  slippers, garments and household utensils to supply the needs of her customers.  

Gaudiosa would like to invest in  other business  ventures to generate more income as well as to expand her present business to support her family's basic needs including the   college education of her youngest child for her bright future.

loans.use: to buy more  merchandise to sell like slippers, garments and  household utensils

loans.name: Geghanush

texts.en: Geghanush is a 58-year-old mother of 6 daughters and is involved in agriculture. She keeps livestock which currently includes 3 cows and 20 chickens. She also owns agricultural land where she grows peaches, apricots, pears and cherry trees. It is very difficult for Geghanush to sustain such a big family so she has applied for this loan. The loan will help her to purchase seeds for cultivation and forage for feeding animals. She hopes that this will increase her income and allow her to ensure a better future for her daughters.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Mariquita

texts.en:
Mariquita is a 55-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She makes a living through hog raising. She has been in the business for more than five years now.

Mariquita needs a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her business and generate more revenue. In the future, Mariquita hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Angerique

texts.en:
Angerique is 28 years old. She sells vegetables and has been selling these items for the past six years. 

She has requested the loan in order to buy more tomatoes, green beans, and potatoes for sale. With the profits from the business, she will try her best to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla  vive en  el suburbio. Tiene 31 años. Es soltera .tiene un hijo menor de edad. Ella a raíz de su separación de su ex pareja,  Tomo  la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir con la educación de su  hijo y Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. Ella decide juntar dinero  para dar apertura  a su negocio de costura en general  En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  una clientela.
Karla  trabaja en su negocio sola   diariamente, ella se dirige a su trabajo a las 6 am de la mañana a dejar a su  hijo  en la escuela. Con el préstamo comprara  tela, hilos, botones, etc. su meta es que sus hijos termine sus estudio tener ingreso para mejorar su negocio y su vivienda
texts.en:
Karla lives in El Suburbio.  She’s 31-years-old and has a minor son.  As a result of her separation from her ex-spouse, she decided to look for work to continue paying for her son’s schooling but when no one would hire her to work for a firm she decided to gather money together to start her own general sewing business.    Her business has gradually grown and now has a regular clientele.  

Karla works by herself in her business every day.  She heads to work at 6 in the morning after dropping her son off at work.  She will use the loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, etc.  Her goal is that her son finish his schooling and to earn income to improve her business and her house.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a lady of 37, married to John, and a mother of two children. She sells cosmetics and curtains in Kangemi and has been in this business for seven years. She gets a monthly income of KES 26,000 (Kenya shillings).

This will be Purity's third loan with Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET). She plans to use the entire loan to buy more curtains, cosmetics, and accessories, like bangles, earrings, and chains to sell. In the future, she wants to open a shop.

loans.use: To buy more curtains, cosmetics, and accessories, like bangles, earrings, and chains for resale.

loans.name: Edison Javier

texts.es: Edison  vive en el cantón libertad  Tiene 26 años. Es soltero  no tiene  hijos. El  Tomo la decisión de buscar trabajo para  terminar de estudiar   y  Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa.  Decide juntar dinero  para dar apertura  a su negocio  de venta de calzado En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  clientes necesarios.  Edison  trabaja en su negocio  diariamente. Con el préstamo  el comprara zapatos, sandalias, etc. su meta es poder  mejorar sus ingresos  y agrandar su negocio  obtener mercadería.
texts.en: Edison lives in the canton of Libertad. He is 26 years old.  Edison is single and does not have any children. He made the decision to be done studying and look for work.  Since no one gave him the opportunity to work in a business, he decided to save up the money to open his own business selling footwear. His business has been growing little by little to the point where he now has regular customers. Edison works in his business every day.  With the loan, he will buy shoes and sandals. Edison’s goal is to be able to increase his income and expand his business to include other merchandise.

loans.use: to buy shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Jose Cecilio

texts.es: El señor Jose tiene 47 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de San Francisco de Yojoa junto a su esposa e hijas. Hace un año que don Jose inicio su propio negocio para generar ingresos. El compro una maquina para la elaboración de bolsas plásticas de diferentes tamaños para vender. Su mercado son las pulperías y otros negocios de la zona. Ha  invertido dos prestamos a su negocio, con el que solicita actualmente es el tercero y es por 10,000 Lempiras, que utilizara para comprar la materia prima que es el plástico, para la elaboración de bolsas de diferentes tamaños. Su objetivo es incrementar la producción y sus ingresos y  la clientela para ver el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en: José, 47, is married and has three children.  He lives in a village in the municipality of San Francisco de Yojoa with his wife and daughters.  José started his own business a year ago to generate income.  He bought a machine used to make plastic bags in various sizes to sell.  His market includes grocery store and other business in the zone.  He’s invested two loans into his business and this will be his third.  It’s for 10,000 Lempiras that he’ll use to buy the raw material, which is plastic, to make bags of various sizes.  His objective is to increase production, income and clientele to see his business grow.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to manufacture plastic storage bags.

loans.name: Maria Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Maria Juliana esta casada, tiene 49 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos los cuales están estu8idnado, se dedica ala producción de muebles de madera: roperos, closed, sillas, mesas, etc; inicio este negocio juntamente con su esposo y hasta el momento lleva 20 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de madera, pino colorado y pino  blanco, tiner, pinturas, etc; ya que actualmente tiene un encargo grande de muebles y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad de vender y tener una buena ganancia. Espera en el futuro contar con mas trabajadores.
texts.en:
María Juliana’s married.  She’s 49-years-old and completed the six years of elementary education.  She has four children who are attending school.  She works manufacturing wood furniture like armoires, closets, chairs, tables, etc.  She started this business with her husband and to date has 20 years’ experience.  Her husband helps her out economically.

She’s asking for a loan she’ll use to buy lumber, red pine, white pine, thinner, paint, etc. since she has a large pending furniture order and she wants to take advantage of this sales opportunity and earn  good profit.  She hopes in future to hire more workers.

loans.use: to buy lumber to make furniture.

loans.name: Ivette  Del Rosario

texts.es:
La Joven Ivette del Rosario posee un taller de costura el cual utiliza para la elaboración de distintas estilo de ropa tales como pantalones, camisas y otros artículos para vestir.

Ella compra las telas, hilos y los diferentes insumos que utiliza para su negocio, inició su negocio con ayuda de su mama el cual le heredo el arte de la confección negocio con el cual pudo triunfar en su mayor sueño el cual coronar su carrera universitaria para darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.

Doña Ivette solicita un crédito a Ceprodel el que  utilizara en la compra de tela y estar lista para la entrada a clases y así darle a su clientela la satisfacción de que sus hijos ingresen a clase con un uniforme de muy buena calidad para obtener más ingresos y lograr un mejor nivel de vida de ella y su familia. Ella sueña  que su negocio siga creciendo cada día más.
texts.en:
Young Ivette del Rosario has a sewing workshop she uses to make various styles of clothing like pants, shirts and other articles of clothing.  She buys fabric, thread and various supplies used in her business.  She started it with help from her mother who taught her to sew.  The business led to her succeeding in reaching her greatest dream which was to graduate from university to give her family a better standard of living.

Ivette is asking Ceprodel for a loan she’ll use to buy fabric so she can be ready for the start of the school term and satisfy customer demand for quality uniforms for their children who are starting classes.  Ivette will earn more income and attain a better standard of living for her and her family.  She dreams with her business growing more every day.

loans.use: to buy fabric for uniforms.

loans.name: Dieudonne

texts.en: Dieudonne is 30 years old. He is married to a farmer; they currently have no child. Dieudonne sells spare motorcyle parts. With the loan, he wants to buy more spare parts to sell. With the profits from the business, he needs to provide food in abundance for his family.

loans.use: to buy more spare motorcycle parts for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabet tiene 27 años, madre de la pequeña Valery de 7 añitos se encuentra  soltera y es catalogada como una mujer muy trabajadora.
Reside en una vivienda construida a base de material noble en calidad de alquiler.
Optó desde hace 7 años incursionar en el negocio de la venta de frutas en donde hallo un buen ingreso para su familia. 
Inicialmente desempeñaba su labor frente en diversos puntos de su localidad de manera informal  logrando con el tiempo ser admitida por el mercado de abastos de su localidad en donde hasta hoy ha logrado consolidar su negocio.
Semanalmente recepciona los pedidos y cajas de frutas que solicita a la capital y gradualmente los va expendiendo en su puesto en donde las manzanas y uvas son los productos que mas demanda posee.
A modo obtener capital de respaldo para seguir trabajando de manera fluida tiene en mente ampliar su stock de frutas con algunas variedades como lúcuma y demás variedad de uvas a solicitud de sus clientes.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan a aperturar un negocio con mayor capacidad. Desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para sus próximos pedidos dentro de los cuales está la lúcuma, variedades de uvas y manzana delicia.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 27, is the mother of little Valery, 7.  She’s single and is described as a very hardworking woman.  She lives in a rented house made out of substantial materials.  Seven years ago she decided to go into the fruit selling business which has become a good source of family income.  At the beginning, she started out selling informally in various spots around her community and in time succeeded in being admitted to the local wholesale foodstuffs market where she’s been able to consolidate her business to date.  She receives weekly deliveries of crates of fruit she orders from the capital and she gradually displays them in her stand; apples and grapes are the products in highest demand.

In order to obtain back-up capital to continue working fluidly, she’s thinking about expanding her stock with some other varieties like eggplant and other grape varieties her customers are requesting.  Her future plan is aimed at opening a larger business.  She needs 2,000 new soles for her next orders which will be for eggplant, grape varieties and Delicious apples.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 28 years old. She sells eatable animals and has spent four years dealing in this business. With the loan, she wants to buy more eatable animals such as rabbits, hens, and goats for sale. With the profits from the business, she will build a house.

loans.use: to buy more rabbits, hens, and goats for sale.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is a farmer living in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He is a married man and a father of two young children. Renato has been in the rice farming business for more than five years now.

Renato needs a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm, and to buy food for daily consumption. 

Renato hopes of expanding his farm and save money for future schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and to buy food for daily consumption

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is a married woman from Baclayon, Bohol. She has four children.  The youngest child is 14 while the oldest is 22. She is a fish vendor. She sells fish in her community. She has been in the fish vending business for 23 years. She requested a loan of  30,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell, containers (for fish storage) and  a new weighing scale. She works hard to earn a living. Her husband helps her to make their business prosper in order to  cover the family's  daily needs. In the future, Remedios would like to  invest in other business ventures to augment her income and to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy  more fish to sell, containers (for fish storage) and a  new weighing scale

loans.name: Venegre Noama Group

texts.fr:
Mme T.THERESE  est responsable du groupe  VENEGRE NOAMA. Mariée, elle est mère d’un enfant. Il est  âgé de 06 ans. Il ne  va pas  à l’école et elle a 01 personne  en charge.
Mme vend des habits depuis 04ans.  Elle s’approvisionne aux  marchés  de  secteur 10. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes et les filles.
Elle veut s’acheter  20 complets pour enfants et 05 pièces de pagne.	
Elle  veut  épargner ses bénéfices  pour s’acheter un motocycle. Mme  ambitionne avoir un moyen de déplacement pour facilité son activité et ouvrir une boutique de vente d’habits dans le futur.
texts.en:
Mrs. Therese is the representative of the group Venegre Noama. She is married and the mother of one child. Her child is 6 years old; he does not attend school. Mrs. Therese has one person in her care. Mrs. Therese has been selling clothing for 4 years. She stocks up at local markets in sector 10.

Mrs. Therese's customers are men, women, and girls. She wants to purchase 20 children's outfits and 5 pieces of cloth. She wants to save her profits to be able to buy herself a motorcycle. Mrs. Therese's goal is to have a method of transportation to help her business and to someday open a clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase 20 children's outfits and 5 pieces of cloth

loans.name: Carmen Magdalena

texts.es: Carmen  vive en orquídeas. Tiene36  años. Es soltera  no tiene  hijos. Ella toma la decisión de buscar trabajo para seguir  adelante  y superarse. Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. Ella decide juntar dinero que tenia para dar apertura  a su negocio de  comercio en general.  En la actualidad su ventas poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  clientela  necesaria. Ella trabaja sin horario .Con el préstamo comprara  cosméticos  ,jabones , esmaltes, varios, etc. su meta es tener su negocio en el centro de la ciudad  y tener salud para seguir trabajando
texts.en: Carmen lives in Orquideas. She is 36 years old. She is single and does not have any children.  Carmen made the decision to look for work to get ahead and excel. Since no one gave her the opportunity to work in a business, she decided to save up her money to open her own store. Carmen’s sales have grown little by little until she now has enough customers. She does not have a set work schedule. With the loan, Carmen will buy various cosmetics, soaps, nail polishes, etc. Her goal is to have her own business downtown and to have the health to continue working.

loans.use: to buy various soaps, cosmetics, nail polishes, etc.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys de 32 años es considerada por sus amigas como una mujer muy trabajadora y de amplia responsabilidad para con su familia, aun sin hijos espera formar su hogar al lado de un hombre responsable y cariñoso.
Posee una vivienda construida a base de material noble en donde actualmente residen sus padres.
Dedicada a su casa optó como mujer a emprender y mejorar su economía familiar a través de su trabajo, es cuando motivada por sus cuñados optó por iniciarse en la venta de carnes.
Lleva 8 años en el negocio en donde inicialmente lo hacia de manera informal para luego a través de su municipio otorgarle un puesto en el mercado de abastos de su localidad.
Para el normal desempeño de su trabajo debe solicitar el pedido de reses vivas a distintas zonas alto andinas de su  región para luego ser enviarlos al camal local y posteriormente expenderlos en su puesto donde se caracteriza por brindar los mejores cortes frescos y a precios sin competencia.
A causa de muchos años de trabajo considera que su labor es muy abnegada y no lo cambiara por el momento.
Al iniciarse la temporada de lluvias en su localidad el precio de las reses sufre un incremento en el precio, es por ello que debe realizar el pedido con capital disponible  y de manera anticipada.
Desea a futuro aperturar un negocio del mismo rubro en su domicilio y lograr contar con maquinas cortadoras los cuales no son posibles instalarlos  en su puesto a falta de espacio. Este es su primero crédito por el cual se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada y espera seguir trabajando con el entusiasmo que la caracteriza para demostrar su puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas. 
Para seguir trabajando de manera fluida desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para el próximo pedido de reses a sus proveedores.
texts.en:
Gladys, 32, is considered by her girlfriends to be a very hardworking woman who is very responsible with her family.  Still childless she hopes to form a home alongside a responsible, affectionate man.  She owns a house built of substantial materials where her parents live currently.  She’s devoted to her home and decided as a woman to become an entrepreneur to improve her family’s economy by means of her work.  Encouraged by her brothers-in-law she started selling meat.  She’s been in this business for 8 years.  She started out doing it informally until her municipality eventually granted her a stand in the local wholesale foodstuffs market.

Her usual way of working requires her to order live cattle from various zones in the high Andean regions that are sent to the local slaughterhouse and she subsequently sells them in her stand where she’s noted for offering the best fresh cuts at incomparable prices.  After many years of work, she considers her work to be very demanding but she wouldn't change it for now.

When the rainy season starts in her location the price of cattle increases which is why she must have capital on-hand to place her orders ahead of time.  She hopes in future to open the same kind of business at home and to have meat saws she’s unable to install at her stand for lack of space.

This is her first loan and she feels very grateful for the opportunity provided; she hopes to continue working with the same enthusiasm that characterizes her to be punctual with her installment payments.  In order to be able to continue working with efficiency, she needs 1,000 new soles for her next cattle order to her suppliers.

loans.use: to buy beef.

loans.name: Mikhail

texts.ru:
Михаил женился полтора года назад. И вместе со своей супругой решил продолжить фермерское дело, которым занимался вместе с родителями.

Михаил выращивает овощи на своем участке. У него есть одна теплица. Михаил полон сил и энергии. Он хочет развивать бизнес, строить новые теплицы. Со временем планирует сделать ремонт в доме.

Михаил просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 17,000 гривен на закупку угля для отопления теплицы.
texts.en:
Mikhail got married a year and a half ago. Together with his wife, he decided to continue the farming activities which he was engaged in with his parents.

Mikhail grows vegetables on his plot of land. He has one greenhouse. Mikhail is full of strength and energy. He wants to develop the business, building new greenhouses. Over time, he plans to do repairs in the home. 

Mikhail is requesting a loan of 17,000 hryvnia to purchase coal for heating greenhouses.

loans.use: закупить уголь для отопления теплицы

loans.name: Evgeniy

texts.ru: Евгений занимается выращиванием овощей на протяжении 12 лет.  Он трудолюбивый и ответственный. Евгений решил сделать отопление в теплицах, чтобы получать ранний урожай. Также у него есть свободный участок земли, на котором он планирует со временем поставить новые теплицы. Евгений просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 15000 гривен на устройство отопления для теплиц.
texts.en:
Evgeniy has been engaged in growing vegetables for over 12 years. He is hardworking and responsible. Evgeniy decided to make heating for greenhouses in order to get an early harvest. He also has a free plot of land on which he plans eventually to put a new greenhouse. 

Evgeniy is asking for a loan of 15,000 hryvnia for a device for heating greenhouses.

loans.use: to heat greenhouses

loans.name: Mirando Al Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Mirando al Futuro” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; feriantes, peluquería, venta de muebles, panadería, centro de llamados, artesanía, venta de masas, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillan.
Maria, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie al fondo del grupo, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, usa anteojos y su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa nueva y usada, desde hace 1 año. Comenta que trabaja el sábado en la feria libre y los otros días lo hace de domicilio en domicilio.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en la ciudad de Santiago y la compra según temporada y por docena a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente
Con el crédito comprará toallas, poleras, ropa interior, paños de cocina y cortinas.
Una de las metas de Maria es ser independiente, tener un negocio establecido y poder tener un vehículo para desplazarse tranquilamente cuando realice las compras de su mercadería, así con esto generar mayores ingresos y optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Maria vive junto a su esposo y  tres hijos de 15, 10 y 2 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral son continuar con su negocio y a nivel familiar darles una buena educación para que sean grandes profesionales.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones. 
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This community bank is called "Mirando al Futuro" (Looking to the Future) and it is comprised of 17 entrepreneurs who work in different businesses, among which are: running fairs, a hairdresser, a furniture seller, a baker, a call center, crafts, making dough, and services. All the members are from the city of Chillan.
Maria is a member of the community bank who, in the photo, is standing at the back of the group in the first position from right to left, wears glasses and has dark brown hair.
She works selling new and used clothes and has been doing this for a year. She says that she works on Saturday in the free fair and on the other days she sells from door to door. 
She buys the supplies that she needs in the city of Santiago and she buys according to the season and by the dozen at low cost, as this makes economic sense. 
She will use the loan to buy towels, shirts, underwear, kitchen cloths, and curtains.
One of Maria's goals is to be independent, to have an established business, and to have a vehicle so she can easily travel when she needs to buy supplies. In this way, she would generate greater income and have a greater quality of life.
Maria lives with her husband and three children who are 15, 10, and 2 years old. Her work dreams are to continue with her business and her family dream is to give her children a good education so that they can be good professionals. 
She is very happy and appreciative of the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza as it enables her to invest in her business. She remarks that the trainings have been vital for her business and also for her personal development, as she has learned to organize and distribute her income and savings in a better way.
Chillán is a community in the central zone of Chile. It's name means seat of the sun in Mapudungun, the language of the indigenous Mapuches. 
Cillán is known as the Cradle of the Country or the Land of Artists  because many distinguished people in the history of Chile were born there such as, for example, the well known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy towels, shirts, underwear, kitchen towels, and curtains.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en: Nona is 23 years old. She lives in a suburb of the capital city with her husband, parents-in-law and two infant children. Nona works as a baker at a bakery and her mother-in-law is a cook. Both family members get a monthly salary. Nona has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but she hasn't had any success. She wants to start a bakery and a confectionery, but her loan request has always been rejected in the past because of her lack of experience, which is usually required by local credit providers. Nona has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Nona will start up her own confectionery shop. She will renovate the rented store, purchase stock and equipment for baking and bake different kinds of cakes and cookies. Nona hopes her project will be profitable as she already has the baking experience and will offer quality products to her customers. This will increase her sales volume. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to start up a confectionery

loans.name: Violette

texts.en: Violette is aged 33. She is married and has three children aged between four and seven, and are enrolled in school. Her husband works as a tax collector. She sells clothes and has been in the business for 4 years. She wants to save money from the profits that will be obtained from the business.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes for sale

loans.name: 3.11.221.tt Vạn Hà Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Quý works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Mrs. Quý is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children.  Mrs. Quý is the group leader of the 3.11.221.TT Vạn Hà solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

Mrs. Quý supports 3 dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Mrs. Quý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Mrs. Quý has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Mrs. Quý has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.  With her business profit, Mrs. Quý hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: 3.11.225.tt Vạn Hà Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chiến  operates a food stall selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables and resell them.

Chiến  is 54 years old and she is married with one child. Chiến  is the group leader of the 3.11.225.TT Vạn Hà  solidarity group, which consists of eight members. Chiến does not support any dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Chiến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Chiến  has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Chiến  has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Chiến hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and resell them.

loans.name: Dyrle

texts.en:
This is Dyrle, 39, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is still single, but she is hoping to have a family of her own. She is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses and needs.

Dyrle operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Dyrle is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages, to expand her product inventory. She expects an expansion in her business income as she enlarges her business. 

Dyrle hopes to expand her business. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.es:
Leonora tiene 26 años y a Leonardo de 28 con quien comparte una linda vida conyugal. Como complemento de felicidad tiene a sus 2 pequeños Franklin y Melissa de 8 y 6 años respectivamente.
Vive en una vivienda construida a base de madera que fue heredado de sus padres. Inicialmente como ama de casa y con las atenciones del caso a Leonardo quien tiene por oficio la albañilería optó por apoyar a la economía familiar a través de la venta de calzados para damas  y niños.
Con los ahorros de momento y en un puesto otorgado gracias al municipio de su localidad en el mercado de abastos local se inicio de a pocos llegando a cumplir 4 años con su pequeño stand.
Considera que su negocio va en crecimiento pues hasta hoy es un sólido sustento para su economía familiar y ha logrado entablar buenas amistades con sus compañeras y vecinas de puesto.
Como todo negocio es necesario surtir constantemente la mercadería es por ello que acude a su entidad financiera para la compra de más calzados.
Desea a futuro iniciar la construcción de su vivienda y posteriormente reiniciar sus ventas en un local mas amplio y acogedor esperando así incrementar sus ventas  y en efecto sus ingresos. Desea contar con 500 nuevos soles para ser usados como capital en la compra de más calzados para damas y niños cuya demanda sufre un incremento para esta época de lluvias.
texts.en:
Leonora, 26, shares a pleasant married life with Leonardo, 28.  Additional happiness is provided by their two little ones: Franklin and Melissa who are 8 and 6 years of age respectively.  She lives in a wooden house inherited from her parents.  

Initially she was a housewife but decided to help Leonardo, who works in construction, with family economy by means of selling shoes for women and children.  With her savings at the time and thanks to a stand in the local wholesale market granted her by the city she started out; she’s now reached the fourth year with her small stand.  She feels that the business is growing because it’s become a solid source of support for her family economy and she’s established good friendships with her fellow vendors and neighboring stands.  

Like any business, it’s necessary to constantly restock it with merchandise which is why she’s calling on her financial institution to buy more shoes.  She hopes in future to start building her house and move her store into larger, more welcoming quarters to increase sales and income.  She needs 500 new soles to be used as capital to buy more shoes for women and children that are in higher demand due to the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy more women's and children's shoes.

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.ru: Хуршеда живет в городе Вахдат. Ей 30 лет. Она замужем и является матерью четырех детей. Она получила среднее техническое образование, но по специальности так и не работала. Хуршеда выбрала путь торговли. Вот уже 4 лет как Хуршеда работает продавцом в продуктовом магазине своего города. Она продает печенье, шоколад, сахар, чай, кофе и т.д. Хуршеда хочет увеличить товарооборот и закупить большое количество ассортимента товара. Поэтому она обратилась в организацию за кредитом для приобретения продуктов питания в свой магазин.
texts.en:
Khursheda lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 30 years old. She is married and is the mother of four children. She has a technical high school education, but she did not work in her specialty. Khursheda chose the way of trade. 

For the past four years, Khursheda has been working as a shopkeeper at a grocery store in her town. She sells cookies, chocolate, sugar, tea, coffee, and the like. Khursheda wants to increase her inventory and to purchase a large quantity of assorted goods. Therefore, she appealed to the organization for a loan for the purchase of food products for her store.

loans.use: to acquire food products

loans.name: Symbat

texts.ru: Сымбат 42 года, замужем, воспитывает двоих детей. У нее два замечательных сына, оба сына учатся в школе. После развала Советского Союза, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Сымбат начала свой бизнес в животноводстве  со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, ее хозяйство с коровами и баранами приносит около 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.В хозяйстве у Сымбат имеется 1 дойная корова, 3 голов бычка и 4 овцы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сымбат обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух бычков на откорм. Доходы Сымбат планирует вложить в постройку нового сарая в целях обеспечения комфортных условий для содержания скота. И реализовать свою давнюю мечту купить в семью машину.
texts.en:
Symbat is 42 years old, married, and raising two children. She has two wonderful sons who are both in school. 

After the collapse of the Soviet Union, Symbat started her own business in livestock as a main source of income for her family with a starting sum of 5,000 som (KGS). To date, her homestead of cows and sheep brings in about 7,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of dairy and meat products. In her household, Symbat has one dairy cow, three heads of cattle, and four sheep. 

In order to further develop her business, Symbat appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy two calves for fattening. Symbat plans to invest income from the loan to building a new barnto ensure comfortable conditions for the livestock, and to realize her dream to buy a family car.

loans.use: to purchase two bulls

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old and blessed with three children.  Her husband is a business man. She owns a welding business in Mlolongo market and has been in this business for the last eight years.  She makes an income of  25,000 KES per month.

She has good credit history in KADET LTD where she is applying for her second loan of 60,000 KES.  She plans to use the loan to buy more welding materials for sale.

She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children.  She hopes to become the best welder in Mlolongo.

loans.use: To buy more welding materials.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna, de 35 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Royser de 43 años y sus 4 queridos hijos cuyas edades son 13, 12, 8 y el ultimo de tan solo 2 meses de nacido, educa y cría a sus hijos impartiéndoles valores sólidos y buenos modales, además trabaja mucho para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
La actividad que realiza Reyna es la venta de comidas típicas de la zona y asados de carnes como pollo, cerdo y pescado, para ello instala su mesa en el frontis de su casa desde donde atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes. Además, durante la época escolar trabaja brindando desayunos, jugos y otros potajes en su puesto instalado en un colegio de su sector. Lleva en este negocio desde hace 3 años y cuenta con la ayuda de su hija mayor para la preparación de los potajes y la atención de los clientes.
Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y la necesidades de sus pequeños hijos quien es la motivación para seguir progresando, por lo contrario no le gusta cuando los precios de su insumos suben reduciendo sus ganancias pero aun así logra encontrar la rentabilidad en sus ventas, tiene planes de seguir con su negocio y mantenerlo, ampliando con mejores sillas y mesas para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Este es el préstamo número 2 con MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando para seguir con su negocio y avanzar con sus planes. Por otro lado comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues considera que cada uno de sus miembros son personas buenas y cumplidas.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas a precio por mayor para así tener mejores ganancias, tales como arroz, aceites, papas, y demás.
texts.en:
Reyna is a 35 year old woman who is very friendly and hardworking.  She lives in her home with her 43 year old husband, Royser, and her four lovely children aged 13, 12, 8 and the littlest one is only 2 months old.  She educates and raises her children to have strong values and good manners; she works very hard to bring them a better quality of life.  

Reyna makes a living in food sales of the local variety of grilled meats like chicken, pork, and fish.  She sets up tables in front of her home where she serves her customers in a very cordial and friendly manner.  In addition, during the school year she sells breakfast, juices, and other snacks to the local students.  She has been doing this for the last three years and relies on the help of her oldest daughter to prepare the food and serve her customers.  She enjoys her work because it allows her to have a sustainable income which she uses for her home expenses and the necessities of her children whom are her motivation to keep progressing in life.  

On the other hand, she finds it difficult when food costs increase because they lower her profit margins.  Despite this she finds ways to still make profit.  She plans on growing her business and upgrading the tables and chairs so that her customers are more comfortable.  This is her second loan with MFP.  She is very grateful for the financial support that they are giving her so that she can continue growing her business and reaching her goals.  She also feels close to her communal bank because she believes that each member is a good person and good borrower.  With this loan of 1500 Peruvian Sols she will purchase ingredients to prepare her foods so that she can continue her business.  Ingredients such as rice, oil, potatos, and other products.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, potatoes, and other products.

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Zenobia de 31 años tiene el orgullo de tener una linda  convivencia junto a sus 2 pequeños patricia de 11 años y Erica de 2 añitos a quienes dedica lo mejor de si.
Es propietaria de una vivienda construida a base de madera que le cedieron sus padres.
Inicialmente dedicada solo al cuidado de su menor hija decidió con el tiempo incursionar en la venta de productos de primera necesidad de manera informal para posteriormente ser acreedora de un establecimiento en el mercado de su localidad.
Lleva casi 10 años dedicándose al rubro y con el tiempo le permitió entablar muchas buenas amistades.
Con la venta de víveres como arroz, azúcar, verduras y cereales ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia motivo por el cual planea seguir desempeñándose como tal por muchos años más. 
Actualmente desea reabastecer su negocio con más variedad de productos esperando incrementar sus ventas motivo por el cual acude a su entidad financiera.
Tiene en mente iniciar la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble para luego habilitar un local comercial y proceder con la aperturar de un negocio del mismo rubro con la intención de estar al pendiente de sus pequeños quienes aun son muy niños. Desea contar con 2,500 nuevos soles y ser usados como capital para la compra de cereales, verduras y demás conservas esperando así reabastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Zenobia, 31, is proud to have a pleasant life with her two little ones: Patricia, 11, and Erica, 2, who she gives her best to.  She owns a wood house her parents passed on to her.  At first she only cared for her children but in time decided to start selling basic staples informally to eventually be eligible for a stand in her local market.  She’s been in this line of work for almost 10 years now and in time has established good friendships.  Selling food items like rice, sugar, vegetables and cereals she’s succeeded in moving her family forward and plans to continue doing so for many more years to come.

She currently wants to restock her business with more variety of products hoping to increase sales which is why she’s calling on her financial institution.  She has in mind building her house out of substantial materials and then set up a commercial site to open a new business in the same line of work so she can watch over her children who are still very young.  She needs 2,500 new soles to use as capital to buy cereals, vegetables and canned goods to restock her store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to restock her store.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Toto 1 Group

texts.es:
La señora Catarina  esta casada, tiene 42 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 7 hijos 3 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa de toda clase, en la plaza de su localidad, inicio este negocio con poco capital, hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien le apoya económicamente.

Organiza un grupo y solicitan un préstamo que les servirá para la compra de mercadería para la venta, suéteres, playeras, camisetas, calcetines, gorras, bufandas, etc. Espera mejorar su negocio y tener otros puntos de venta.
texts.en:
Catarina is a 42 year-old married woman. She did not have the opportunity to study. She has 7 children, 3 of which are studying. She makes a living selling a wide variety of clothing. She sells in the market close to where she lives. She started this business with very little capital ten years ago. She has the support of her husband, who helps her financially. 

She became a part of the communal bank that is requesting a loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy merchandise to resell, such as sweaters, t-shirts, shirts, socks, hats, scarfs, etc. She hopes to improve her business and have other sales locations.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: 3.11.224.tt Vạn Hà Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoan works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Hoan is 54 years old and she is married with two children. Hoan is the group leader of the 3.11.224.TT Vạn Hà  solidarity group, which consists of four members. One of Hoan's children is grown up so Hoan supports one dependent with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Hoan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hoan has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoan has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Hoan hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Sulait

texts.en:
Sulait used the previous loan to buy more soap and cosmetics for women to sell. He is a 28-year-old married man with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Ten years ago he decided to start a retail shop so as to supplement his agricultural activities and also bring goods nearer to his community. 

Since he mainly deals in women's cosmetics, he is challenged by his failure to meet the different tastes and preferences of his customers due to inadequate capital. He has dreams of educating his children and diversifying his business to include home use items such as soap among others so as to mitigate risks. Sulait intends to use the loan to buy soap and cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soap and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Con 33 años de edad Vilma es una mujer soltera muy abnegada y dedicada a sus 2 motivos de vida Ketty de 16 años y Mayte de 7 añitos.
Comparte de vivencia familiar en su vivienda construida a base de material noble.
Luego de culminar la construcción de su vivienda optó por desempeñar el negocio de alojamientos y hotel desde hace 2 años. Inicialmente tenía dudas en cuanto a desempeñar su negocio optando por alquilarlo a terceros para posteriormente tomar las riendas de su negocio y trabajar para el crecimiento del mismo.
A diario debe estar al pendiente incluso en horas de la madrugada para recepcionar a viajeros y demás visitantes.
A pesar de ello se siente a gusto con su negocio ya que le permite  estar casi siempre con sus hijas.
A manera de gestionar algunas mejoras a su establecimiento tiene en mente realizar el repintado y  mantenimiento de algunos ambientes internos con el apoyo de un maestro de albañilería con el objetivo de optimizar la calidad de su servicio.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan a la construcción de un local de similar magnitud en la capital de su región en donde planea radicar con motivo de brindarles a sus pequeñas una educación superior de calidad. Requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la contrata de un maestro y realizar el mantenimiento de algunos ambientes de su negocio así como para el pintado de algunos interiores.
texts.en:
Vilma, 33, is a single, very self-sacrificing woman who is devoted to her two reasons for living: Ketty, 16, and Mayte, 7. She shares her family life in a house made of substantial building materials.  When she finished building her house, she decided to go into the hotel and room rental business two years ago.  She had doubts at first about how to manage her business so she initially leased it out to third parties and eventually took hold of the reins of her business and worked to make it grow.   She must be watchful even at dawn to receive travelers and other visitors.  Despite this she feels good with her business because it allows her to be by her daughters almost all the time.

In order to carry out some improvements to her establishment she’s thinking about repainting and repairing some of the rooms with help from a master construction worker in order to maximize quality of service.  Her future plan is aimed at building a similar hotel in the regional capital where she plans to relocate to provide her little ones with quality higher education.  She needs 1,000 new soles to hire a master construction worker to repair some of the rooms in her hotel as well as to paint some of the interiors.

loans.use: to hire someone to paint and repair some of the hotel rooms.

loans.name: 3.11.226.tt Vạn Hà Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hằng has a retail business raising cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle-feed for her cattle.

Hằng is 39 years old and she is married with two children. Hằng is the group leader of the 3.11.226.TT Vạn Hà  solidarity group, which consists of eight members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents.

In 2010, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hằng has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hằng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hằng hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle-feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with six children and only two of her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (cousins). She has   a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 10 years, selling to all categories of people, retail.  She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from rental houses. She works seven days a week from her home.  

Sarah's major business challenges include transportation and thieves. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also building more rental houses. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.    Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu has seen her business help the residents by the provision of potable water. She looks forward to increasing the sources of income to her family by opening up a grocery stall. She also would like to increase the number of water tanks and pay for her children's education.

Saumu is applying for a loan of 125,550 KES to buy a water tank, pay school fees, and buy grocery stock to set up a grocery business.

Saumu believes these will increase her income and help her continue providing education to her children.

loans.use: to buy more tanks, pay school fees, and buy grocery stock for her new business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. She cleared the previous loan on time and attributes this to good stocking and high demand.
