Agnes now looks forward to increasing the stock and is applying a loan of 125,600 Kenya shillings to buy firewood and charcoal. This she believes will help her pay for her children’s education with much ease. Her main challenge is the seasonal weather that affects the charcoal business.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and firewood.

loans.name: Wilda

texts.en:
Wilda is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of 10 children from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than 10 years now. 

Wilda is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and feeds for the pigs. With this loan, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business, augmenting her profit and income. Moreover, she also wants to save money for the schooling of her children. Wilda's greatest dream is to see her children become successful professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia, de 56 años de edad, es una mujer amable y trabajadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es conviviente con Teófilo quien es técnico en enfermería y padre de sus 4 hijas.  Vive en compañía de su pareja, 3  hijas y sus 3 nietos en su propia casa la cual compró con su esposo.
La actividad que realiza Ofelia es la venta de abarrotes. Ofrece al público diversas verduras, plátanos, huevos, panes, harina, arroz, aceite, azúcar y otros. Para eso cuenta con un puesto instalado en el frontis de su vivienda, ahí atiende de manera amable y muy cordial a cada uno de sus clientes que llegan a su establecimiento. Trabaja con ayuda de su hija y realiza esta labor desde hace 6 años. Considera rentable su negocio pues le ha permitido salir de sus apuros económicos, así como poder apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar. 
Le gusta su actividad porque le permite estar en su casa y cuidar a sus hijos y nietos. Por lo contrario, no le gusta cuando algunas veces no consigue vender todos sus productos en el tiempo establecido, sobre todo las verduras que perecen en poco días ocasionándole perdida en su inversión, pero eso no la desanima y realiza mejor los cálculos de sus ventas para comprar lo necesario y evitar que se descompongan.  Además tiene planes de continuar y hacer crecer su negocio buscando incrementar sus ventas. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de plátanos, verduras y otros productos como arroz, huevos, aceites y azúcar.
texts.en:
Ofelia is 56 years old, kind, hardworking and has a strong desire to get ahead.  She is married to Teófilo, with whom she has four children.  Teófilo works as a nursing technician.  She lives with her husband, three daughters and three grandchildren in her own home that she bought with her husband.

Ofelia’s business is selling groceries.  She sells vegetables, plantains, eggs, bread, flour, rice, oil and sugar, among other things.  She operates her business from a stall built on the façade of her home.  From here she waits on each one of her customers in a very kind and friendly manner.  Her daughter helps her with the business, which Ofelia has been running now for six years.  She considers her business a success because it has helped her out of her financial difficulties and has allowed her to help her husband with the household expenses.

She likes her business because it allows her to be in her home and look after her children and grandchildren.  On the other hand, she has not liked the few times that she has not been able to sell all of her products before they spoiled – especially vegetables that perish in a few days – causing her to lose her investment.  But this has not discouraged her, and instead she has more carefully calculated her sales so that she can buy only what is necessary and therefore avoid that any products go bad before being sold.

Ofelia plans to continue to grow her business by looking for ways to increase her sales.  With the requested amount of 2000 PEN, she will buy plantains, vegetables and other products such as rice, eggs, oil and sugar.

loans.use: to buy plantains, vegetables and other products such as rice, eggs, oil and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.en:
Alfonsa is a 39-year-old married woman from Baclayon, Bohol. She is the mother of a 12-year-old daughter.

Alfonsa is engaged in a candle making business. Aside from candle making, she is engaged in a fish vending business. She has been in the candle making business for years. 

She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase wax, thread and nails, and also for additional capital for her fish vending business. 

In the future, Alfonsa would like to expand her business to support her family, as well as to save so that she will be able send her daughter for a college education.

loans.use: to purchase wax, thread and nails, and also to have additional capital for her fish vending business.

loans.name: Theara's Group

texts.en:
Theara, 30 years old, resides in a rural area of Sa Ang district in Cambodia’s Kandal province. She is married and has two children. To continually support the family, Theara and her husband have been working so tirelessly as rice farmers on a 2-hectare plot of farmland. 

This will be Theara’s first time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Theara is now leading a loan group of two female members to take out a loan in the amount of 160,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) each. As a group representative, Theara will spend her portion on building a proper latrine for use in the family. After receiving and using the loan as she plans, Theara believes that she will be able to create a healthy environment for her family as well as help to promote hygiene and sanitation in her community.

loans.use: To build a proper latrine.

loans.name: Dedicación

texts.es:
Dedicación de 47 años, es viuda. Tiene 5 hijas, pero sólo vive con la menor de 21 años, en una casa propia que construyó al lado de su esposo, años atrás y se ubica en un anexo rural.
Dedicación tiene una sonrisa dulce pero una actitud para el trabajo ejemplar. Se desempeña como agricultora en terrenos de cultivos de su localidad y propios, donde produce distintas variedades de papas, especialmente, papas de color y harinosas. Así también cultiva ollucos (tubérculos andinos). 
“Con la agricultura he logrado ahorrar bastante, por eso también empecé con otro negocio, con la venta de ganado”, menciona
Considera que la agricultura es impredecible, pero le agrada el ritmo de trabajo. 
En cuanto a su producción, Dedicación vende sus cosechas en su propio distrito y en la ciudad de Tarma. 
La venta de ollucos es rentable, por ello éste mes iniciará una siembra de éste tubérculo; requiere de su apoyo para ello. Éste es su crédito número 15 con MFP, por ello agradece la oportunidad de desarrollo. Se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. A su vez menciona sentirse contenta y respaldada por los integrantes de su banco comunal “Mirando un futuro mejor”.
Dedicación destinará el dinero en la compra de semillas de ollucos y bolsas de fertilizantes orgánicos.
texts.en:
Dedicación is a 47 year-old widow. She has 5 children, but she only lives with her youngest child who is 21 years-old. She lives in her own home, which she and her husband built side-by- side, years ago. The house is located in the rural annex.  

Dedicación has a sweet smile and an exemplary work ethic. She makes a living as a farmer using land that is close to her home, as well as her own land. She has crops of distinct varieties of potatoes, specifically varieties that are colored and starchy. She also has crops of ullucos, an Andean tuber that is similar to a potato. 

"With my farming business I have been able to save a lot of money, which is why I also started another business selling livestock." mentioned Dedicación.

She believes that farming is unpredictable, but she likes the pace of work. When she harvests her crops, she sells the produce in her own district, in the city of Tarma. 

The sale of ullucos is profitable, which is why this month she is going to plant a new crop of this tuber. This is what she needs help with. This is her 15th loan which she has taken out through MFP. She is thankful for the opportunity to develop her business. She promises to make her loan payments on time. She is happy with and supported by the other communal bank group members; her group is called "Mirando un Futuro Mejor" (Looking for a Better Future)
 
Dedicación will use the loan to buy ulluco seeds and bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy ulluco seeds and bags of organic fertilizers.

loans.name: 3.11.227.tt Vạn Hà Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyệt has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.

Nguyệt is 41 years old and she is married with two children. Nguyệt is the group leader of the 3.11.227.TT Vạn Hà  solidarity group, which consists of seven members. One of her children is grown up so Nguyệt supports one dependent with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Nguyệt joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nguyệt has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nguyệt has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nguyệt hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Reyson

texts.en:
Reyson is a 21-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He has been engaged in the food vending business for more than a year now. He sells home-cooked snack foods to the people in his locality.

 Reyson has hopes of expanding his business but lacks the resources to do so. With this in mind, he is requesting a loan to buy additional ingredients to make snacks to sell like flour, sugar, cooking oil, seasonings and others. With these, he will be able to cook and sell more thus augmenting profit. In the future, Reyson hopes to make his business a success and save money for the future schooling of his daughter.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients to use to make snacks to sell like flour, sugar, cooking oil, seasonings and others

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married with five children and four of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for two years, selling to all categories of people but on retail. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income through rental houses. She works at the market on a retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. She is aspiring of owning a delivery van for ease in transportation, becoming a wholesaler and also building more rental houses. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is 34 years old, a fishmonger in Mariakani, Mombasa. She is a married mother of four who has been in this business for the last ten years and she is doing well.

This being her fifth loan, she will use the requested loan to purchase additional sacks of dry fish which locally known as 'omena' before the ban is lifted on the lake. 

She will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan. Her previous loans were repaid successfully and she hopes to have a happy family life.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of dry fish ('omena') before the ban is lifted on the lake

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana de 47 años de edad, originaria de Matagalpa, pero  actualmente vive en Managua, casada, madre de 2 hijos  entre las edades de 5 y 21 años, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de plásticos. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio, con capital propio hace 12 años, vendiendo plásticos en el mercado ya que es un producto muy buscado por los clientes, negocio que le genera muchas ganancias a diarios,   hoy en día ella cuenta con dos negocio de venta de plásticos, ambos negocio son muy rentable, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y su hija, sus expectativas es hacer crecer el inventario de su negocio para lograr mejores ganancias.
Juana solicita el financiamiento para comprar plásticos, como vasos de plásticos, cucharas, bolsas, tollas, azistin,  etc. Ya que ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar toda la mercadería necesaria para agregar a su negocio, con el objetivo de aumentar el ingresos, sus planes  futuros  es convertirse en una gran empresaria de venta de plásticos, su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura del local, para darle una mejor presentación al negocio.
texts.en:
Juana is 47 years old, married, and the mother of two children, ages 5 and 21. She is from Matagalpa, but currently lives in Managua. A merchant by occupation, she sells plastic items. 

She started in business 12 years ago with her own capital, selling plastic items in the market. This is a product much sought after by customers, and a   business that generates considerable earnings daily. Nowadays she has two stores selling plastic items, and both are very profitable. She has the help of her husband and her daughter and hopes to increase her business's inventory, so that she can achieve better earnings 

Juana is requesting a loan to buy plastic items such as plastic cups, spoons, purses, as well as towels and cleaning products. She believes this loan will help her buy all the necessary merchandise to add to her store, with the aim of increasing income. 

Her future plan is to become a successful business person selling plastic items, and her immediate goal is to improve the infrastructure of her shop, so that she can improve her business's appearance.

loans.use: To buy plastic items, such as plastic cups, spoons, purses, as well as towels and cleaning products.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.es:
Rómulo de 55 años está casado con Ambrosia, con quien tiene  8 hijos, pero solo vive con el menor de 16 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en un distrito agrícola y ganadero. Su carácter es apacible pero su trabajo demuestra su gran capacidad. A su edad se dedica a la agricultura, una actividad muy cansada, pero reconfortante.
Él cultiva papas en grandes cantidades. Mayormente en los meses de mayo, noviembre y diciembre. “En esta zona las papas harinosas crecen grandes y sanas, por eso su precio de venta siempre es favorable”, menciona.
Rómulo empezó esta actividad desde que era joven, y después formó su familia. Ahora, con la experiencia de muchos años, aprendió a realizar otros negocios, como la venta de carne de carnero. 
Considera que la mayor inversión se da en la compra de fertilizantes y en el pago de personal
De esta manera Rómulo trabaja y sale adelante. Está muy agradecido por al ayuda que se le brinda y la confianza, por eso esta vez también espera el apoyo para iniciar otra siembra de papas. Éste es su crédito número 3 con MFP. Como en el anterior préstamo, menciona que, será puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando un futuro mejor” y le agrada el trabajo en equipo.
Rómulo destinará el dinero en la compra de 5 bolsas de fertilizantes cuyo precio es de 500 soles cada una. Lo restante lo empleará en le pago del personal.
texts.en: Rómulo is fifty-five years old and is married to Ambrosia. Together they have eight children, although only the youngest, who is sixteen, lives with them. The family has their own home in a farming and livestock district. Rómulo is mild-mannered, but his work demonstrates his great capacity to get things done. He works as a farmer, which at his age is very tiring, but also comforting. He grows large crops of potatoes. He does his planting mostly in May, November and December. "In this area the hearty potatoes are healthy and large, so they sell at good prices," he reports. Rómulo began farming when he was young, and then started his family. Now, with all these years of experience, he has learned and expanded into other businesses, such as selling mutton. He believes that currently his best investments will be in purchasing fertilizer and hiring laborers. In this way he will be able to keep working and get ahead. He is very grateful for the support he has received so far. This time he hopes to use the funds to initiate another planting cycle. This is his third loan with MFP. He promises that he will be punctual in his loan repayments, as he has with his past loans. He belongs to the communal bank “Mirando un futuro mejor” ("looking toward a better future"), and he is thankful to be part of this team. He will use the loan proceeds to buy five bags of fertilizer, the price of which is 500 soles per page. He will use the remaining funds to pay workers.

loans.use: to buy five bags of fertilizer and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Marie Rosine

texts.en: Marie Rosine is 28 years old. She is married with four children. The oldest is eight and the youngest is five months. Her husband sells beds and chairs. She has been in business for seven years. She wants a loan to buy more food spice for sell. The profit will assist her buy a home.

loans.use: To buy food spices for sale.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en: Salima is 38 years old. She is married with five children. The oldest is 15 and the youngest is seven. Her husband sells goat, chicken and other eatable animals. She has been in business for 9 years. She wants a loan to buy more goats. The profit will assist in paying for school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 36 years old. She is married with three children. The oldest is 14 and the youngest is two. Her husband is a taxi driver. She has been in business for six years. She wants a loan to buy more rice, sugar, cooking oil, and cooking spices for sell. The profit will go towards her savings

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, cooking oil, and cooking spices for sale

loans.name: Floride

texts.en: Florida is 41 years old. She is married with eight children. The oldest is 17 years old and youngest is two years. Her husband sells timber. She has been in business for 6 years. She wants a loan to buy more fruits for sell. The profit will go towards children school fees.

loans.use: to buy more fruits for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing for sale.

loans.name: Kety

texts.es:
Kety de 28 años, convive con su pareja con quien tiene 3 hijos de 10, 5 y 2 años. Ellos viven unidos en una casa propia ubicada en un distrito agrícola y ganadero.
Kety es una madre joven de gran empeño y coraje para el trabajo. Desde los 19 años decidió dedicarse a la agricultura en terrenos que sus padres le otorgaron. Ahora también se dedica a la ganadería aprovechando los buenos pastos de su anexo, gracias a la altitud.
“Tengo más de 50 carneros, que crío en las zonas altas, cuando están grandes los vendo o los sacrifico”, dice. Ella obtiene ganancias considerables de las ventas de la carne, el pellejo, la menudencia y otros; las que ofrece en un puesto improvisado en el mercado de su distrito.
Kety tiene grandes aspiraciones, entre ellas ampliar sus campos de cultivos y mejorar la raza de sus animales. Por ahora se dedicará a la crianza de más ovejas, para continuar con su negocio de carnes.
Solicita de su apoyo para adquirir 5 cabezas de ganado ovino, los que piensa engordar para su posterior venta.
Éste es su préstamo número 5 con MFP. Se compromete en pagar las cuotas mensuales con puntualidad. Por otra parte reconoce el trabajo de su banco comunal “Mirando un futuro mejor”, como solidario y cooperativo.
Kety invertirá los 600 soles en la compra de 5 cabezas de ganado ovino para engordarlos.
texts.en:
Kety, who is 28 years old, lives with her partner, with whom she has 3 children aged 10, 5 and 2. They live together in their own home located in a farming and livestock area. 

Kety is a young mother with great determination and courage for work. 19 years ago she decided to dedicate herself to farming on the plots that her parents bestowed upon her. Now she also raises livestock, making the most of the good pastures of her settlement, thanks to the altitude.

"I have more than 50 rams, which I raise on high ground. When they are grown I sell them or I slaughter them", she says. She earns a considerable income from the sale of the meat, the skin, the offal, and other things; she sells these at a makeshift stall at her district market. 

Kety has high hopes, among these is to extend her farm land and improve the breed of her animals. For now she will work on raising more sheep, to continue her meat business. 

She asks for your support in order to purchase 5 sheep, which she will fatten for their later sale. 

This is her fifth loan with MFP. She promises to pay the monthly instalments punctually. On the other hand, she recognises the work of her communal bank "Mirando un futuro mejor" as supportive and cooperative. Kety will invest the 600 PEN in the purchase of 5 sheep to fatten up.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sheep to fatten

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio is a 38-year-old resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines.  He is married to Mirriam, a housewife, and is a father to their children.  He and his wife manage the household while operating the business.  At this time, he is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Florencio is selling fish.  He works with a dealer where he gets fish at a lower price.  He will then sell it to the public for a little income.  He has been selling fish for seven years now.  His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue the operation of his business, he is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan.  He will be utilizing the loan to buy more fish.  He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  Florencio hopes to be able to expand his business and to have his own stall.  He dreams of being a millionaire.  He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida de 44 años tiene el agrado de compartir una vida conyugal con Juan de 39 años, para complemento del calor familiar tiene el orgullo de sacar adelante a sus dos hijos Mardenku de 19 años y Carlos de 14.
Residen en una vivienda de madera adquirida desde hace poco.
Desde hace 14 años lidera su negocio consistente en la venta de repuestos para diversos vehículos.
Todo inicio cuando Juan luego de trabajar como ayudante en un taller particular obtuvo basta experiencia en el rubro permitiéndole posteriormente abrir su propio taller. Al notar el incremento de clientela ella optó por aperturar el negocio de la venta de repuestos logrando consolidarse como una pareja muy productiva.
Le agrada mucho su negocio puesto que le permite pasar todo el tiempo necesario al lado de su familia.
El incremento en las ventas ha logrado establecer su negocio como un sólido sustento para el hogar.
Como todo negocio comercial es necesario invertir en mercadería que permita surtir el negocio y atraer clientes es por ello que motivada por su trabajo desea abastecer su negocio.
Desea  a futuro iniciar la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble y mejorar el ambiente de su negocio. Requiere contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de lubricantes y repuestos menores para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Zenaida is 44, and has the pleasure of sharing her life with her partner Juan, who is 39.  Complementing the warmth of their family, she has the pride of raising their two children, Mardenku, 19, and Carlos, 14.

They live in a home made of wood, which they acquired a little while ago. For 14 years she has been running her business selling spare parts for various vehicles. Everything started when Juan, after working as a helper in a private workshop, obtained enough experience in this area to allow him to open his own workshop. Noting the increase in clientele, she chose to open her business selling spare parts, and they have succeeded in growing stronger as a very productive couple.

She is very happy with her business as it allows her to spend all the necessary time with her family. The increase in sales has enabled her business to become a solid support for the household.

As with every business, it is necessary to invest in merchandise that allows the business to be restocked and attract customers. This is why, motivated by her business needs, she wishes to restock her store.

In the future, she wishes to begin building her house from high-quality materials and improve her business premises. She needs to have 2,000 nuevos soles to buy lubricants and spare parts for stocking her store.

loans.use: To buy lubricants and spare parts for stocking her business.

loans.name: Nang's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Sa Ang district in Cambodia’s Kandal province, Nang is 33 years old and married with three dependent kids.  All of her children are school-aged.  To make a living, Nang raises a head of pig and a head of cow.  Nang’s husband has a business farming rice on a two-hectare plot of land to complement the income.  

Nang has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three loan cycles already.  With the previous loans she accomplished covering household expenses and buying animals to raise.  She is now leading a loan group of three female members to take out a loan in the amount of 1,300,000 KHR.  As a group representative, Nang will utilize her loan portion to build a latrine.  With the latrine properly installed, Nang will be able to obtain a healthier environment as well as to promote sanitation and hygiene practices in her community.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro, de 32 años es un hombre trabajador y honrado. Vive en compañía de su esposa Virginia y sus hijos: Carlos y Luis, a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 9 años. Desde muy temprano a los primeros rayos de sol, Abraham se dirige a un pueblo lejano donde realiza el servicio de volteado de tierra agrícola con el tractor que posee. Su trabajo es muy cansado pues realiza la actividad durante todo el día, llega a casa por la tarde cuando el sol se oculta, es por esa razón que no para mucho en casa. “Mis esposo es muy trabajador, nuestro único ingreso económico es el servicio que realiza”, afirma Virginia. Es por esa razón que desea poder comprar una moto para así trasladarse a su centro de trabajo y no perder horas y horas de caminata, de esa manera podrá tener más tiempo para pasar con su familia y así llegar a tiempo a los terrenos agrícolas donde tiene que realizar los servicios. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico recibido, el cual le ayudará a mejorar su negocio y a dinamizar sus ventas. Pues tendrá el capital para trabajar, por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Alejandro, invertirá el dinero en la compra de una moto nueva para poder trasladarse a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Alejandro, age 32, is an honest and hard-working man.  He lives with his wife, Virginia, and their two children, Carlos and Luis.  They are raising the children in the house he bought nine years ago.

Very early, at the sun’s first light, Abraham heads to a faraway town where he plows farmland with the tractor that he has.  His work is very tiring because he does it all day long.  He arrives home when it is dark.  That is the reason he does not stay at home a lot.

“My husband is very hard-working.  Our only income is from the service that he performs,” says Virginia.  It is for this reason that he wants to be able to buy a motorcycle in order to get himself to work without losing hours and hours walking.  This way he will have more time to spend with his family.  This way he will arrive on time to the farmlands where he works 

This is his fourth loan with MFP.  He is grateful for the financial support he has received.  It will help him improve his business and invigorate his sales.  He will have working capital, and he pledges to be punctual with his payments.  Alejandro will use the money to buy a new motorcycle in order to be able to get to work.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle in order to be able to get to work.

loans.name: Joram

texts.en: Joram is a 47-year-old man with 15 children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  He has been selling fish since 2003 and dreams of expanding his business to new areas.  He also dreams of educating his children to attain degrees, as minimum qualification, despite inadequate capital.  The purpose of the loan is to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Rhona

texts.en:
Rhona is married with two children who attend school.  She also takes care of her sister’s children.  She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for many years.  She also generates additional income from operating a retail shop.  She works from her home and sells to all categories of people seven days a week.  

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality.  She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build rental rooms.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio is a 42-year-old married man and father of a nine year old daughter from Trinidad, Bohol. He is in the food vending business and also retails ready to wear clothes and accessories. These are the sources of his income. 
Dionesio needs a loan to buy more dressed chicken, cooking oil, and other seasonings. With this, he will be able to cook more and sell more food to the people in his place.
In the future, Dionesio hopes to make his business a success and save money for the schooling of his daughter.

loans.use: to buy more dressed chickens, cooking oil, and other seasonings

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is 35 years old, a resident of Mbuya, and a widow whose husband passed away suddenly, without falling ill, leaving her with four children, ages 20, 17, 15, and 8. All of the children go to school.
 
Evaline deals in the selling of charcoal in Mbuya town. She started this job in 2009, after the death of her husband, since it was the easiest business to start with the little capital she had. Her major customers are her neighbors in Mbuya. Evaline’s major challenges are lack of enough capital to invest in her business and also looking after her children with the little income she earns from the business. 

Evaline's loan is to help buy more charcoal for her business and also pay fees for the children. Evaline is very hard-working, social, and honest. She has dreams of expanding her business and building rentals, to bring in more income for her family's needs, especially school fees for her young ones.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business and also pay fees for the children

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a fishmonger. She buys fresh fish from the market then smokes and sells them. Fatima has been selling smoked fish for 10 years. She is married with six dependents. She uses her income to help her husband to feed and clothe their children. Fatima will use her loan to purchase a large quantity of fresh fish to smoke and sell. She will expand her business with the additional profit.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
Primitiva de 37 años, con Sergio. Ambos tienen 2 hijos de 13 y 11 años. Ellos viven unidos en una casa propia en una localidad ganadera. Ella es una mujer que se esfuerza en todas las actividades que realiza. Por esa razón se desempeña en un negocio de verduras en el mercado mayorista, además es agricultora. 
Pero la actividad que le está otorgando mayores satisfacciones es el servicio de transporte interprovincial. Hace 4 meses, su esposo y ella, adquirieron una minivan de segunda mano. Su esposo trabaja todos los días con la movilidad desde la ciudad de Tarma hasta Chanchamayo (selva central) y viceversa. Cada viaje lo realiza en una hora y media, y cobra a cada pasajero la suma de 15 soles, un monto justo para realizar los gastos de mantenimiento de su vehículo y para continuar en la legalidad de su actividad.
Primitiva está contenta con sus actividades y con el apoyo que recibe, ya que gracias a las charlas educativas, se animó a incursionar en esta actividad. Éste es su préstamo número 6 con MFP. Por ello se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Manifiesta que su banco comunal “Mirando un futuro mejor”, es unido y  que cada reunión es un día de alegrías y aprendizajes.
Destinará los 2500 soles en la colocación de nuevos tapizados para los asientos de su minivan y así ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Primivita, age 37, and Sergio have two children, ages 13 and 11.  They live together in their own house in a livestock area.  She is a woman who puts forth a lot of effort in all of the business activities that she does.  That is the reason that she works in a vegetable business at the wholesale market and is also a farmer.

However, the business activity that is giving her the greatest satisfaction is the inter-provincial transportation service.  Four months ago she and her husband got a second-hand minivan.  Her husband works with it every day from the city of Tarma to Chanchamayo (central jungle) and vice versa.  Every trip he makes is one and a half hours, and he charges each passenger 15 soles.  This amount is just to cover his vehicle maintenance expenses and to keep up with the legal requirements of his business activity.

Primivita is happy with her business activities and with the support that she gets.  Thanks to the educational talks, she decided to enter into this business activity.  This is her sixth loan with MFP.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments.  She says that her communal bank, Mirando un Futuro Mejor, is united.  She says that each meeting is a day of joy and learning.

She will use the 2,500 soles to reupholster the seats in their minivan in order to provide better service.

loans.use: to reupholster the seats in their minivan in order to provide better service.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia sells maize porridge. She serves the porridge with bread in Abura, Ghana. She is married and has three children. Lydia has been selling maize  porridge for six years. She uses her income to help her husband to feed, clothe, and pay school fees for her children. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare her porridge and bread to sell. With the new profit, Lydia will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare her porridge and bread to sell

loans.name: Anipa

texts.ru: Для Аныипы это второй КИВА кредит. Она в первую очередь хотела бы поблагодарить всех КИВА инвесторов за то что поддержали её в трудную минуту. От полученного первого кредита она получила хороший доход. Сейчас у неё очень развитое хозяйство. В хозяйстве у Антипы имеется 2 коровы, 1 лошадь, 3 жеребца и 10 голов овец. Её ежемесячный жоход сосотавляет 7,000 KGS. Для расширения бизнеса и увеличения дохода Анипа обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) На приобретение 1 коровы и 3 лошадей тем самым увеличив надои молока и надеется получить приплод в будущем. В этом году ей предстоит женить сына.
texts.en:
This will be the second Kiva loan for Anipa. Firstly, she would like to thank all Kiva investors that supported her in a difficult time. From the first loan, she received a good income. She now has a highly developed homestead. Antipa's farm has two cows, a horse, three horses, and ten head of sheep. Her monthly income is 7,000 KGS. 

To expand her business and increase revenue, Anipa appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) for the acquisition of one cow and three horses, thereby increasing milk production. She hopes to have offspring in the future. 

This year, she will marry off her son.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is a food vendor. She sells rice and porridge. She serves the porridge with milk, sugar, and bread at a Pedu station near Cape Coast. She is married to a mason and has five children. Francisca  has been selling rice and maize porridge for 10 years. She uses her income to help her husband  to feed, clothe, and pay school fees for her children. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice, maize, and flour to prepare her porridge and bread to sell. With the new profit, Francisca will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, maize, and flour to prepare her porridge and  bread to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hairdresser and she owns a beauty salon in Abura.  She is married with 2 children.  Gloria has been a hairdresser for some years now.  She uses her income to support her husband to pay their utility bills.

Gloria will uses her loan to purchase creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer for her beauty salon.  She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer for her beauty salon

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a baker and she bakes bread for sale at Abura.  She is married and has 5 children.  Margaret has been baking for 34 years now.  She uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children.

She will use her loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery. She hopes to expand her business from the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma de 37 años de edad, está casada con Clemente, con quien tiene 4 hijos de 19, 16, 10 y 8 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en un anexo agrícola y ganadero. El trabajo de una mujer de campo no descansa y permanece alerta ante cualquier eventualidad, así lo considera Norma, ya que desde los 18 años viene laborando en los campos de cultivos que sus padres le otorgaron. Por su parte Clemente también posee terrenos por su herencia. 
Ella se dedica a la agricultura, con la siembra de papas de las variedades: “Yungay” y “Jilguero”. Producción que vende satisfactoriamente en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. “Estas papas se venden mejor, sus precios son mejores y siempre se mantienen”, menciona.
El trabajo en el campo no es sencillo, y más aún cuando tiene hijos en edad escolar, a quienes atiende para luego dedicarse a sus sembríos.
Los meses de enero y febrero son importantes por las lluvias, por eso ella iniciará una siembra de papas, para lo cual requiere de su apoyo. Éste es su crédito número 5 con MFP. Da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las mensualidades. Pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando un futuro mejor”, y se siente a gusto con el sistema de trabajo de su cuenta interna y las charlas educativas.
Ella destinará los 1000 soles en la compra de bolsas de  abono orgánico para la siembra de papas que realizará este mes.
texts.en:
Norma, 37, is married to Clemente, and they have 4 children aged 19, 16, 10 and 8.  They live in their own home, which is located in a rural settlement where farming and livestock are the main activities.  According to Norma, the work of a country woman is never done, and she must remain alert to any situation that might arise.  Norma has been farming for 18 years on land that her parents gave her.  Her husband Clemente also has some land that he inherited. 

Norma cultivates potatoes of the “Yungay” and “Jilguero” varieties.  She is able to successfully sell these products in the wholesale market of Tarma.  "These potatoes sell better, they command higher prices, and their prices are stable," she says.  

Farming is not easy, even more so when the children are school-aged, and you must care for them before you go out to farm.  The months of January and February are important because of the rains; this is when she will start planting potatoes, which is the reason why she needs your support.  This will be her 5th loan with MFP.  She gives her word that she will make her monthly payments on time.  Norma belongs to the communal bank "Mirando un futuro mejor," and she feels comfortable with the institution's system of internal accounting and the educational talks it provides. 

Norma will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she requests to buy sacks of organic fertilizer for the potatoes that she will plant this month.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer so that she can plant potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two cows and forage for feeding them.

loans.name: Lukiya

texts.en: Lukiya is widowed with five children; only one of her children goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling secondhand clothes selling to all categories of people but on a retail basis only. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income from rental houses. She moves door-to-door selling used clothes six days a week. Her major business challenges includes the rainy season which hinders her movements, and ever-increasing prices of used clothes. She is aspiring to get a permanent business premise and also to become a wholesaler.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for electricity and water.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Adah Azenath

texts.en:
Adah Azenath earns a living through her clothing and accessories store. She lives with her family in Alicia, Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the business for more than 2 years now.

Adah Azenath is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like ready-to-wear clothes such as shirts, slippers, accessories and others. With this, she will be able to improve her stock and augment her sales and income. In the future, Adah Azenath hopes of making her business a success and plan for its expansion.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like ready-to-wear clothes such as shirts, slippers, accessories and others

loans.name: Jocob

texts.en:
Jocob is an auto mechanic who repairs cars and he has done this for 20 years. He is married with 4 children.  He uses his income to provide shelter, food and clothes for his children.

Jocob will use his loan to acquire more spare parts, tools, and equipment to enable him to better service his customers. With the new profit, he will expand his business.

loans.use: to acquire more spare parts, tools and equipment to enable him to better service his customers

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a 45-year-old, married woman, and a mother of 13 children, from Ubay, Bohol. She earns a living by running her sari-sari, or variety store. She has been in this business for more than 14 years. She sells various goods and items to the people in her area.

Adelaida needs a loan to buy additional groceries to resell, like soda, noodles, sardines, bread, chips and other snack foods, soap and toiletries. With the increase in inventory, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and profit. Adelaida hopes to expand her business in the future, so that it will continue to generate income.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to resell, like soda, noodles and sardines, plus items like soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio tiene 54 años de edad, es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene  tres hijos, él  nació en la ciudad de Sicuani pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de es la elaboración de artesanía de tipo peletería. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como telas, hilos y otras cosas más. 

Se encuentra contento por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Gregorio is a 54-year-old married man.  The fruit of his beautiful marriage is three children.  He was born in the city of Sicuani but now lives in the lovely city of Cusco.  His principal economic activity is making items from fur.  He has been in this business for many years, and things are going well thanks to his hard work.

He currently needs a loan in order to buy materials including cloth, threads and other items.

He is grateful for the loan opportunity and the support he has been given, and he promises to repay his loan punctually.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cloth and threads.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children from Ubay, Bohol, Philippines. Adela is a farmer and has been in the farming business for more than 20 years now, together with her husband.

Adela is in need of additional capital for the expansion of her farming business. She is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides.  In the future, Adela hopes of making her business grow and become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is from Kobuleti district, West Georgia. She is 21 years old and lives with her husband, child, and parents. Diana works as a waitress and her husband is a meat distributor. Both family members get a monthly salary. 

Also, the family is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they grow nuts, maize, and mandarins on family-owned land. Part of the harvested production is sold at the local open market and the rest is used for family needs. Diana works hard, but the family still doesn’t have enough income for some savings and to improve the living conditions of the family. 

With the received credit, Diana will purchase pigs. She will place the pigs in a shed located in their yard, raise them, and after several months the family will be able to have piglets. This will increase the family's animal husbandry business and their income, as well. With the increased income, Diana will improve the living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for her farm.

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es:
La señora Julia María  es originaria del municipio de Condega, un pequeño pueblo a unos 35 km al norte de Estelí, donde tiene unos 30 años de residir en esta dirección, ella es madre soltera y vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos hijas que cursan la secundaria.

La señora Julia María en la actualidad se desempeña como enfermera en un hospital, ella viaja diario a sus 
labores desde muy temprano y regresando a su casa por las tardes y pocas ocasiones hace un turno de 24 hrs al servicio de los pacientes.

 Este es la única fuente de ingreso que ella tiene para el sostén de su familia así como para cubrir los gastos escolares de sus hijas.

se presenta a las oficinas de Ceprodel con el objetivo de solicitar un financiamiento, para mejorar su casa de habitación, consiste en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como es cemento, ladrillos y pago de mano de obra.
texts.en:
Julia María is from Condega, a small village some 35 kilometers north of Estelí.  She has lived there for thirty years.  She is a single mother, and she lives in her own house with her two daughters who are in secondary school.

She currently works as a nurse in a hospital.  She goes to work very early and returns home in the afternoon.  Occasionally she will work a 24-hour shift at the hospital.

This is her only source of income to support her family and cover her children's school expenses.

She is seeking a loan from Ceprodel so that she can make improvements to her home.  She will use the funds to purchase construction material such as cement and bricks, and also to pay the laborers who perform the work.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks, and also to pay laborers.

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en: Nizami is 26 years old. He is married and has a child. Nizami has been an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city, but now he has settled in the Fizuli region with his family. Nizami has been in agriculture for five years, breeding cows. Now he needs a 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) loan to buy cows, for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.en:
Anatolia is a 50-year-old married woman from Bohol, a province in the Philippines. Together with her husband, she has been in the fishing business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of their income.

Anatolia is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights and fish hooks. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

Anatolia hopes to make her business a success, and to save money to reinvest and for her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights and fish hooks

loans.name: Azel

texts.en:
Azel is a 20-year-old married woman and a mother of a 1-year-old child from Bohol, Philippines. Azel has operated her sari-sari (or variety store) business for more than a year now. She sells various goods and commodities to the people in her area.

Azel is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like noodles, rice, canned goods, chips and other snack foods, soap, toiletries and soda. With this, she will be able to increase her stock and attract customers and buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income. Azel has hopes of making her business grow and become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like noodles, rice, canned goods, chips and other snack foods, soap, toiletries and soda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is a 36-year-old, married woman and a mother of four young children. They live in Bohol, Philippines. Caridad has been engaged in the fishing business, together with her husband, for more than ten years. This is the way of their living and their source of income.

Caridad is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, buckets, and other items. With this, her husband will be able to catch more fish and they will have more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Caridad hopes to make their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, buckets, and other items for her fishing business.

loans.name: Erabella

texts.en:
Erabella is a 42-year-old, married woman from Corella, Bohol. She has five children. She is engaged in a sari-sari (variety store) business. She sells, for example, soft drinks, noodles, canned goods and soaps. She earns 4,000 Philippine pesos a month, as owner of the sari-sari. Her husband is a carpenter, who earns only below minimum income.

Erabella requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more beverages, including soft drinks like Coke and Pepsi. With the loan money she can purchase them in bulk, to cater to the needs of her customers. Erabella would like to expand her business in the future, to generate more income and to save for her children's education, for their bright future.

loans.use: to purchase more beverages in bulk, including soft drinks like Coke and Pepsi, to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 29 años, convive con Haydee, su esposa. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Jefferson y Renzo. Ellos tienen una casa propia y se ubica en las alturas de un anexo ganadero y agrícola. Alberto es un padre cariñoso y un hombre de grandes metas. Su actividad principal es la agricultura. Sus principales cultivos constan de tubérculos como: papa y olluco; productos bandera de su familia, “mis padres me enseñaron todo lo necesario, sobre las técnicas de cultivo”, menciona. Los buenos cuidados que le ofrece constantemente a sus sembríos, hacen que sus cosechas sean buenas y con mucha demanda en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma. Ya tiene 11 años dedicándose a está ardua labor y ahora Alberto, no solo sigue sembrando, también compró varias cabezas de ganado ovino, los que ahora ya están creciendo fuertes y saludables. Según cuente la ayuda en algunos gastos eventuales que tiene, ya que compra a un precio muy bajo con la intensión de engordarlos y vender a mayor precio. 
Ésta vez necesitará de su ayuda para adquirir bolsas de fertilizantes para iniciar una siembra de papas de colores. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando a un futuro mejor” y éste es su crédito número 11 con MFP, donde es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora. Por ello espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos.
Alberto invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono orgánico para su próximo sembrío.
texts.en:
Alberto is 29 years old and lives with his wife Haydee. They have two children: Jefferson and Renzo. They live in the home they own, which is located in a farming area. 

Alberto is a loving father and a man with high expectations. He works mainly as a farmer, and his main crops are root vegetables like potaoes and ulluco, his family's signature products. "My parents taught me everything you need to know about farming techniques," he says. The constant good care he takes of his crops help him obtain good harvests, and there is a lot of demand for them in the city of Tarma's central market. He has been in this hard line of work for eleven years. Not only is Alberto still farming, but he recently bought several heads of sheep, that are now growing strong and healthy. He says this helps with some occasional expenses he has, because he buys the animals at very low prices and plans to fatten them and sell them at a higher price.

This time he needs help to purchase bags of fertilizer so that he can start planting different varieties of colored potatoes. He belongs to the communal bank “Mirando a un futuro mejor” and this is his 11th loan through MFP, where he is considered a responsible person and a very hard worker. He is hoping for support in order to continue working towards his goals. 

Alberto will invest the money he has requested in the purchase of organic fertilizer for his next crop.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for his next crop.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Salamatu. She is married and has three children aged 19, 17 and 14. 

In 1999, Salamatu established her rubber, clothes, slippers, jeans and jewellery business. She started this business because she wanted to generate income, educate her children and build houses. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

She is requesting a loan of SLL 4,500,000. Salamatu requires this loan to be able to travel to neighbouring countries in order to buy large quantities of clothing, rubber, slippers and jeans at discount prices. 

In the future, Salamatu plans to import goods into the country and begin to sell wholesale. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, slippers and jeans

loans.name: Castura

texts.en:
Castura earns a living through her sari-sari or convenience store business. She has been in the business for more than three years. She sells various goods and commodities to the people in her place, in Alicia, Bohol.

Castura is in need of additional capital to buy additional merchandise to sell, like canned goods, noodles, chips and other snack foods, soap and toiletries, and soda, among others. Through this loan, Castura will be able to improve her sales and income. Castura dreams of making her business successful and sustainable, so that she will be able to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell, like canned goods, noodles, chips and other snack foods, soap and toiletries, and soda, among others.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is married and has four children, and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in her own house, but the family doesn’t have access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family, and medication.

She has a business selling produce, like beans, ground nuts, green peas, tomatoes, onions, and sweet and Irish potatoes. She has been in this business for two years. She generates additional income through mushroom growing.

Eunice has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO, to buy more bags of beans, green peas, ground nuts, onions and tomatoes. She supplies the produce to supermarkets and sells mainly on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler, and to buy a delivery van to make transportation of goods easier.

loans.use: To buy more bags of beans, green peas, onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 22 years old, and a tailor in Mazeras, Mariakani. She is married, and her husband earns additional income; together they support one child. She has been in the tailoring business for the past three years, and her income is great. 

Fatuma will use the requested loan to purchase new clothing material for her tailoring shop. She will use the anticipated profit to start up another business.

This is her first loan. She hopes to have a successful business and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing material for her tailoring shop

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 44 years old, comes from Ndunyu Njeru, and is married with one child who is in the university.

George is a farmer and has been in this business for the past 13 years. He has applied for his fourth loan from KADET LTD  to enable him to buy seedlings and fertilizers to use in his farm.

He hopes to be able to educate his child well in the near future and also see his business expand.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Abdul Rahman

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Abdul.  He is married and has one child aged 6. He has one additional dependent, living with him as a Sales Assistant.  In 2005, Abdul established his mobile phone credit card   business. He began his business because he wants to   take care of his family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 6,500,000. 

Abdul has already received and successfully repaid his second loan and now requires a new loan which will enable him to open more telephone call center branches in the provincial towns. In the future, Abdul plans to complete his 3-bedroom house and support his child’s education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to open more telephone call centers

loans.name: Batkhuu

texts.en: Batkhuu, 46 years old, lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) next to their own grocery store. His elder son studies at university while his younger son goes to high school. He has a leg disability and uses crutches. Due to his disability, he gets a pension from the state and his wife executes the role of caretaker. In 2012, he rented a counter at an outdoor market and began selling additives such as ketchup, mayonnaise,pepper, garlic, onion and curry. The family also owns one complete and one unfinished house on their plot of land. Besides his additive selling business, he also makes construction blocks from April to November and sells them to customers and has operated this business for two years. He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to increase his circulating assets by purchasing various types of additives. As a result, he can generate more income for his family. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives to see his sons have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase various types of additives

loans.name: Firaddin

texts.en: Firaddin was an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city, but now he has settled in the Fizuli region with his family. He is married and has three sons. Firaddin is 46 years old. He needs a 2000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy sheep to sell as meat. Firaddin has been in the butcher shop business for seven years. In the future he wants to expand in his area.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a 49-year-old fisherman from Bohol, Philippines. He is married and has three young children. Eduardo needs additional capital for his business. He needs a loan to buy a new fishing boat.

In the future, Eduardo has hopes of making his fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat

loans.name: Shalva

texts.en:
Shalva is a 66-year-old farmer from Kobuleti District, West Georgia. He is married. He purchases potatoes, cabbages and different kinds of vegetables from wholesalers once a week and sells them in the local market. This business gives the family approximately 300 Laris per month. Along with the above-mentioned income source, Shalva’s family has a milk cow. They produce cheese and sell it at the local market. In addition, they grow nuts and maize on the family-owned land and do all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest.

With the requested loan, Shalva will purchase stocks of vegetables to expand his trading business and sell them for a profit. That will increase his profit. Shalva plans to reinvest part of the profit in the same business, and the rest will be used in the family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama  is married and has two children, one of whom goes to school.  She has a business of a restaurant, selling all types of food. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO, to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, beans, chicken, rice, charcoal, and sweet and Irish potatoes. She works six days a week at the market. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and to build her own house.   She resides in a rented house in which the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, rice, beef, charcoal, chicken, sweet and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Felix  Sr.

texts.en: Felix Sr. is a fisherman from Bohol, Philippines. He has been in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. Felix Sr. wants a loan worth PHP4000 to buy new fishing nets and lead weights and fuel for the boat. With this, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. Felix Sr. dreams of improving his business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and lead weights and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a 48 year-old married woman who has nine children. She lives in the province of Bohol, Philippines. The oldest child is 27, while the youngest is 7.  She has been engaged in the fish vending business for almost ten years.  Her husband is a fisherman and Aida sells his catch as a source of livelihood.  Her business is financially insufficient to sustain itself. Aida requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like a fish net, hook and gasoline for the motorboat.  In the future, Aida would like to invest in another business to gain more profit, and at the same time, save for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fish net, hook and gasoline for the motor boat

loans.name: Byron Salomon

texts.es:
Don Byron, expresa su agradecimiento por brindarle la oportunidad de su primer crédito Kiva con el cual logro comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abono y pago mano de obra, ya que con esta inversión pudo sacar adelante su siembra de café, el cual se ayudó con los costos que este le genere. Siempre mantiene en su mente de incrementar sus cosechas para obtener más ganancias.
Está requiriendo  este segundo  financiamiento para invertir igual en la compra de insumo, fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para darle un mejor mantenimiento a su cosecha. Ya que al obtener buena cosecha podrá obtener mejores ingresos para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Byron wishes to express his gratitude to Kiva investors who offered him the opportunity for his 1st Kiva loan, which he has used to buy inputs such as fertilizers and manure and to pay laborers. The loan advanced his coffee planting and helped cover the costs it generated. He had always wanted to increase his harvests in order to obtain greater earnings.

Byron needs this 2nd financing to invest once again in purchasing inputs like fertilizers and to pay laborers to improve the maintenance of his harvest. As soon as he gathers a good harvest, he will obtain better income and use that to improve his house's infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy inputs such as fertilizers and to pay laborers who work on his coffee crop.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto de 31 años de edad, originario de Estelí, padre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 3 y 13 años,  de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la veta de disco, del que es propietario hace más de 1 años. Inicio su negocio con capital propio, a la edad de 29 años, el cual lo comenzó con 25 Cd luego  con el tiempo fue creciendo, con las ganancias que le genero su negocio, el cual ha podido tener mejores ingresos, con lo que ha podido comprar el teatro en casa para escuchar los Disco y comprar una vitrina, este ha sido su primer negocio, sus expectativas es ampliar el negocio.
Él está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar  discos  como  CD de música y video.  Ya que el estima que este crédito le ayudaría a incrementar el inventario de su negocio, de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias, sus planes futuros es vender DVD, repuesto de nintendo, una de sus metas próximas es establecer una venta de video juego.
texts.en:
Roberto is 31 years old and is from Estelí.  He is the father of two children between the ages of 3 and 13.  He is a salesman and works selling CD's and DVDs.  He has owned his own business for 1 year.  He began his business with his own capital when he was 29 years old.  He started with 25 CD's and over time his business has grown, along with the income that the business generates.  He has been able to have better income, which has meant that he has been able to start a movie theatre in his home and to put up a display case.  This has been his first business.  His plans are to expand the business.  

He is asking for a loan to buy discs like music CD's and movies.  He believes the loan will help him to increase the inventory of his business, and in that way he can make a better income.  His future plans are to sell DVDs and nintendo replacement parts.  One of his upcoming goals is to begin selling video games.

loans.use: To purchase discs like music CD's and videos.

loans.name: Pikria

texts.en:
Pikria is from the village of Kvilishori, Tskaltubo district. She is 24 years old, married, and lives with her husband, her retired mother-in-law and three children (4, 5 and 7 years old). The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, Pikria runs a small dairy farm. She has three milk cows whose milk is used for cheese products that are sold at the local open market. 

Besides that, the family has two pigs and sells piglets seasonally. According to government estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category and they get monthly social assistance. Pikria works hard to make some savings and improve living conditions for her family, but she still doesn’t have enough income to implement her plans.

She requested a loan to renovate the house. The existing house is old and damaged. Pikria will purchase building materials and repair it. Then the living conditions of the family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment. Pikria hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to renovate the house.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 44 years old, married and supports nine members of his family.  He has six children aged between 16 and two years.  Peter does dairy farming on his farm, and has been in operation for a period of three years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,000.

He is servicing a third loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD, and intends to use the amount to purchase one dairy cow and animal feeds.  

The profits he earns will be used to purchase a motorbike that will help him in transportation. He hopes to own a vehicle and also to educate his children to higher levels.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a 58-year-old, married woman and a mother of six grown children. They live in Bohol, Philippines. She operates a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and commodities to the people in her place.

Marcelina is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell, like canned goods, candies and snack foods, soda, toiletries, rice, and feed for the pigs. With this loan, she will be able to sell more and increase her profit and income.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell, like canned goods, candies and snack foods, soda, toiletries, rice, and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Kevin Jose

texts.es: Kevin   vive en  el cantón de libertad  Tiene 22  años. Es soltera .no tiene  hijo. El Tomo  la decisión de buscar trabajo para salir adelante y terminar sus estudios   y  Como nadie le daba la oportunidad de trabajar en una empresa. El decide juntar dinero  para dar apertura  a su negocio de cyber papelería en general  En la actualidad su negocio poco a poco creció  hasta llegar a tener  una clientela  necesarias Kevin  trabaja en su  negocio solo   diariamente, el   Con el préstamo comprara  computadoras,  papelería, etc. su meta es ampliar su negocio y terminar sus estudios.
texts.en: Kevin lives in the town of Libertad, Ecuador.  He is 22 years old, single, and he does not have any children.  He decided to look for work in order to get ahead and to finish his studies, but since no one gave him a job opportunity, he decided to save money in order to open his own Cyber-cafe and supply shop.  Currently his business is growing little by little gradually gaining the necessary customers.  Kevin works daily at his business.  With the loan he will purchase computers, paper products, etc.  His goal is to grow his business and also to finish school.

loans.use: to buy computers and paper.

loans.name: Angela Ventura

texts.es:
La señora Angela Ventura esta casada, tiene 41 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a la venta de muebles, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de su esposo, hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo, quien se dedica a prestar sus servicios de viajero. 

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de muebles para su comercialización, ya que ella los compra por mayor, espera en el futuro tenga un negocio grande, y con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Angela Ventura is married and is 41 years old.  She completed four years of elementary school, and she has four children, one of whom is still studying.  She works selling furniture.  She began this business thanks to help from her husband.  She has ten years of experience as of this date, and she counts on the economic support of her husband, who works offering his services as a traveling salesman.  

She is asking for a loan that will help her to buy furniture to sell.  She buys the furniture in bulk.  She hopes in the future to have a large business, with better earnings.

loans.use: To buy furniture in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en: Batsaikhan, 47 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. His wife runs her own tailoring business. His daughters go to high school and the elder one will graduate this summer. Since 1997, he has been selling sub products such as sheep intestine, legs and head and providing a taxi service to local people. In January 2012 he purchased a Hyundai Porter, a light truck, which he uses to transport livestock to the sausage factory. The stock available for his business decreased drastically due to the purchase of the light truck. He is requesting a loan of 2000000 MNT to purchase large amounts of stock for his business. As a result, he can get out of a troublesome situation and generate more income for his family. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who is gregarious and ambitious. In the future, he has a goal of accumulating a considerable amount of money to expand his house and invest in his daughters’ education.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of stock for his business

loans.name: Melencia

texts.en:
Melencia operates a barber shop in her place in Alicia, Bohol. She has had this business for more than 20 years now. Melencia wants to expand the business but lacks the capital to do so. For that reason, she is applying for a loan to buy new scissors, powder, brushes, blades, hair dyes and other materials needed in the shop. 

Melencia is hopeful that in the future she will be able to make her business successful and  even more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new scissors, powder, brushes, blades, and hair dyes.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 52 years old, from Olkalou, and is married with five children who are all in school and aged between 21 years and 16 years old.

He has a dairy farming business that he has been doing for the past 12 years and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy a dairy cow to rear for milk production.

He hopes to educate his children well  and improve his family's standard of living in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a 46-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She  has seven children. The oldest child is 24 while the youngest is 10. She is engaged in a dried fish vending business. She buys and at the same time sells dried fish. She has been in the dried fish business for 23 years. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fish, salt, and baskets to be able to produce more and serve her customers in their community. 

In the future, Adelaida would like to expand her business to earn more profit  and be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy   fish, salt, and baskets

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 48 years old and has a motorcycle transport business in Naivasha town. He has been in the transport business for nine years and it has been profitable. He is married to Lucy and they have two school-going children.

This will be his second loan term and he plans to use it to pay school fees for his children. He anticipates generating more income from his transport business and he plans to use it to provide for the needs of his family.

In the future, Paul hopes to grow his business by buying another motorcycle.

loans.use: to pay his children's school fees.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en: Madona is 29 years old. She lives with her parents and husband in the Mukhrani district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milk cows, whose milk is used in dairy products. Madona sells dairy products locally as well as in the nearby villages. They also have a plot of agricultural land, where onions are grown. They sell the harvested onions locally at a good price. Madona is a very hard-working young woman and has rich experience in her business. She has requested a loan to purchase piglets and cultivate the land. After purchasing piglets, she will expand her livestock. After cultivating the land, she will sow onions and thus the income of the family will increase. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Madona awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase piglets

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 62 years old and has operated a 'sari-sari' (variety) store in her place for more than 10 years now. She lives with her family in Bohol, a province in the Philippines. Her husband is in the fishing business.

Narcisa is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, sodas and other beverages, soap, toothpaste and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater for more customers in her store. Narcisa dreams of expanding her business in the future so that it will generate more revenue. Then she will be able to support the needs of the family and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, sodas and other beverages, soap, toothpaste and toiletries

loans.name: Abigael

texts.en:
Abigael is a 30-year-old café owner in Mariakani, Kenya. She is married, and her husband gives additional income. Together they support three children. She has been in this business for the last year and she has made good progress. Her monthly income is great. 

Abigael will use the requested loan to purchase dry food stock for her café: bales of wheat flour, sacks of rice, sugar, boxes of milk, and cooking fat.

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business, this being her second loan. The first one was paid successfully. Abigael hopes to see her business grow to greater heights and to have a prosperous family.

loans.use: to purchase dry food stock for her café: bales of wheat flour, sacks of rice, sugar, boxes of milk, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Rhina

texts.en:
Rhina is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for more than five years now.

Rhina is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, and a new engine for her boat. With this, she and her husband will be able to improve their fishing business and augment their income. Moreover, Rhina wants to save money for her children's schooling. She dreams of seeing them as successful professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, and a new engine for her boat

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
