Peter used his previous loan amount to buy spare parts to repair his motorcycle. This enabled him to keep his motorcycle in good condition and it was profitable so he was able to repay the whole loan amount.

This will be Peter's second loan term and he plans to use the loan to add to his savings so as to buy another motorcycle. This will enable him to expand his business and thereby earn more income with which he will pay the school fees for his children.

Peter hopes to grow his transport business, earn more profits, and buy a plot of land to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Aleks

texts.en:
Aleks is 53 years old. He lives with his mother, wife, and two sons in the small village of Gardabani district. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have four milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese locally in an open market, at a good price. 

Aleks is a very hard-working man and has a rich experience in his business. He requested a loan for purchasing feed for the cows. After purchasing the feed, the cows will be fattening properly. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions. Aleks awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the cows

loans.name: Samalie

texts.en:
Samalie  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both children attend school. She is looking after additional members of the family (sisters). She has operated an eatery for a few months, working six days a week. She does not earn any additional income.

Samalie has requested a loan of UShs 500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock rice, flour, cooking oil and replace plates and saucepans and acquire a bigger charcoal stove.  Her challenges include seasonality, transportation, and realizing funds from creditors. Her dream is to acquire land and grow the food herself and also to own a fully stocked restaurant. Her friends inspired her to join MCDT-SACCO. She rents a house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are rent, transport and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rice, flour, and cooking oil; replace plates and saucepans and also acquire a bigger charcoal stove.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is 62 years old, married, with four children, all above 18 years of age. She owns a grocery stall in a Kapsabet location and has been in operation for a period of 18 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She is servicing her second term loan of KES 40,000 from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) and wishes to use this amount to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale. The profits she earns will be used to repay the loan. Her dream is to be able to grow her business and get more income.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 32-year-old farmer from Mabini, Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has two young children, ages 7 and 4. She has been in the farming business together with her husband for several years now. Alma works hard to assist her husband in meeting the needs of the family. 

Alma is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve their farm and their harvest. In the future, Alma wants to expand her farming business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Analine

texts.en:
Analine is 32 years old and a married woman, living in Anda, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and commodities.

Analine is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda, biscuits, soap, and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to cater to more buyers in her store, thus increasing her sales and income. Analine dreams of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy addiitional stocks to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda, biscuits, soap, and toiletries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy manure for her  farm and take care of her grandchildren.

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en:
Phanice is now 42 years old and single and her children are now 18 and 15 years old. Her grocery has been progressing well and her monthly income has risen to KES. 8,000.

She has applied for her fifth loan  of KES. 60,000 from KADET LTD, and she intends to use this amount to purchase more vegetables and varieties of fruits for resale.  


The profits she earns will be used to plough back into the business and also start the same business in a different location. Her dream in life is to prosper in business and have a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruit for resale.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 33 years old and is married, with two children, aged seven years and four years. Isaac has an Agrovet (animal health care) retail business that he has been running for the past year. 

He has applied for his second loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to enable him to buy vaccinations and drugs to add to his stock. He is optimistic that his business will do well after the loan. He hopes to improve his family's standard of living and expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy vaccinations and drugs for his business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is from Ndunyu Njeru.  He is 51 years old and is married with three children who are all in school.

David is a farmer and has been farming for the past 12 years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy fertilizers and seedlings to use on his farm.

David hopes to improve his family's standard of living in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 37-year-old married woman living in Bohol, Philippines. She has been involved in seaweed farming and rice farming for more than a year now. Her husband works with her in their business.

Alma is asking for a loan to buy more seaweed seedlings and fertilizer for her rice field. With this, they will be able to improve their harvest from both farms.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed seedlings and fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Bizoza Group

texts.fr:
Spéciose fait partie du groupe Bizoza et   habite à Gitega. Elle  a   38 ans et est mariée à Serges, un commerçant de boutique(riz, haricot, savon, ..). Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants, âgés de 6  à 16 ans, dont 3  étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de vin de banane  depuis 1 an et 2 mois. 

Elle est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes pour préparer  beaucoup de litres de vin de banane    à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Avec les bénéfices de son commerce, elle  va payer à l’aise les frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
Spéciose is a member of the Bizoza group and she lives in Gitega.  She is 38 years old and married to Serges, who works in a small retail shop selling rice, beans, soap etc.  Together they have five children whose ages range between 6 and 16.  Three of their children go to school.

Spéciose has been selling banana wine for fourteen months.

This is her fifth loan with Turame.  Her loan from Kiva will allow her to increase her capital and to buy a large quantity of bananas with which she will prepare many liters of banana wine for resale, in order to make more money.

With the profits from her business, she will perfectly be able to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas in order to prepare many liters of banana wine and make more money.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, one of whom attends school. She is looking after her parents as well.

Faith has been selling cooked food in the market at retail for five years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other side job.

She has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to be able to buy cooking utensils and also stock rice, cooking oil, spices and flour. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

Faith’s dream is to grow her business and be able to operate in another area, thus accumulating profits for building rental houses. She joined MCDT because her friends assured her that MCDT-SACCO would give her loans as promised. 

Faith stays in her husband`s house with access to electricity, but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more cooking utensils and also rice, bunches of bananas, spices and flour.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
This will be Samir's second loan. In his first loan, he received 2,000 AZN, and he made payments on his loan on time every month. Samir is very thankful to Kiva and the lenders who have helped him in his business. 

Now his business has changed, as he has begun to sell fruits and vegetables. Samir needs a loan 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to improve his new business and to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To procure fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: Rukia's business is picking up well and the progress has motivated her to increase the supplies she carries. Rukia is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenya shillings to buy hair chemicals, creams, and other beauty products. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to meet emergency needs,  to improve her living standard, and also pay for her children’s school fees. She aspires to open other branches in the future.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals, creams, and other beauty products.

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
El comité San Blas se destaca por la unidad y el deseo de progresar como grupo.La señora Sonia es un  ejemplo de perseverancia y de empeño ella es muy solidaria con todo el grupo y siempre trata de ayudarlas para poder salir adelante.
Sonia se dedica a la venta de prendas, y gracias a este trabajo ayuda a su familia y está saliendo adelante y creciendo como microempresaria.
Esta solicitando de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de variadas clases, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y ganando los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: The “San Blas” committee stands out for its unity and drive to make group progress.  Sonia is an example of perseverance and dedication; she’s very supportive of the rest of the group and always tries to help them get ahead.  She sells cloths and thanks to this work is able to help her family; she’s getting ahead and growing as a businesswoman.  She’s asking for this loan to buy assorted clothes to continue working and earning income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon runs a sari-sari (or variety) store business in her place in Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the business for more than two years now.

Corazon is asking for a loan to buy additional stock of rice, canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, and other items. Through this, she will be able to cater to more buyers in her store thus augmenting her income and profits. Corazon hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice, canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, and other items.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar  tiene 36 años, convive con su pareja, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 9 años. Ellos habitan un hogar propio ubicado en una zona agrícola. La alegría y el trabajo constante son unas de las virtudes que lo caracterizan. Él es un hombre de campo y le gusta su actividad. Él es agricultor desde que era niño, por eso se considera un experto. 
Actualmente se encarga de la producción de papas, ollucos y ocas (tubérculos andinos). Los que al cosechar vende satisfactoriamente en el mercado mayorista de su distrito y en varias ocasiones los traslada hasta la ciudad Tarma. 
Así también posee aproximadamente 2 centenas de ganado ovino, de cuyas ventas en carnes obtiene ingresos considerables. “Con estas actividades me va bien, porque me pude comprar una camioneta, así viajo con mis productos”, menciona. 
La temporada de siembras de papas ha llegado por ello requiere de su apoyo para adquirir fertilizantes y semillas. Éste es su crédito número 15 con MFP. Está muy agradecido por todo el apoyo en estos ciclos. Se compromete en pagar las cuotas con puntualidad. Pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando un futuro mejor” y se siente orgulloso de sus socios.
Con los 1000 solicitados podrá adquirir semillas de papas y guano de ave para fertilizar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Edgar is 36 years old and lives with his partner with whom he has 2 children aged 11 and 9 years old. They live in their own home located in an agricultural area. Happiness and constant work are several of the virtues which characterise him. He is a man of the land and he enjoys his work. He has been a farmer since he was a child, so he considers himself to be an expert. 
He currently deals with the production of potatoes, ullucas and ocas (Andean tubers). When these are harvested he sells them successfully at his district's wholesale market and on some occasions he transports them to the city of Tarma. 
He also owns around two hundred sheep, whose meat he sells to make a considerable income. "This work is going well for me, because I have been able to buy a van so that I can travel with my products", he says. 
The season for sowing potatoes has arrived and this is why he needs your support in order to buy fertiliser and seeds. This is his fifteenth loan with MFP. He is very grateful for all of the support he has received in these cycles. He is committed to making his repayments punctually. He belongs to the communal bank "Looking to a better future" and he feels proud of his fellow members.
With the 1000 PEN he is requesting he will be able to buy potato seeds and bird guano to fertilise his crops.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and bird guano to fertilise his crops.

loans.name: Brisa Del Este Group

texts.es:
El comité Brisa del Este tiene 16 miembros, donde todas y cada una de ellas está trabajando duro para poder ayudar a sus familias. Zulma, una de las miembros, se dedica a la costura, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante y progresar para ayudar a su familia.
Ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura, donde hace todo tipo de trabajos, desde siempre ha trabajado y es por eso no teme a ningún desafío. Es una persona muy talentosa y que desea ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de hilos, telas, botones y demás, para poder seguir haciendo sus costuras y seguir creciendo.
texts.en: The “Brisa del Este” (East Breeze) committee has 16 members; each and every one of them is working hard to be able to help her family.  Zulma is one of the members and she works sewing.  She’s a very responsible person who very much wants to get ahead and make progress to help her family. She has a small sewing workshop where she does all kinds of jobs.  She’s always worked so she fears no challenge.  She’s a talented person who wants to help her family.  She’s requesting the loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, etc. to continue sewing and growing.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Mufariji Group

texts.fr: La cliente Vumilia, conseillère du groupe Mufariji, entrepreneur courageuse et mère de 10 enfants, qui vont tous à l’école. Son conjoint est un maître mâcon constructeur. La cliente est vendeuse de Tabac brut, qu’elle revend aux industriels rwandais. Elle réalise des transactions frontalières (la république démocratique du Congo et le Rwanda). Elle commença cette affaire avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 10 tas de tabac de 500 kg. La cliente supporte trop de taxes frontalières. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son accompagnement en micro crédit aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
The borrower, Vumilia, is the representative of the Mufariji group.  She is a courageous entrepreneur and the mother of ten children who all go to school.  Her husband is a master mason-builder.

Vumilia sells raw tobacco to Rwandese manufacturers.  She conducts cross-border transactions between the Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda.  She started in this business using her own fund, received from her husband.  This new loan will help her to buy ten 500-kilo piles of tobacco.  

Vumilia has to pay too many border taxes.  For this reason, she thanks Hekima for the support it provides, through micro-credit, to small entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy ten 500-kg piles of tobacco.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 56 years old and a fisherman from Bohol, Philippines. He is a married man and a father of two grown children.

Felix is asking for a loan to buy additional fishing materials like nets, lead weights, hooks, and buckets for storage. With this, he will be able to improve his fishing business as well as his earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials like nets, lead weights, hooks, and buckets for storage.

loans.name: Dan

texts.en: Dan is a married man. He has two children aged three and eight years-old.  He describes himself as an ambitious man. He operates a retail store  where he sells video tapes, compact discs, etc . His business is located at a very competitive business area and his primary customers are local residents . He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy video tapes and compact discs to sell . His business goal is to expand his business within five years.

loans.use: to buy movie tapes and compact discs.

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es:
Yanina tiene 27 años, convive con Osvaldo, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 8 años. Esta familia vive, por ahora, en una casa alquilada en la ciudad. De carácter sosegado y constante. Yanina se dedica a la venta de ropa en las ferias de 2 ciudades. 
Yanina aprendió de sus hermanas el comercio de ropa. Por esa razón viaja constantemente a la ciudad de Lima, donde adquiere su mercadería por docenas y cientos. 
En esta actividad lleva como 5 años, y le agrada el ritmo de trabajo. Viaja cada quincena hasta las tiendas de los mismos confeccionistas, y obtiene prendas como: pantalones, chompas, casacas, polos, etc., pues sus clientes le hacen cada vez más pedidos. Sus ventas las realiza de manera ambulatoria, en cada feria de la ciudad de Tarma, (jueves y domingos), y obtiene buenas ganancias gracias a los clientes fijos que captó en todos sus años como vendedora.
El negocio no descansa por ello solicita una vez más de su apoyo, para adquirir más mercadería. Éste es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las mensualidades. Le gusta trabajar dentro de su banco comunal “Mirando un futuro mejor”, porque le agradan las reuniones y charlas educativas.
Con lo solicitado Yanina podrá comprar ropa y expenderla en las ferias de los jueves y domingos.
texts.en:
Yanina, 27, lives with Osvaldo with whom she has two children who are 11 and 8 years old.  For now, this family lives in a rented house in the city.  Of serene, constant temperament, Yanina works selling clothes in the markets in two cities.  She learned the clothing business from her sisters.  Because of this she travels to Lima constantly which is where she gets her merchandise by the dozen or by the hundreds.

She’s been in business for five years and she likes the rhythm of work.  She travels every two weeks to the clothing designers’ stores and buys items like pants, sweaters, jackets, shirts, etc. because her customers place more orders every time.  She sells from place to place on market days in the city of Tarma (Thursdays and Sundays) and earns good profits thanks to the regular customers she’s won over in the years she’s been in sales.

The business does not rest which is why she once again is asking for your support to acquire merchandise.  This will be MFP loan #5 and she commits to be punctual with her monthly payments.  She likes working in the “Mirando un future major” (Seeing a better future) communal bank because she enjoys the meetings and the educational chats.  Yanina will be able to use what she’s requested to buy clothes to then sell in the Thursday and Sunday markets.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell in the Thursday and Sunday markets.

loans.name: Delfin Group

texts.es:
Doña Paula es uno de los integrantes del Grupo Delfin el cual esta integrado por 11 personas alegres, trabajadoras y amables cada una de ellas tiene una actividad económica:
Laura venta de topper 
Bertha venta de carne
Maria Isabel venta de comida
Ana Maria Venta de Abarrotes 
Julio venta de Frutas y verduras 
Paula Cria de cerdos
Rodrigo Venta de antojitos 
Agustin taller de reparacion de calzado
Loida venta de mole
Denis venta de zapatos 
Erick Eduardo venta de antojitos 

Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en las comunidad de Tetela en una Zona cañera y su gente se dedica al trabajo del campo siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar.

Doña Paula tiene la edad de 52 años, esta casada con Don Alberto y solo estudio la primaria, Ella platica que como no le dieron muchos estudios aprendió a trabajar desde pequeña ya que sus padres le enseñaron que solo trabajando se sale adelante, Ella se dedica a la cría de cerdos desde hace 10 años, los compra desde pequeños y los alimenta y cuida en un chiquero(corral) que tiene en su hogar cuando ya están grandes y gordos los vende.
Doña Paula también se dedica a la siembra de caña de azúcar. 
Un crédito ayudara a doña Paula a comprar alimentos para continuar con la cría de cerdos.
 Ella esta muy contenta con su actividad y espera con sus ganancias hacer unas mejoras en su hogar y seguir invirtiendo mas en su negocio.
Este grupo agradece a vision Fund el apoyo que les brinda y envían un gran saludo a las personas que harán posible su préstamo.
texts.en:
Paula is one of the members of the “Delfín” (Dolphin) group which has 11 cheerful, hardworking, kind members each with their own economic activity: 

Laura sells Tupperware 
Bertha sells meat
María Isabel sells food
Ana María sells groceries 
Julio sells fruit and vegetables 
Paula raises pigs
Rodrigo sells fast-food snacks 
Agustin has a shoe repair shop
Loida sells ‘mole’ [traditional chili sauce]
Denis sells shoes 
Erick Eduardo sells fast-food snacks 

This group is located in the community of Tetela in a sugarcane growing zone; its residents work in the fields growing sugarcane.

Paula, 52, is married to Alberto.  She only attended elementary school.  She relates that since she did not receive formal education she learned to work when still little since her parents taught her that only through work could one get ahead.  She’s been working raising pigs for ten years.  She buys them when they are little and feeds and cares for them in a corral she has at home and when they are big and fat she sells them.  Paula also works in the sugarcane fields.  A loan will help Paula buy feed to continue raising pigs.  She’s very happy with her activity and hopes with her profits to do some home improvements and continue investing more into her business.

The group thanks Vision Fund for the support it provides them and sends a warm greeting to all the people who will make their loan possible.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Ruhim

texts.en:
Ruhim has been in the agriculture business for three years. It is the third loan for Ruhim through Kiva. He is very thankful to lenders and Kiva for helping to improve his business. 

Ruhim needs 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manats) to buy calves to increase his business. He has been an IDP (internally Displaced Person) from Fizuli City, but now he has settled in the Fizuli region with his family. Ruhim is married and has two children.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Shota

texts.en:
Shota is 58 years old. He lives in Marneuli district with his wife and two sons. Shota works as a baker at the bakery and his wife is a nurse. Both of them earn a monthly salary. 

Shota has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but he hasn't had any success. He wants to start his own bakery, but his loan requests have always been rejected in the past because of his lack of experience, which is usually required by local credit providers. Shota has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Shota will start his own bakery. He will bake traditional Georgian bread and sell it for a good price. He owns a commercial space and he hopes his project will be profitable as he already has the baking experience and will offer quality products to his customers. This will increase his sales volume. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to start a bakery.

loans.name: Maria Leny

texts.en:
Maria Leny has earned a living through her sari-sari or variety store business for more than ten years now. She sells various goods to the people in her place in Anda, Bohol.

Maria Leny is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, noodles, bread, soda, soap, and other items. With this, she will be able to cater to more buyers in her store. 

Maria Leny hopes to expand her business in the future so that it will generate more income necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, noodles, bread, soda, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
Blas tiene 50 años de edad, convive con Dionicia, con quien tiene un hijo de 12 años. Esta familia vive unida en una casa propia que Blas construyó con esfuerzo y se ubica en una zona rural.
De buenos principios y de carácter emprendedor Blas se dedica a varias actividades: servicio de transporte con un vehículo, la agricultura y la ganadería. Pero asegura que su prioridad es la agricultura, por la destreza que consiguió en más de 30 años de trabajo.
Su zona es propicia para la producción de una variedad de papas harinosas y para la crianza de animales como ovejas y vacas, gracias a los pastos naturales. Por esas razones Blas se esfuerza en mejorar su cosecha y sus ganados.
“Estos meses voy a sembrar papas y ollucos”, dice, entusiasta.
Considera que la mayor inversión se genera en la compra de fertilizantes y en traslado de éstos hacia sus parcelas (2 horas de viaje desde la ciudad). 
Está entusiasmado en la próxima siembra, por ello solicita su ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes y semillas. Éste es su préstamo número 11 con MFP, por ello se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las mensualidades. En cuanto a su banco comunal “Mirando un futuro mejor”, menciona que le agradan las reuniones y las charlas educativas.
Blas destinará los 1500 soles en la compra de fertilizantes orgánicos y semillas de papas y ollucos.
texts.en:
Blas, 50, lives with Dionicia with whom he has a 12-year-old son.  This family lives in its own house that Blas built with effort; it’s located in a rural zone.  Blas has good principles and good character and he does a variety of things: he provides transportation service with a vehicle; he works in agriculture and in animal husbandry.  He insists that his main priority is agriculture, though, because of the skill he’s acquired with 30 years’ of work.

His zone is apt for growing a variety of starchy potatoes and to raise animals like sheep and cattle because of the natural grasses.  Because of this, Blas strives to improve his crops and his cattle.  He states enthusiastically: “These months I’m going to plant potatoes and olluco [Andean tuber].”  He feels that his greatest cost is in the purchase of fertilizer and transporting it to his parcels (a two hour trip from the city).

He’s excited about the next planting cycle which is why he’s asking for your help to buy fertilizer and seeds.  This will be MFP loan #11 and he commits to be punctual with his monthly payments.  With respect to his “Mirando un future mejor” (Seeing a better future) communal bank, he mentions that he enjoys the meetings and the educational chats.  Blas needs 1,500 soles to buy organic fertilizer and potato and olluco seeds.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and potato and olluco seeds.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as an ambitious and determined man . He operates a retail store where he provides electronics repair services. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a competitive business area and his primary customers are local residents . He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy electronics spare parts. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his first loan with Kiva partner SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy electronics spare parts.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza owns and operates a furniture shop. She has been in the business, together with her husband, for several years. They make tables, cabinets, and other furniture.

Liza needs a loan to buy materials for making furniture, like woods, nails, and varnish. With this increase in materials inventory, they will be able to produce more products and sell more to the market.

Liza hopes to expand their business in the future, in order to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy materials for making furniture, like woods, nails, and varnish.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children and both of them attend school. She is not looking after any other family members.

She has been selling second hand clothes at retail in the market and from door to door for three years, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested for a loan of UShs 400,000 from Kiva partner MCDT- SACCO in order to enable her to buy bales of second hand clothes to sell. Her challenges include seasonality and ever increasing prices of used clothes. Her dream is to expand her business, employ people in other markets and also to start importing used clothes. She joined MCDT for more capital and because of timely loans. She rents a house without access to either electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are rent, water and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 49 year-old fisherman from Bohol, Philippines. He is married and has two children.

Henry needs a loan in order to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and fuel for the boat. With this, he will be able to improve his catch and give him more fish to sell in the market. Henry dreams of expanding his business and making it sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and three of them attend school. She is also looking after her mother.

She has been selling second hand shoes in the market at retail prices for five years, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested for a loan of UShs 400,000 from Kiva partner MCDT- SACCO in order to enable her to buy more  bales of used  shoes to sell. Her challenges include unstable prices and seasonality. Her dream is to employ people to work with her and also to become a wholesaler. She joined MCDT to expand her business to retail in the course of time and for the relatively low interest charged on the loans. She stays in her husband`s house with no access to either  electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medical bills.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is happy because of the progress her business is making. She is able to provide for her family, despite the small size of her venture. She was able to complete the repayments of the first loan on time.

Now Juliet is applying for a new loan, of 15,900 Kenyan shillings, to purchase ingredients to use in making the foods she sells, such as sugar, flour, cooking oil and potatoes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings, to improve her family's living standard. She aspires to own other business locations, and to pay for her children’s education with much security.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs like sugar, flour, cooking oil and potatoes.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, a 42-year-old mother of four children, is married to Michael. They all live in Nakuru town, where she works in the timber selling business. Having been in the business for more than 10 years, she says it has been profitable and it has enabled her to provide for the needs of her family.

This is her first loan term, and she plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of timber for sale. This will enable her to meet the high demand for timber from her customers, who include carpenters and people in the construction business. She anticipates generating more income, with which she will pay school fees for her children.

Beatrice hopes to grow her business, make more income, and be able to buy a plot of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more stock of timber for sale.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. She is also looking after her mother. She stays in her husband's house, with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

She has been retailing second-hand shoes in the market for the past two years, working six days a week. She does not have an additional source of income.

Juliet has requested a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDT-SACCO, to enable her to buy more second-hand shoes for sale. She joined MCDT because she did not have enough capital for her business. Her business challenges include seasonality and hard luck -- when she finds damaged shoes in a bale of shoes she has bought. Her dream is to expand her business and be able to sell whole bales, instead of selling shoes one pair at a time.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 62-year-old, married woman, and a mother of two grown-up children. She is from Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in fishing and a rice farming business, together with her husband. They have done this work for more than 30 years.
 
Lolita is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets and lead weights. With this equipment, her husband will be able to improve his catch.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and lead weights

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 38-year-old woman from the town of Anda, Bohol. She is married and has six children, ages 1 to 17 years. Veronica and her husband rely on rice farming to provide for their children. This business provides them an income of 5,000 PHP every month.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm, so she can have an abundant harvest. She hopes to continue sending her children to school, so she can provide them a better future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice crop

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of them attending school. She is not looking after any additional family member. She rents a house without access to either electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, transportation and rent.

She has been selling banana leaves, charcoal and jackfruit in the market, at retail, for many years. She works seven days a week. She does not earn any additional income.

Zaina has requested a loan of UGX 200,000 from MCDT-SACCO, to enable her to stock more banana leaves, charcoal and jackfruit for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to eliminate the middlemen, by going to the villages to get the commodities from the suppliers, themselves. She joined MCDT because of convenient terms tied to enrolling as a member.

loans.use: To buy more banana leaves, charcoal and jackfruit, to resell in the market.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en: Madelyn is a merchant living in Bohol, Philippines. She has owned and run a sari-sari (variety store) for several years. This is the source of her income. Madelyn is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, of items like canned goods, bread and biscuits, soap and soda. Madelyn believes that through this loan, she will be able to improve her store and attract more customers and buyers to the store.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, of items like canned goods, bread and biscuits, soap and soda.

loans.name: Mangovy Group

texts.es:
El Comité "Mangovy", es un comité con 10 integrantes se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo.  Todas son mujeres trabajadoras, el  comité está en la ciudad de Curuguaty.
Lorenza, miembro de este grupo, se dedica a las ventas, tiene una pequeña despensa, con la cual surte a su vecindario con todo tipo de productos. Trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano y lo hace hasta muy tarde. Ella quiere seguir trabajando para ir mejorando su negocio e ir creciendo. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, verduras, carnes y demás insumos para poder seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientes y así tener un mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
The "Mangovy" communal bank is a group with 10 members, and they are in their fourth loan cycle. They are all hard-working women, and live in the city of Curuguaty.

Lorenza, a member of this group, works in retail sales. She has a small grocery store with which she supplies her neighborhood with every type of product.

She works every day from a very early hour, and does so until very late. She wants to continue working so that she can gradually improve her business and see it grow. 

She is applying for this loan in order to invest in the purchase of drinks, vegetables, meats and other supplies, so that she can continue giving good variety to her customers, and have a better income.

loans.use: To buy drinks, vegetables, meats and other items to sell.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka closed the year on a high note, in her business. She sold a high volume of fish and was well able to repay her loan. The income she earned with that loan helped provide for the family's needs.

Currently, her main challenges are the high cost of transportation and the perishable nature of her goods, because she buys fish from upcountry. These challenges have forced her to deal primarily in dried fish.

Mwaka is now applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings, to purchase additional stock of fish for sale. The extra income from the business will enable her to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en: Sera is a 40-year-old, married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as a sociable woman. She operates a retail store, where she sells onions. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located at a viable business location, and her primary customers are local residents. She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy onions to sell. Her business goal is to run a new retail shop within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy onions to sell

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a 33-year-old woman from Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. She is married and her husband works as a fisherman. While he fishes, Sara also helps by selling fish and farming rice and vegetables. The income provides for her family's basic needs like food and school fees for her two children ages 5 and 7. 

Sara is asking for a loan to buy fishing net and fertilizer for her farm. She is hoping that in the future she can further improve her business and generate a better profit for her family.

loans.use: buy fishing net and fertilizer

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 50 years old, married and his five children are aged between 15 and 2 years old.  He owns a pharmacy shop, selling both animal and human drugs, and has been in operation for over a period of 15 years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000.

David is now servicing his third loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase drugs for resale.  

The profits he earns will be used to educate his children and ploughed back into his business. His dream is to prosper in his business.

loans.use: purchase medicine to resell

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity's business of selling vegetables like tomatoes, kale, etc. is doing well. She is grateful that she is earning a higher income to support her family and also repay her loan.

Purity is applying for a new loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to buy vegetables wholesale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help restock her business for more sales and income to help educate her children.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madinalives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and two of them attend school. She is also looking after her sisters.

Madinalives has been selling second-hand shoes from door to door for one year at retail, working five days a week. She does not earn any additional income.  She has requested for a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to purchase more shoes for resale. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to be able to rent a place so that she can stop moving from door to door, and also to become a wholesaler.  She joined MCDT in order to be able to buy a bale of shoes for sale. She stays in her husband's house and has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are school fees and food.

loans.use: buy used shoes to resell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children from Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than eight years now. This is the only source of their income. 

Marissa needs a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. With this, her husband will be able to catch more fish, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Marissa hopes of making their business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the continuous schooling of her children.

loans.use: buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets

loans.name: Ruffa

texts.en: Ruffa is 59 years old and a resident of Bohol, Philippines. She is married with six grown children. Ruffa owns a sari-sari store which has been her livelihood for 3 years now.  She is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, seasoning, milk and coffee to sell.  This loan will give her the chance to increase her inventory and sales. She hopes that in the future she can have a better savings for her old age.

loans.use: buy food items to resell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is now 41 years old and single, supporting her four children aged between 17 and 7 years.  Her hotel business has enabled her to start an alternative business that is retail shop and now it is four years old and her monthly income is KES 15,000.

Emily is servicing her third term loan KES 60,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to purchase stocks of maize flour, rice, sugar, tealeaves, cooking oil.  

The profits she earns will be used to educate her school-going children.  She hopes to expand her business and be prosperous in life.

loans.use: buy maize flour, sugar, cooking oil, and rice

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 36 years old, married and has two children. They live in Bohol, Philippines. Marivic has been running a sari-sari or variety store business for more than three years now.  Her husband is a fisherman.

Marivic works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family.  She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell, like bread, candies, bicuits, noodles, soap and shampoo. With this, she will be able to cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is 50 years old. She lives in the small village in Gardabani district with her son, daughter-in-law and 2 infant grandchildren. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have cows, whose milk is used in dairy products. 

Lia sells dairy products locally in an open market at a good price. She is a very hard-working woman and has a rich experience in her business. She requested a loan for purchasing more calves. After purchasing the calves, she will be able to expand her dairy farm. This will increase the income for the family. With the increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions. Lia awaits your support.

loans.use: buy calves for her dairy farm

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en: Ronnie is a married man with six children. He is 32 years old and lives with his family in Anda, Bohol.  Ronnie spends most of his time farming coconut and working as a laborer for other farmers. His livelihood started 5 years ago. He is asking for a loan to buy materials like hardwood, nails and nipa palm to renovate his house so he can provide his family a better place to live in. He is determined to work hard for the sake of his family and the welfare of his six children, ages 1 to 12. He hopes to give them education for a better life.

loans.use: buy materials for house renovation

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes se esfuerzan por el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, son conocidas por el trabajo que hacen y por el apoyo que se dan las unas a las otras.
La Sra. Noelia, presidenta del grupo, es una mujer casada, es muy activa y promueve el fortalecimiento del comité. Por su parte ella trabaja en la venta de frutas, tiene todo tipo de ellas, y gracias a sus buenos productos le está yendo bien y tiene buena venta. Su sueño es poder tener una gran frutería donde poder seguir deleitando a sus clientes con sus productos.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas y así tener un buen stock y seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo hasta hoy.
texts.en:
This communal bank is from the city of San Lorenzo.  Each member of the group works hard to grow their business.  They are known for the work that they do, and for the support that they give one another.

Noelia is the president of the group.  She is a married woman who is very active, and she promotes the strengthening of the communal bank.  Noelia has a business selling all types of fruits, and thanks to her good products her sales are good and the business is doing well.  Her dream is to be able to have a large fruit store where she could continue to delight her customers with her products. 

Noelia is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of fruit so that she can have a good quantity of fruit to sell.  This way, she can continue to work as she has been doing up until now.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
El Sr. Vicente es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es soltero, y se dedica al comercio. Es dueño de una despensa en la que trabaja desde hace dos años, cuenta que se está abriendo camino y que gracias a que siempre tiene de todo en su local ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela. El es una persona muy entusiasta y que desea seguir creciendo e invirtiendo en su negocio. Con esto ayuda en los gastos de la casa y sigue mejorando de a poco su negocio.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, lácteos, panificados, verduras y demás insumos para poder seguir dando a sus clientes una buena variedad de productos y así ganarse  otros nuevos.
texts.en:
Vincente is from the city of Curuguaty.  He is single and works as a merchant.  Vincente is the owner of a store where he's been working for 2 years.  He says that he's making headway with the business, because he's attracted a good number of customers due to the fact that he always has a very well-stocked store.   He is a very enthusiastic person who wants to keep growing and investing in his business so that he can help with the household expenses and continue to improve his business over time.

Vincente is requesting a loan to invest in drinks, dairy products, bread, vegetables and other products.  This way, he can continue to provide his customers with a good variety of products and also attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, bread, vegetables and other products

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 26 years old, married, and has two children. She is from the village of Teleti and lives with her husband, mother-in-law and children. Natia's mother-in-law works at the poultry farm, and her husband is a laborer. Both family members earn monthly income. Natia runs a small poultry farm and sells eggs, from her house. In addition, she works as a cook at the local kindergarten and earns a small monthly salary.

Natia is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase a milking cow. She will be able to produce and sell cheese. Natia wants to expand her business, in order to earn a good profit. With the increased profit, she will be able to reinvest in her agricultural business, as well as spend more on the family’s daily needs. As a result, the living conditions for the family will improve. Natia is a very hard-working person, with a rich experience in her work.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any additional family member. She stays in her husband's house, with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

She has been selling snacks at retail, from home, for three years. She works seven days a week. She does not have any other job.

She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT-SACCO, to purchase more ingredients, like wheat, baking flour, cooking oil, cassava and potatoes, to use in making snacks for sale. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to grow her business to a level of supplying the surrounding shops with snacks for sale. She joined MCDT because of the low interest charged on loans, and the hope to take loans for paying school fees.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to use in making her snacks to sell, like wheat flour, cassava and cooking oil.

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en: Angelie is a 28-year-old woman from the community of CPG, Bohol. She is married and works hard for her fishing business to flourish. She and her husband have worked together for 7 years now to earn a living and to improve their lives. She is asking for a loan to buy a new engine for their fishing boat. She hopes that with this new tool, they can be more productive at sea. Someday, she hopes to improve their fishing business for a better income. She also hopes to have children.

loans.use: to buy a new engine.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 44 year old married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself as a polite woman. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a local residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 15,000 KES loan to buy a cow. Her business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is divorced and has three children, and all of them are attending school. She does not look after any other family members. She stays in her house, which has access to neither electricity nor piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

Fatuma has been selling fish at retail, in the market, for eight years. She works seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.
 
She has requested for a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT-SACCO, to enable her to buy more fish for sale. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to be able to start selling at wholesale. She joined MCDT, because she did not have enough money for meaningful business.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish for resale

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a fish vendor from Bohol, Philippines. He is married and and has 11 children.

Reynaldo has been selling fish for more than 15 years. Reynaldo needs a loan to buy more fish to sell. With this increased inventory, he will be able to sell more, thus increasing his sales volume and income. Reynaldo dreams of making his business grow and become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more fish for sale to customers.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en: Roberta is a 59-year-old married mother of three children. They live in Bohol, Philippines. She runs a sari-sari, or variety store. Roberta wants to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. Because of this, she is asking for a loan to buy more canned goods, soda, noodles, bread, rice, soap, toiletries, and other items to sell. With this loan, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, soda, noodles, bread, rice, soap, toiletries, and other items to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
The area John lives in faces perennial water shortages and relies on people like him for clean/portable water. He is glad to have impacted the community as he earns an income. This enabled him to repay the loan well too.

John is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenyan shillings to repair his tap, buy more tanks and construct a good site to sell water. Part of the loan will also help pay for school fees. John’s future ambition is to make his business a big source of portable water for the village. The challenges he faces are theft and some customers not paying on time.

loans.use: to repair the tap, buy more tanks and construct a good site.

loans.name: Romie

texts.en:
Romie is a 26-year-old man from Bohol, Philippines. He is married and has three young children. It has not been easy for him to rely only on his motorcycle for his transportation business. Sometimes, his income is not enough for his family.

He is asking for a loan, so he can persevere and go on with his livelihood. He will use the loan to buy a spare tire, and to pay for vulcanizing and gasoline. This way, he will be able to continue his services. He hopes to buy a new and branded motorcycle in the future, for a better income and motor performance. Romie is determined to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy a spare tire, and to pay for vulcanizing and gasoline for the motorcycle that is his work tool.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a 55-year-old married woman. She has 4 children between the ages of 2 and 27. She describes herself as humble, caring and hardworking. She operates a retail store where she provides maize-grinding services to customers. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a convenient business environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use this 20,000 KES loan to buy a new grinding machine. Her business goal is to build a large permanent building that will accommodate many mills for grinding maize into maize flour so she can satisfy the high demand of customers within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a new grinding machine.

loans.name: Mujeres Encantadoras Group

texts.es:
10 son las mujeres de Caacupé que se han unido y forman este grupo, ellas son personas que pese a los inconvenientes quieren trabajar y ayudar a sus familias.
La señora Maria es la tesorera del comité, ella solicita su crédito para invertirlo en la compra de panificados, yerba, frutas, azúcar, etc. para cargar mas su despensa. Tiene un negocio bien surtido, pero quiere poder surtirlo más, ya que sabe que eso atrae a más clientes.
Todas las miembros están contentas, ya que el programa las está ayudando y mejoran así sus vidas.
texts.en:
There are 10 women who have united to form the Caacupé group. They are people who despite the difficulties want to work and help their families. 

Maria is the treasurer of the committee. She is asking for a loan to buy bread, mate, fruits, sugar, etc for her food-stock. She has a well-supplied business, but wants to ensure it is further well-stocked, since she knows that this way she will attract more customers. 

All of the members are happy, since the program is helping them and improving their lives.

loans.use: to buy bread, mate, fruits, sugar, etc

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is quite grateful for the first loan she received. The business made enough income to provide for the family and repay the loan on time. Margaret is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenyan shillings to buy printing papers, books, pens, envelopes and airtime cards. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living conditions of her family and pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to see her business grow to the level of employing more people.

loans.use: to buy more stationery such as printing papers, books, pens, envelopes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and run one Fresh Life toilet.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 48-year-old married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself as a God-fearing, determined and honest man. He operates a retail store  where he sells jewelry. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His business is located in a viable business environment and his primary customers are churches and local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as the high price of jewelry . He will use this 20,000 KES loan to buy jewelry to sell. His business goal is to shift more of his concentration to a business providing transportation to customers within 5 years. Previously, Julius took a loan of 5,000 KES which he managed to pay successfully. In addition, he sells snacks, which increases his business income.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de 14 mujeres se llama Mujeres unidas, lleva ese nombre ya que todas ellas son muy unidas, trabajan juntas y se ayudan las unas a las otras, y es por eso que son muy conocidas en el barrio.
La Sra. Betty, es casada tiene 29 años, es parte del grupo, se dedica a la venta de ropas. Tiene todo tipo de prendas las cuales vende en forma ambulante y con los ingresos que tiene ayuda a su familia y cubre los gastos del día a día.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas y así venderlas y tener una buena ganancia. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe, la cual aprovechara.
texts.en:
This group of 14 women is called "Mujeres Unidas," and bears that name as they are all very united, work together, and help one another. That is why they are very well known in the neighborhood. 

Betty is 29 years old and married. She is part of the group and sells clothing. She has every kind of clothing, which she sells as a street vendor, and with the income she has, helps her family and covers day-to-day expenses.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of articles of clothing; to sell them and make a good profit. She is grateful for this opportunity she is receiving, and will make good use of it.

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a 51-year-old married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be a focused man. He operates a farm and he sells farm products. His business is located in a viable business environment and his primary customers are retailers and residents from the environs. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving his business. 

Elijah will use this 11,100 Kenyan shilling loan to buy a water tank that will be used by his seven family members. His business goal is to improve his business within five years.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Rahab is a married woman. She has four children, whose ages range from 6 to 14 years. She describes herself as a polite and jovial woman. She operates a business; she provides garbage collection services. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy market, and her primary customers are shopkeepers. She says her biggest business challenge is the lack of a room, from which to serve her customers. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy materials to use in collecting garbage. Her business goal is to run a large garbage collection company  within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy materials to use in collecting garbage.

loans.name: Haron

texts.en: Haron is a 27-year-old, married man. He has one child. He describes himself as an innovative and ambitious man. He operates a retail store, where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for three years. His store is located in a busy business area, and his primary customers are local residents. He says his biggest business challenge is the lack of a storage facility for milk. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a freezer for storing milk, so it won't spoil. His business goal is to be a big supplier of milk within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for storing his milk inventory, so it won't spoil.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 22-year-old, married woman. She has two children, ages 2 and 6 years. She describes herself as an honest, hard-working and ambitious woman.

She operates a greengrocery stall, where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a well-populated area, and her primary customers are local residents. She says her biggest business challenge is a shortage of stock for selling. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to address that challenge, by buying vegetables and fruits to resell. Her business goal is to run a well-established grocery store within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

In addition to managing her greengrocery business, Beatrice sells meals, snacks and tea in her restaurant, which increases her business income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to resell

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en: Monica is a 39-year-old, married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as an honest and self-motivated woman. She operates a grocery stall, where she sells fruits such as oranges, lemons, and mangoes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a well-populated area, and her primary customers are people from nearby. She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more fruit to resell. Her business goal is to be a fruit supplier within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to resell at her grocery stall.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado las triunfadoras está en su tercer ciclo, y trabajan duro para poder salir adelante. Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Yolanda, ella tiene un puesto de comidas en su casa, cuenta ella que su familia la ayuda en el negocio y que así están saliendo adelante. Las comidas que prepara son muy ricas y solicitadas y es por eso que le va muy bien.
Su meta es poder seguir con su negocio y más adelante poder ir agrandándolo. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos, los cuales quiere utilizar para seguir haciendo sus comidas, estos productos son carne, condimentos, verduras, hortalizas y demás.
texts.en:
This group, named Las Triunfadoras ("The Winners") is in its third cycle, and the women work hard to move ahead. One of the group partners is Yolanda, who sells food from her house. She says that the business has helped her family and that they are moving ahead in this way. The food she prepares is delicious and in good demand, so it's going very well for her. 

Her goal is to be able to continue with her business and to be able to expand it in the future. She asks for the loan to invest in the purchase of supplies which she wants to use to continue making food. These products are  meat, condiments, vegetables, vegetables, and more.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, vegetables, and more.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Sr. Luis de 30 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de medicamentos menores, como ser aspirinas, antigripales, etc. Él anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de pan de miel, pero hoy en día realiza la venta de medicamentos por todo Itaugua y ciudades cercanas.
Es una persona muy trabajadora que demuestra sus ganas de salir adelante por medio de su trabajo y de su esfuerzo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de pastillas como ser aspirinas, antigripales y demás, para poder seguir con su trabajo y así ganarse el sustento diario.
texts.en:
Luis is 30 years old and dedicates himself to the sale of over the counter medicine like aspirin, flu remedies, etc. Previously, he dedicated himself to the sale of breads made with honey, but today he is selling medicine throughout Itaugua and nearby towns.

He is a very hardworking person who demonstrates his desire to achieve through his work and his effort.

He is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of pills like aspirin, flu remedies, and more, so that he will be able to continue his work and thus earn a daily living.

loans.use: to buy pills like aspirin, flu remedies, and more.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a 29-year-old, married woman. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. She operates a retail stall, where she sells clothes. Her business is located alongside a busy shopping center, and her primary customers are residents of the neighborhood. She says her biggest business challenge is stiff competition in the area. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to resell. Her business goal is to expand her business  within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Tajy Punta Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Mujeres Emprendedoras que lleva el nombre de Tajy Punta, tuvó sus  inicios en setiembre del 2011,  actualmente cuenta con 15 integrantes, se encuentran en el 5to. Ciclo.
Una de las historias que se destaca es el de la señora Corina con 31 años de edad, madre soltera de 4 hijos, ella se dedica a la  confección de colchas y hamacas los cuales sale a vender por la  capital del país, además de otros productos como ropas, zapatos,etc.Todos los fines de semana sin importar las condiciones del tiempo ella se dedica a este trabajo el cual le ayuda para la manutención de sus hijos y de esa forma lucha para poder darles un futuro mejor sin privaciones.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas, para poder seguir vendiendo y así seguir dando a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan para crecer dignamente.
texts.en:
This group of enterprising women carry the name Tajy Punta. They began in September of 2011 and currently have 15 members as they enter their fifth cycle.

One of the stories which stands out is that of Corina, who is 31 years old and a single mother of four children. She dedicates herself to making quilts and hammocks which she sells in the capital of the country, as well as other products like clothes, shoes, etc. All of her weekends, regardless of weather conditions, she dedicates herself to this work which helps her support her children and fight to give them a better future without deprivation.

She is asking for this loan to buy clothing so that she can continue selling and thus continue giving her children everything they know to grow with dignity.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo “SAN CAYETANO” es un comité de 17 mujeres que son muy bien organizadas, unidas y trabajadoras. Estas señoras son de la ciudad de Villarrica, todas son vecinas y amigas.
Silvina es la presidenta de este grupo y cuenta que todas trabajan y se esfuerzan por salir adelante, que ella también las trata de alentar para que sigan trabajando. Silvina es artesana, hace tejidos, es muy creativa y por eso sus artesanías son muy vendidas.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas de Ao Poi (tela típica paraguaya), hilos, y demás productos y así seguir haciendo sus artesanías que es su medio de subsistencia y la forma en la que ayuda a su familia.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano group is a committee of seventeen women who are well organized, united, and hardworking. These women are from the town of Villarrica. All of them are neighbors and friends.

Silvina is the president of this group and says that all of them work and make an effort to achieve, and that she also tries to encourage them so they keep working. Silvina is a craftswoman who makes woven products. She is very creative, which is why her handicrafts sell well.

She is asking for this loan for the purchase of Ao Poi fabric (a Paraguayan type of fabric), thread, and other products so that she can keep making her handicrafts, her means of subsistence and the form in which she helps her family.

loans.use: to buy Ao Poi brand cloth, thread, and more.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, four of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other family members.

She has been selling ladies' and children's clothes in a retail shop for the last five years, working seven days a week. She also has rental houses as an additional sources of income.

She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more ladies' and children's clothes to sell. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to expand her business and open a branch. She joined MCDT because it lends money in time. She stays in her husband's house with access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for ladies and children.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Abibatu K. is 37 years old and is married with three children. She has three additional dependents who live with her because they lost their parents. 

In 2000, Abibatu established her food business. Formerly, Abibatu was working on a farm. She began her business because she realized she would be able to earn more money by selling farm products in town. She operates her business six days a week and 11 hours a day. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) in order to purchase additional food stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El Comité Divino Niño Jesus esta ubicado en la ciudad de Benjamin Aceval- Chaco estan en el quinto  ciclo y conforme pasa el tiempo siguen aprendiendo y se ayudan las unas a las otras.
La  Sra Guillermina trabaja como cantinera en una escuela del barrio, por medio de este trabajo ayuda a su familia y está saliendo adelante. Su sueño es poder ir ampliando su cantina y así tener mejores ganancias para seguir ayudando a los suyos. Es una persona muy entusiasta y que quiere salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de golosinas, bebidas, yogur, comestibles y demás y así surtir su pequeña cantina.
texts.en:
The “Comité Divino Niño Jesus” is located in the city of Benjamin Aceval- Chaco and is in its fifth cycle and as time passes, the members learn more and more and continue to help one another.

Guillermina works as a food worker in a neighborhood school and helps her family get ahead in this way.  Her dream is to be able to continue to expand her canteen so that she can have better earnings and continue helping her family.  She is a very enthusiastic person who wants to get ahead.

She is asking for this loan so that she can buy snacks, drinks, yoghurt, and other foods so that she can stock her small canteen.

loans.use: to stock her canteen.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El comité San Expedito  se formó con la unión de 12 vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas, elaboración de sombreros, bebidas, etc.
Paola, quien también es parte de este grupo se dedica a la venta de bebidas, tiene todo tipo de ellas, siempre tiene muy buena venta y con ello mantiene a su familia. Comenta Paola que los fines de semana es cuando más ventas tiene, ya que siempre hay alguna actividad que reúne mucha gente y eso hace que venda mas.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas de toda clase, como ser cervezas, vinos, gaseosas, etc.
texts.en:
The “San Expedito” committee was formed by 12 neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  All of them have different businesses such as preparation and sale of fast food, hat making, drinks, etc.

Paola, who is part of the group, sells all kinds of drinks.  She makes good sales and supports her family in this way.  Paola says that she has the most sales on the weekend and there is always an activity that brings in lots of people, which increases her sales.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in drinks of all types, such as beers, wines, soft drinks, etc.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres Valientes" esta en 6º ciclo del programa comité de mujeres emprendedoras, está integrado por 17 señoras. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar en equipo, y ayudarse para poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias. El grupo lleva ese nombre ya que son mujeres valientes que salen a trabajar por un mejor futuro para sus hijos.
Una de estas mujeres es Noelia, quien por medio de su arduo esfuerzo en su peluquería ayuda a su familia. Este negocio es el que la ayuda con todos los gastos y el que le permite sentirse útil para ayudar. Noelia es una persona muy trabajadora y cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela, y lo que la ayuda es su buena predisposición y amabilidad.
Solicita de este crédito para poder surtir su peluquería con tintes, agua oxigenada, shampoo, enjuagues y demás insumos que pueda necesitar, para así seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Valientes” committee is in its sixth cycle of the committee for entrepreneurial women, made up of 17 ladies, each of who’s objective is to work together and help one another get ahead and help their families.  The group is named this way because they are brave women who work so that they can provide a better future for their children.

Noelia has a small beauty salon.  This business helps her with her expenses and she helps her family in this way.  It also makes her feel useful.  Noelia is a very hardworking woman with steady customers because of her good disposition and friendliness.

She is asking for this loan to be able to stock her salon with tints, peroxide, shampoo, rinses, and other supplies so that she can continue providing good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité La esperanza  nace mediante la gestión de una de las miembros del grupo, quien queriendo ayudar a sus amigas las invito y de allí surgió el grupo.
La Sra. Alba, es casada tiene 30 años, es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y por sobre todo muy optimista, ella se dedica a las ventas, tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Este es su medio de trabajo y con el está saliendo adelante. Solicita de este crédito para poder seguir trabajando, ya que quiere surtir su local con bebidas, panificados, verduras y demás.
Agradecen por la oportunidad que todas reciben, ya que les será de mucha ayuda el crédito.
texts.en:
The “La Esperanza” committee was born out of one of the members’ desire to help her friends, so she invited them to form this group.

Alba is 30 years old and married.  She is an enterprising, hardworking woman and above all is an optimist.  She has a small grocery store and works every day beginning early in the morning.  She gets ahead through this work and is asking for this loan so she can continue working.  She wants to stock her store with drinks, breads, vegetables, and other things.

They are grateful for this opportunity.  The loans are very helpful.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: San Pedro 2 Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Zulma quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, quienes encantadas decidieron formar su grupo y de allí nace este comité.
La Sra. Zulma es vendedora de C.D,  esta casada con el señor Juan,  y ambos trabajan y se esfuerzan para poder mantener la casa y cubrir todos los gastos que día a día surgen. Ella solicita el crédito  para la compra de mas Discos, ya sea de músicas, vídeos, películas y demás, con lo que podrá  para ir surtiendo su negocio . Zulma tiene como meta ir agrandando su negocio y  brindando así un mejor estilo de vida a su familia y también sentirse útil, pudiendo ayudar a su esposo.
texts.en:
The contact who began this committee was Zulma, who invited and organized her friends to form part of the program Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Enterprising Women) who were delighted and decided to form the group. From there this committee was born.

Zulma sells CDs and is married to a man named Juan. Together they work and make an effort to maintain their house and cover all of their costs which arise day by day. She is asking for this loan to buy more discs of music, videos, movies, and more, with which she will be able to supply her business.
